story:
Klean Kanteen / 5 Gyres Science To Solution Matching Grant Crowdsourcing Challenge! 

The 5 Gyres Institute is a globally focused nonprofit working to rid our oceans of plastic waste. To date, we've accomplished a tremendous amount towards building a future that will include plastic free oceans. Our partner, Klean Kanteen, has been a huge supporter of our mission (one of their founders even sailed with us) and this year, we'll get a dollar for dollar crowdsource match up to $15,000 from Klean Kanteen to support our 2014 programs and research.


What are we up to in 2014?

  • We are exploring, researching and documenting a never before studied oceanic gyre, The Viking Gyre, on an expedition from Bermuda to Iceland in June.
  • Creating a large scale image of plastic microbeads, sifted from personal care products, as rendered by photographer and Midway Film artist CHRIS JORDAN, to communicate the issue of microbead pollution to the public.
  • Facilitating legislation in five states to eliminate plastic microbeads from personal care products after discovering high concentrations of them in The Great Lakes. 
  • Launching a national campaign and petition to gather 200,000 signatures with supporting PSA's, infographics, share graphics, and volunteer actions to eliminate microbeads from commerce in The United States. 
  • Publishing the first ever scientifically accurate global estimate of micro-plastics in ALL the world's oceans. 
  • Building our iGyre citizen science program for volunteers to collect and add to our global estimate of plastic density, both on beaches and at sea.
  • Building curriculum + webinars + outreach materials to empower the next generation of change-makers to stop plastic at its source. 

Remember, every dollar you support us with equals two! 

Why We Need $15,000 From Our Community and What You'll Get From 5 Gyres.

  • Data collection is costly. So is analyzing that data. Your contribution to our campaign will help our Expedition gather data from a never before studied gyre in the North Atlantic.
  • We will produce a film from our Expedition for students, and the world at large, to encourage action by being armed with facts, figures and visuals from 'the garbage patch.'
  • Creating effective outreach materials (infographics, PSA's, share graphics, and visuals [including Chris Jordan's piece]) to empower our community to help eliminate microbeads from commerce is an investment in essential environmental education.
  • Expanding our Citizen Science program to gather data that serves as the basis for our action campaigns is the equivalent of financing the building blocks that drive change at a social and environmental level.

5 Gyres Impact

The nature of giving has changed, and people give to those they believe to 'be the change they want to see in the world.' 5 Gyres is one of the few nonprofits in the world that takes on the issue of plastic pollution from all angles. We gather data from places in the world that have never been researched in this manner. We use this data to publish scientific, peer-reviewed papers that serve as the basis for our education and action initiatives. This has become an extremely powerful mechanism for change. Here's what we've done so far in just four years:

  • We have sailed over 40,000 nautical miles, and are the only group to have researched the southern hemisphere gyres as well as the eastern half of the Atlantic Gyre. To fight a problem, you must first understand its scope, right? 
  • Facilitated our initial, high-level campaigns to eliminate plastic bag bans and styrofoam to-go container bans in ten major cities across the US. 
  • Stopped Coca-Cola from bullying the National Parks into being required to sell bottled water or risk losing Coke's funding.
  • Published the first ever plastic pollution survey of The Great Lakes which discovered high concentrations of plastic microbeads from personal care products. 
  • Successfully campaigned to get Unilever, Johnson & Johnson, Procter & Gamble, L'Oreal, and The Body Shop to eliminate plastic microbeads from personal care products. 
  • Shepherded a legislative bill to Ban Microbeads from personal care products that passed the California State Assembly as well as the New York State Assembly in a historic, unanimous vote.
  • Created a traveling exhibit of plastic pollution in the world to educate audiences in real time about the scope of the problem. 

Plastic Free Oceans for Everyone

It's easy to get involved in our Plastic Free Oceans Campaign, and its not all about the money.  Some people just can't contribute right now, but we still need you!

  • Help us get the word out to your network that 5 Gyres has launched an Indiegogo campaign and that it's easy to double your money with Klean Kanteen's generous matching donation.
  • Take Action on microbeads at 5gyres.org/campaigns.
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools and spread the word!
  • Want more info? Sign up to receive emails from 5 Gyres at www.5gyres.org.

Thank you for your support of 5 Gyres' Plastic Free Oceans Campaign!

story:
FINAL THOUGHTS.   As the Indiegogo campaign is finishing, I expect some of you are checking back to see what happened.  First, a huge THANK YOU to those wonderful people who have contributed.  You will be kept informed and your support gives me both the desire and obligation to make it happen. We will not give up.  So I will post no more news here, even though there is some.  You can be checking our progress at cambyocar.com.  Thanks for looking!

October 17.  The Hybrid option.   Based on costs and our own needs for a bit longer range - we live on a farm which makes a trip to town and back pushing the range limits of the pure electric - we have decided to build the first CambYo as a hybrid. See the "Updates" section for a full explanation of why, how, and why the Prius etc are NOT an example to follow for efficient hybrids!  

The hybrid option ALSO gives us cabin heat for winter use in cold climates! 

(started August 28, 2012)  This is our little electric car design, a super simple and practical electric car that can be built anywhere in the world.  Profits from developed countries support open source plans online for developing countries.  This model took me one week to build (after months of design work), so the real thing is NOT that hard to do....once you have the plans.  (note: The Reva is Indian, not Italian, I'm not sure why I said that… sorry.)

Why is our project important? 

It's important because the world needs to change, and quick.   Think about it ... since the pioneering Model T Ford of 1909 our wasteful cars have driven our wasteful energy and economic systems.  Our motto is: "To change the world, we have to change the car."   Consider that most developing countries import far more used cars than new ones, then become slaves to imported fuel and expensive imported parts.  Expensive electric cars from the big companies mean very slow change, if ever, because they will take years to "trickle down" to the masses, and replacement batteries and parts will always be expensive.  So gasoline cars will continue to glut the system for decades, unless we do something radical.  Our campaign is to change the world with a "Model T of Electric Cars" - not for everybody but for enough people to make a REAL difference.  The difference is NOT just that it is electric but that it can be built in developing countries or by individuals anywhere, independent of the petrodollar and mega-factory system that enslaves hundreds of millions of people.  CambYo Mundial, or World Change, is both our car's name and our goal, from the 99% for the 99%.  Different future versions are planned.  

Electric cars can be much simpler than gasoline or diesel cars.  Of course ours will not be for everybody at first.  If you would like an electric Tata Nano you will like our CambYo Mundial.  And if you don't tens or hundreds of millions of others will, enough to make a difference, and maybe start a revolution in power to the people. And if people in Rwanda or Nepal where we won't have patents want to build them at no profit to us, fantastic!

Why can I do it?   

I am Jesse Blenn, a 56-year-old mechanic, inventor, and vehicle designer originally from Westmoreland, Kansas, USA.   I have worked with water and electric power as well as cars, small airplanes (FAA Airframe Certificate 3240001), airships, and many other things.  You can see my resume under the "Gallery" tab, at the bottom.   You can contact me at jesseblenn@gmail.com.   Here are some of several  projects I have worked on:

     

 

 

My forte is designing and making simple things that work, and I see both the need and business potential to make an affordable electric car that can be made in any good shop. I am fluent in Spanish and live in Costa Rica, which really needs cheap electric vehicles, has renewable hydroelectric power available, and has the very ambitious but up-to-now unrealistic goal of being carbon neutral by 2021. They will never make it without help, so let’s do it.  If we succeed we can be an example to change the world, and if you personally want to build a simple and affordable electric car you can, and you can also own part of the company if you choose. 

As a full time student the last five years (Troy University Bsc in Business Admin, Magna Cum Laude October 2011) I don´t have savings available for this project. I have dedicated a lot of my time since graduation to this project. We need your help, but not your free help rewarded by your name on some plaque or website and a t-shirt.  You too can have access to all the information you need to build your car (let me make the mistakes and correct them first!). If we can get the expected CR government grants (average 65% of prototype cost) it will multiply up to 200% the effect of the help you give us, and thus help it happen sooner.  

Financials.

Toyota and others spend hundreds of millions to develop a new car.  We don't need even hundreds of thousands of dollars because if we did it would mean that we have failed from the start.   

Our next steps are to build a full-size mockup to be sure everything about the Mundial is user-friendly, adapt our large carport for some serious work while we begin serious construction, and work on our business plan, for which we will be getting realistic numbers. From my experience with small airplanes I know about half the cost of the first vehicle will be parts and about half is labor. (both will be less in production).  I can work for $15 per hour, my helpers for about half that, and you will have updates to show where the money goes.  Our materials will be about $10,000 (much less later in quantity purchases) and the labor will realistically be more than that for the first one once we include testing, jig construction etc.

Our cost of production should be under $10,000 and we hope that in production dealers can sell the Mundial for about $12 to $15,000 in Costa Rica, where cars both new and used are more expensive than say the US. We expect the CR government to be good customers due a law that favors their use of electric cars (they have several Revas).  Our small company is now legal and is called Asesorias para el Desarrollo or ASPADE.  This startup company belongs to my wife's family, I am in charge of design and English communications.  Our president will finish the business plan as part of a course in the National University starting in January.  ASPADE will handle the financial and managerial aspects, including fulfilling our obligations to you to deliver on our promises.  We plan to set up the first factory as part of a local cooperative, with ASPADE in charge of technical development and international promotions, as well as kits and international sales.

What if we don't reach our goal?  

October 17.  Those of you who are watching our project will see that unless some miracle happens we will not reach our goal.   That does NOT kill the project, but does slow it down. Our hope is to be able to have me (Jesse) work full time on the project, but I will continue to work part time.  I see our next step of developing our own super simple brushless motor as extremely important to the project, and it could revoluitionize DC motors and finance the project.  We will have first results before November first.  In the end, we will likely launch a CambYo Stage 2 on Indiegogo, with more results to show from the start, and likely open to investors once the US relaxes its limits.  

(previous) If we don´t reach the entire goal we will definitely finish design and start construction because these can inspire a positive reaction to our application to the CR government grant (January or February 2013) that will likely let us complete the project. They even contacted us to make sure we knew that they have grant money available, which is a very positive sign.  We will be openly sharing design information with you along the way.

A little more about the car....

Many features are described in the video, and some are patentable so are not public including especially some aspects of the front suspension and motors.   Others will be only for those who contribute, and once we are positive that they are the best they can be!  Two curves plus straight tubes make up the unibody of welded square tubes and curved sheets, tested for rigidity to be as good as or better than other small cars (2000 or more foot-lbs per degree of torsional deflection). A major key to its simplicity is the fact that it starts with two flat frames to define the basic shape, and there are no flat sheets over 2 feet wide in the car – simplifying the tools and materials needs greatly.

Because we have a central battery pack, we have a separate smaller electric motor driving each rear wheel through a chain drive and that means: no clutch, no differential, no normal transmission, and that one motor can fail and the car can still make it home.  Motor controls are under the trunk floor, and we plan some neat innovations in motor design and control (I enjoy winding motors!). Definitely axial flux PM is the way to go for simplicity, local manufacture, and highest efficiency.  Our prototype may or may not have off-the-shelf motors depending on time and funding.

 Thanks for reading!

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS

Style                        Two door, 3+3 seating

Construction               Square steel tube, aluminum sheet, welded and glued

Drive                        Rear via independent motors with chain reduction

Empty Weight             650 kg (1430 lbs) estimated

Max Gross Wt             900 kg (1980 lbs) 

Top Speed                  90 kph (56 mph) continuous

Range                       50 to 80 km (30 to 50 miles) (more with Li batteries)

Length                      3.0 meters (9 ft 10 in)

Width                       1.55 meters (5 ft 1 in)

Height                      1.55 meters (5 ft 1 in) (plus mirrors)

Wheelbase                2.0 meters (6 ft 6 3/4 in)

Ground Clear             0.2 meter (8 in)

Track F/R                 1.3 meters (4 ft 3 in)

Roll Center Ht           75 mm(3 in) /100 mm (4 in) front/rear

Effective Swing Arm   2.5 m (98.4 in) /1.85 m (72.8 in) front/rear

Turning Radius           3.9 meters (12 ft 9 1/2 in)

Trunk Capacity           0.6 cubic meter (35 cubic feet)

Brakes                     Disk, with regenerative braking

Suspension               Air springs, patented mechanism

Tires                       12 inch 

Motor Power              2 x 10 kW = 20 kW (27 hp) total @ 48 volts

Batteries (lead acid)   Eight 12-volt, deep cycle, 100 amp-hour (Four in Hybrid)

Battery Capacity        10 kiloWatt hours (5 kWh Hybrid option)

Charge Time             5 hours from 80% discharge, 110 Volts, 20 Amps

Battery exchange       Three minutes

Air Conditioning         Optional, excellent ventilation

Other Versions          Four wheel drive, pickup

HYBRID OPTION      Four batteries, small 5-8 hp gasoline or propane engine                             

Hybrid benefits         Same cost, lighter weight, extended range, 75-100 mpg

story:
COMPANY SUMMARY

Our effort began 4 years ago specifically for the purpose of promoting the unique attributes of several key energy crops with sustainable competitive advantages in combined agricultural, and energy production operations throughout the South Pacific.

Our projects are focused on providing highly efficient feed stock for renewable energy, co-generation facilities in South Pacific Island nations in dire need.

Our energy crops are non GMO; they are NOT genetically modified.  They are selectively bred, perfected over years of trial and selection.  In general, they have attributes such as:

  • Short crop cycles
  • Low input costs
  • Low water & fertilization necessity
  • Very high dry mass harvest yields
  • Serve as excellent rotation crops
  • Very efficient conversion ratios for energy production
  • Can thrive on marginal land



PROJECT                                                   

We have 2 energy crops, and carbohydrate rich root crops. All are non-GMO; they are selectively bred, NOT genetically modified.

We have a spectacular and immediate opportunity to introduce 2 key energy crops right NOW!  If we can act quickly enough, we can have crops growing to produce biomass feed stock this season, for the production of clean, green, renewable energy before year end in existing power facilities!  .... but the window is closing for this season.

The project scope is simple; get these crops formally into countries in the South Pacific, and to growers. In order to do so, we must clear the Bio-Security Office compliance requirements, and complete a minimal sized, successful field trial growth of the crops in the rich indigenous soil.

We need YOUR energy to make it happen!  Crowd funding seemed the best way to move quickly, and to demonstrate the power of the will for the greater good if the cause is righteous!

The use of funds raised is 100% for:

  • Bio-Security requirements compliance
  • Arranging seed, & seed pod, & monitoring personnel
  • Trial costs, crop input costs for approximately 50 acres


MISSION

100% of the group is dedicated, and devoted to the empowerment of the South Pacific Island Nations, and the proud people of these nations. Our mission is to bring to an end historic dependence on imports, particularly fossil fuels WHICH ARE POISONING the indigenous populations.  The corporate suppliers and oil companies of these fossil fuels have enjoyed a stranglehold on these nations we wish to break!  Our goal is to increase efficiencies in energy production and output while also providing sustainable new cash crops for an entire generation of farmers and growers whose livelihoods are literally dying in 3rd world economic environments.

Join us!
story_txt:
COMPANY SUMMARY
Our effort began 4 years ago specifically for the purpose of promoting the unique attributes of several key energy crops with sustainable competitive advantages in combined agricultural, and energy production operations throughout the South Pacific.Our projects are focused on providing highly efficient feed stock for renewable energy, co-generation facilities in South Pacific Island nations in dire need.
Our energy crops are non GMO; they are NOT genetically modified.  They are selectively bred, perfected over years of trial and selection.  In general, they have attributes such as:

Short crop cycles
Low input costs
Low water & fertilization necessity
Very high dry mass harvest yields
Serve as excellent rotation crops
Very efficient conversion ratios for energy production
Can thrive on marginal land

PROJECT                                                   

We have 2 energy crops, and carbohydrate rich root crops. All are non-GMO; they are selectively bred, NOT genetically modified.
We have a spectacular and immediate opportunity to introduce 2 key energy crops right NOW!  If we can act quickly enough, we can have crops growing to produce biomass feed stock this season, for the production of clean, green, renewable energy before year end in existing power facilities!  .... but the window is closing for this season.
The project scope is simple; get these crops formally into countries in the South Pacific, and to growers. In order to do so, we must clear the Bio-Security Office compliance requirements, and complete a minimal sized, successful field trial growth of the crops in the rich indigenous soil.
We need YOUR energy to make it happen!  Crowd funding seemed the best way to move quickly, and to demonstrate the power of the will for the greater good if the cause is righteous!
The use of funds raised is 100% for:

Bio-Security requirements compliance
Arranging seed, & seed pod, & monitoring personnel
Trial costs, crop input costs for approximately 50 acres
MISSION100% of the group is dedicated, and devoted to the empowerment of the South Pacific Island Nations, and the proud people of these nations. Our mission is to bring to an end historic dependence on imports, particularly fossil fuels WHICH ARE POISONING the indigenous populations.  The corporate suppliers and oil companies of these fossil fuels have enjoyed a stranglehold on these nations we wish to break!  Our goal is to increase efficiencies in energy production and output while also providing sustainable new cash crops for an entire generation of farmers and growers whose livelihoods are literally dying in 3rd world economic environments.
Join us!

story:
About the Bamboo Center

The Bamboo Center has been training young men and women from rural communities to manufacture several types of products out of bamboo. The time has now come where the Center is constrained by its capacity and thus cannot meet demand for its products. The Center has current capacity to make 12 bamboo bikes per month, but has the potential to ship 30 bamboo bikes per month based on confirmed buyer interest. $2,000 will provide the essential funding to purchase the necessary equipment and supplies to service this unmet demand. If we can raise in excess of this amount, the funds will allow further equipment purchases to facilitate a broadened product range beyond bikes, handbags, placemats, purses and sandals to other marketable products.

Our Desired Impact

Expanding production capacity serves our two ultimate goals. Firstly, it will provide greater employment opportunities for rural youth who are struggling to break out of the cycle of poverty. They will be taught a trade and benefit from secure employment and steady income. Secondly, it allows us to generate greater profits from the Center to support and expand educational development programsfor children in the community and thus make us less reliant on donor funding for those initiatives. These educational development programs help to ensure that children in the community can attend school and maximize their potential to secure employment as adults.

Why Bamboo?

Bamboo is incredibly strong, light and eco-friendly. It is one of the fastest growing plants in the world and requires no fertilizers or pesticides. Bamboo promotes sustainable living. We have our own bamboo plantation and this ensures that we have an abundant supply of raw materials to process once we have the necessary equipment and supplies.

The Perks on Offer

As a way to thank those who donate we are offering our quality bamboo products as perks. You’ll get to enjoy our products while knowing you’ve helped to grow our organization and directly benefit our community!

Donors can choose among the following perks;

-          $15 gets a bamboo purse

-          $25 gets four bamboo placements

-          $30 gets a bamboo bag

-          $50 gets a bamboo hand bag and placemats

-          $100 gets a bamboo hand bag, placemats and a purse

-          $500 gets a bamboo bicycle Frame

All perks will be shipped to donors as quickly as practicable.

My Passion for the Yonso Project

I am a young social entrepreneur whose primary focus is to create educational and economic opportunities for the youth, women and children in the rural communities I grew up in. I have dedicated the last 7 years of my life to breaking the cycle of poverty that permeates rural communities in Ghana. With the generous support of volunteers and donors, the Yonso Project has provided scholarships and educational assistance to children, microfinance to female entrepreneurs and training and employment to youths. We have ambitious goals to grow the organization and its impact exponentially over the coming years and with that hopefully become fully self-sustaining.

 

Through the Yonso Project, I was fortunate to win the 2012 edition of Airtel Touching Lives as well as the Ghana National Youth Achievers Award for grass root and rural community development. It was humbling to be recognized nationally for work done to improve my community.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help raise awareness for our cause by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. We need all the support we can get! Should you have any other ideas or be interested in helping in any other way please do not hesitate to contact me.

Thank You

We greatly appreciate your support. Your contribution will positively impact the lives of the youths and children in our communities. We look forward to providing with you updates on our progress and forging a lasting relationship with you.

story:
for the english version please scroll down!
 
Cos'è il CROWDFUNDING.

Il Crowdfunding è un modo per raccogliere fondi da destinare ad un progetto. Semplice ed efficace e da l'opportunita a chi investe di contribuire direttamente alla salvaguardia delle api.

Come partecipare. 

Clicca su una delle ricompense a destra. Paypal non è necessario! Se non aveste Paypal, basta possedere una carta di credito o debito. Qualora non riusciste a procedere con le precedenti opzioni è anche possibile versare un bonifico sull'IBAN IT21D0316901600CC0010736849 indicando come beneficiario Riccardo Balzaretti, come causale "Donazione per 3Bee: Hive-Tech for bee research" ed infine inserendo nella descrizione il perk per cui avete donato.

Una volta eseguito il bonifico inviate il codice della transazione a info@3bee.eu in modo tale da avere anche il vostro indirizzo mail per contattarvi successivamente.

Per informazioni più dettagliate, scrivete a info@3bee.eu

3Bee è il primo progetto italiano nato dall'idea di 3 ricercatori per la salvaguardia degli alveari e la protezione dell'ambiente. Precisamente, il progetto 3Bee comprende la realizzazione di un dispositivo elettronico per il monitoraggio degli alveari di apis mellifera. Il dispositivo permetterà di interpretare i bisogni delle api, ascoltando suoni, odori, temperatura, umidità dell'alveare. Il nostro obiettivo è di rivoluzionare l'apicoltura al fine di trovare nuove cure per aiutare le api!​

E' troppo difficile donare qui? la pagina ti spaventa? Scriveteci info@3bee.eu

 

AD OGNI DONAZIONE...

 

...LA GIUSTA RICOMPENSA

Un buonissimo vasetto di miele Italiano di Cardo

 

2 Vasetti di miele Italiano, in una magifica confezione di legno. La scritta a laser sulla confezione seglila tu. Quando comporrai il puzzle guarda la sorpresa!

 

Monitora una delle arnie Hi-Tech 3Bee. Un apicoltore in tutta italia installerà il nostro dispositivo e tu comodamente da casa potrai guardare i progressi delle api e il loro stato di salute. Finita la stagione apistica potrai riscuotere il tuo miele a un prezzo conveniente! Questo è il primo sistema al mondo che mette in contatto diretto il consumatore con il prodotto.

                            

Visita in apiario! Hai mai voluto entrare in contatto con le api? Hai mai pensato di indossare una tuta gialle e toccare con mano il miele caldo? A fine giornata, inoltre, potrai goderti il miglior miele italiano, assieme a un degustatore professionista.

 

                      

Il Problema

Biodiversity warning!!!

 Le api non solo contribuiscono quotidianamente a preservare e propagare molteplici specie vegetali, ma ci riforniscono di preziosissimi prodotti quali miele, propoli, cera e polline. 

Moria delle api

Negli ultimi anni l’integrità delle colonie di api è stata sempre più minacciata da molti fattori sia naturali che antropici. In molti stati europei la mortalità delle api ha superato il 50%! 

 

Pesticidi: sono veramente così pericolosi?

Certamente! Tutte le sostanze chimiche disperse nell’ambiente possono venire in contatto con le api. Bottinando nettare e polline, le api possono trasportare e accumulare molte di queste sostanze all’interno del proprio alveare causando il collasso improvviso dell’intero alveare (Colony Collapse Disorder).

Trattamenti chimici per arginare parassiti e batteri

Prima dell’arrivo in Italia dell’acaro Varroa Destructor (1981), in apicoltura erano veramente pochi i casi in cui era richiesto l’utilizzo di trattramenti chimici. Ora in commercio esistono prodotti chimici per combattere la varroatosi, ormai indispensabile per la sopravvivenza dell'alveare. Oltre a questi prodotti, vi sono anche quelli antibiotici utilizzati per far fronte ad infezioni batteriche. Nonostante molti di questi composti siano severamente vietati in Unione Europea a causa dell’ingente quantità di residui chimici rinvenuti nella cera e nel miele, in numerosi paesi extra UE sono ammessi!

Miele commerciale: importato, non certificato ed inquinato

Vi siete mai soffermati a leggere le etichette del miele che comprate al supermercato? Se non vi è mai capitato, provateci. Vi stupirà leggere quanto del miele che mettiamo sulle nostre tavole proviene da paesi esteri dove la regolamentazione è molto permissiva. Quello che ne risulta è un miele di scarsa qualità la cui origine non può essere né tracciata né garantita  Non tutto il miele fa bene! State attenti!

 

LA SOLUZIONE

Il progetto 3Bee

3Bee è un progetto realizzato da un gruppo di giovani ricercatori provenienti dai campi più disparati: dall’elettronica quantistica alle nanobiotecnologie. Grazie alla fusione delle nostre abilità con le nostre passioni, è nato il progetto Hive-Tech di 3Bee. La nostra missione è quella di salvaguardare la vita delle api attraverso la realizzazione di un dispositivo elettronico equipaggiato con sensori all'avanguardia per il monitoraggio degli alveari di Apis Mellifera. Nello specifico, permette il controllo da remoto dello stato di salute delle api e consente di monitorare: l’attività di bottinaggio, l’andamento della covata, la presenza della regina, l’imminente sciamatura, la quantità di scorta e l’insorgenza di malattie. 

Inoltre, al consumatore proponiamo una nuova piattaforma eCommerce all'insegna della più completa trasparenza e tracciabilità su cui potrà acquistare dagli apiari convenzionati 3Bee svariati prodotti dell’alveare come miele, cera, propoli etc.

I nostri sensori

E-HAND­­

Comprende 2 tipologie di sensori: il primo per la rilevazione della temperatura e umidità interne all'alveare e il secondo per la misurazione dell'incremento ponderale dell’arnia (bilancia).

Con il primo sensore si potrà avere una panoramica sullo stato di salute dell'alveare. Con il secondo si andrà, invece, a monitorare produttività, necessità e gravi incidenti nell’alveare.

E-NOSE

Costituito da sensori per la rilevazione della qualità dell’aria, ossigeno, anidride carbonica. In analogia a quanto svolto per altre tipologie di allevamenti animali sono il primo strumento di allarme nel caso di malattie e virosi.

 

E-EAR

Al dispositivo sono collegati alcuni microfoni ottimizzati per l’acquisizione dell’emissione sonora dei suoni dell’alveare. Il dispositivo permette di acquisire l’intensità e lo spettro sonoro delle vibrazioni delle api, comprese tra 50 Hz fino a 600 Hz. Grazie al linguaggio sonoro delle api sarà possibile prevedere la sciamatura delle api con largo anticipo nonché ascoltare la nascita di nuove regine.

 

E-EYE

Il dispositivo è dotato di sensori capaci di analizzare l’intensità e lo spettro luminoso della luce ambientale. Grazie a tale sensore sarà possibile valutare l'influenza dello spettro luminoso sull'attività bottinatrice delle api.

 

PROTEGGI ANCHE TU LA

SOPRAVVIVENZA DELLE API

Aiutaci a:

          installare in Italia i primi 100 Hive-Tech;

       creare una solida rete tra ricercatori, apicoltori e consumatori;

     valorizzare e promuovere​ i prodotti dell'alveare made in Italy.

 

 

 

 

RINGRAZIAMO:

  • Federica Savio (Kikka) per il Loghi;
  • Giovanni Jacopo Gianella per l'aiuto in apiario;
  • Mauro Buttafava per il supporto nel design hardware;
  • Flavio Dinon (Pepe) per la parte meccanica.

 

https://vimeo.com/185134435

English Version

3Bee is an innovative Italian project developed by three Italian researchers for the protection of the Hives and the related environment. More specifically, the 3Bee project concerns the construction of an electronic device for monitoring the Hives of Apis mellifera. The device will monitor the bees’ needs by checking temperature, humidity, smell of such Hives. 3Bee’s revolutionary goal is to find new treatments to counter-act the massive bee die-off

The problem

Biodiversity warning!!

Bees not only contribute daily to preserve and propagate many plants, but supply us with valuable products such as honey, propolis, wax and pollen. 

Deaths of bees

In recent years the integrity of bee colonies has been increasingly threatened by many factors, both natural and human. In many European bee mortality has exceeded 50%! 

Pesticides: are really so dangerous?

Of course! All chemical substances released into the environment may come into contact with bees. Bottinando nectar and pollen, bees can carry and accumulate many of these substances inside their hives causing the sudden collapse of the entire hive (Colony Collapse Disorder).

Chemical treatments to stem parasits and bacteria

Before the arrival in Italy of the mite Varroa Destructor (1981), in beekeeping were very few cases where it was necessary to use chemical trattramenti. Now in the market there are chemicals to combat varroamite disease now essential for the survival of the hive. In addition to these products, there are also those antibiotics used to cope with bacterial infections. Although many of these compounds are strictly prohibited in the European Union due to the vast amount of chemical residues found in the wax and honey, in many non-EU countries are allowed!

The solution: The project 3Bee

E-HAND

It includes 2 types of sensors: the first for the detection of the temperature and moisture internal to the hive and the second for the measurement of the increase in weight of the beehive (balance). With the first sensor you can get an overview on the state of health of the hive. With the second it will go, instead, to monitor productivity, necessity and serious accidents in the hive.

E-NOSE

It consists of sensors for the detection of air quality, oxygen, dioxide carbon. In analogy to what is done for other types of animal farms are the first alarm instrument in the case of diseases and virus diseases.

E-EAR

The device are connected some microphones optimized for the acquisition of EM ission sound of beehive sounds. The device allows you to capture the intensity and the sound spectrum of the vibration of the bees, ranging from 50 Hz to 600 Hz. The sound language of the bees will be able to predict the swarming of bees well in advance as well as listen to the birth of new queens.

E-EYE

The device is equipped with sensors capable of analyzing the intensity and spectrum of ambient light. Thanks to this sensor will be able to evaluate the influence of the light spectrum foraging activity of bees.

The Team

Niccolo Calandri is an electrical engineer, a doctoral student at the Politecnico di Milano. Niccolo says “I realized in collaboration with MIT and NASA cryogenic optical systems for satellite applications. With this knowledge I am developing for 3Bee an ultra innovative system for the protection of bees.”

 

Riccardo Balzaretti is a biologist, beekeeper and PhD student of the University 'Insubria. Riccardo says “For some years I am passionate about the fascinating world of beekeeping. I deal, for 3Bee, the development of predictive algortmi in order to improve the health of the hive.”

 

Eliah Nipoti, food technologist and gourments. He is passionate about the analysis of the dynamics of the food industry. He manages the quality 'of service and of 3Bee processes.

Rewards

Adopt a Hive-Tech

You will adopt one of the Future Hi-Tech Beehive installed all over Italy and Europe. Special discount of the next year honey!  

Save a Bee

Thank you publicly on their Facebook page 3Bee! 

Bee Sweet

 3 x 375g jars of sweet Italian honey 

Bee a Bee 

Visit the apiary and tasting their honey

Honey-Puzzle Box

 A sweet puzzle and honey gadget.

Costituito da sensori per la rilevazione della qualità dell’aria, ossigeno, anidride carbonica. In analogia a quanto svolto per altre tipologie di allevamenti animali sono il primo strumento di allarme nel caso di malattie e virosi.
 
E-EAR
Al dispositivo sono collegati alcuni microfoni ottimizzati per l’acquisizione dell’emissione sonora dei suoni dell’alveare. Il dispositivo permette di acquisire l’intensità e lo spettro sonoro delle vibrazioni delle api, comprese tra 50 Hz fino a 600 Hz. Grazie al linguaggio sonoro delle api sarà possibile prevedere la sciamatura delle api con largo anticipo nonché ascoltare la nascita di nuove regine.
 
E-EYE
Il dispositivo è dotato di sensori capaci di analizzare l’intensità e lo spettro luminoso della luce ambientale. Grazie a tale sensore sarà possibile valutare l'influenza dello spettro luminoso sull'attività bottinatrice delle api.
 

PROTEGGI ANCHE TU LA 

SOPRAVVIVENZA DELLE API

Aiutaci a:
          installare in Italia i primi 100 Hive-Tech;
       creare una solida rete tra ricercatori, apicoltori e consumatori;
     valorizzare e promuovere​ i prodotti dell'alveare made in Italy.
 
 
 

 
RINGRAZIAMO:

Federica Savio (Kikka) per il Loghi;
Giovanni Jacopo Gianella per l'aiuto in apiario;
Mauro Buttafava per il supporto nel design hardware;
Flavio Dinon (Pepe) per la parte meccanica.

 
https://vimeo.com/185134435
English Version

3Bee is an innovative Italian project developed by three Italian researchers for the protection of the Hives and the related environment. More specifically, the 3Bee project concerns the construction of an electronic device for monitoring the Hives of Apis mellifera. The device will monitor the bees’ needs by checking temperature, humidity, smell of such Hives. 3Bee’s revolutionary goal is to find new treatments to counter-act the massive bee die-off

The problem
Biodiversity warning!!
Bees not only contribute daily to preserve and propagate many plants, but supply us with valuable products such as honey, propolis, wax and pollen. 
Deaths of bees
In recent years the integrity of bee colonies has been increasingly threatened by many factors, both natural and human. In many European bee mortality has exceeded 50%! 
Pesticides: are really so dangerous?
Of course! All chemical substances released into the environment may come into contact with bees. Bottinando nectar and pollen, bees can carry and accumulate many of these substances inside their hives causing the sudden collapse of the entire hive (Colony Collapse Disorder).
Chemical treatments to stem parasits and bacteria
Before the arrival in Italy of the mite Varroa Destructor (1981), in beekeeping were very few cases where it was necessary to use chemical trattramenti. Now in the market there are chemicals to combat varroamite disease now essential for the survival of the hive. In addition to these products, there are also those antibiotics used to cope with bacterial infections. Although many of these compounds are strictly prohibited in the European Union due to the vast amount of chemical residues found in the wax and honey, in many non-EU countries are allowed!
The solution: The project 3Bee

E-HAND
It includes 2 types of sensors: the first for the detection of the temperature and moisture internal to the hive and the second for the measurement of the increase in weight of the beehive (balance). With the first sensor you can get an overview on the state of health of the hive. With the second it will go, instead, to monitor productivity, necessity and serious accidents in the hive.
E-NOSE
It consists of sensors for the detection of air quality, oxygen, dioxide carbon. In analogy to what is done for other types of animal farms are the first alarm instrument in the case of diseases and virus diseases.
E-EAR
The device are connected some microphones optimized for the acquisition of EM ission sound of beehive sounds. The device allows you to capture the intensity and the sound spectrum of the vibration of the bees, ranging from 50 Hz to 600 Hz. The sound language of the bees will be able to predict the swarming of bees well in advance as well as listen to the birth of new queens.
E-EYE
The device is equipped with sensors capable of analyzing the intensity and spectrum of ambient light. Thanks to this sensor will be able to evaluate the influence of the light spectrum foraging activity of bees.

The Team

Niccolo Calandri is an electrical engineer, a doctoral student at the Politecnico di Milano. Niccolo says “I realized in collaboration with MIT and NASA cryogenic optical systems for satellite applications. With this knowledge I am developing for 3Bee an ultra innovative system for the protection of bees.”
 
Riccardo Balzaretti is a biologist, beekeeper and PhD student of the University 'Insubria. Riccardo says “For some years I am passionate about the fascinating world of beekeeping. I deal, for 3Bee, the development of predictive algortmi in order to improve the health of the hive.”
 
Eliah Nipoti, food technologist and gourments. He is passionate about the analysis of the dynamics of the food industry. He manages the quality 'of service and of 3Bee processes.
Rewards
Adopt a Hive-Tech
You will adopt one of the Future Hi-Tech Beehive installed all over Italy and Europe. Special discount of the next year honey!  
Save a Bee
Thank you publicly on their Facebook page 3Bee! 
Bee Sweet
 3 x 375g jars of sweet Italian honey 
Bee a Bee 
Visit the apiary and tasting their honey
Honey-Puzzle Box
 A sweet puzzle and honey gadget.

story:
Short Summary

Indian Point, a three-unit nuclear power plant 25 miles north of New York City, first opened in 1962. The original reactor was decommissioned in 1974. On midnight, December 12, 2015, the last federal operating 40-year license for the remaining two expired. That morning, several dozen concerned citizens held "caution" tape across the entrance of the plant to draw attention to the danger to 20 million people living in a 50-mile radius caused by the continued operation of the problem-plagued plant. We were all asked to move. The eleven of us who held fast to the tape were arrested.

Our arraignment is scheduled for the Buchanan Village Court on Tuesday, March 8th. We plan to plead guilty to the charge of disorderly conduct. 

What We Need 

We have hired an attorney who is charging a modest fee to represent us as a group in the courtroom on March 8th. In addition, we expect that we will each need to pay individual fines for the disorderly conduct charge.  We are are asking for your help in raising a total of $2,500-3,000 to cover these expenses.

If we are able to raise more funds than we need to cover the court costs, the extra money will be donated to the Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition (IPSEC), which has been working to close Indian Point since 2001, and to the Stony Point Convergence, which has worked with us to close the plant since shortly after the 2011 earthquake, tsunami and meltdown struck the nuclear power plant in Fukushima, Japan.  Excess funds will also be used for scholarships to committed anti-nuclear activists to attend the SAFE ENERGY CONFERENCE we are organizing titled, END NUCLEAR POWER NOW!  at the Stony Point Conference Center in Rockland County, NY that is scheduled from Friday night, April 29 - Sunday May 1. For more detailed info about this summit, go to:

http://stonypointcenter.org/events-retreats/upcoming-events#.Vt1kgfkrLIU 

The Impact

You can help us make a statement to Entergy (Indian Point's owner) and to the federal Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) that even if they don't care about the health and safety of the 20 million people in the 50-mile radius, we do.  Governor Cuomo has called for Indian Point’s closure; the New York Department of Environmental Conservation has refused to give Entergy a permit to draw from the Hudson River the 2.5 billion gallons of water they need to operate and cool the reactors each day. Congresswoman Nita Lowey has expressed her concern about the aging nuclear plant sitting one mile from the intersection of two fault lines in her Congressional district. 

Why are the NRC and Entergy waiting to address the many safety issues of this aging plant?  Help us, the #IndianPt11, get their attention by making a donation before our court appearance. Together, we can help our officials find the political will to close Indian Point before there are any more accidents that release radioactive materials and pollute our groundwater.   

You can find more information about this urgent safety issue at:

http://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/17/opinion/is-indian-point-the-next-fukushima.html,

http://fortune.com/2016/02/28/indian-point-end-of-nuclear-age/,

http://www.lohud.com/story/news/politics/politics-on-the-hudson/2016/02/29/cuomo-halt-algonquin-pipeline-cites-indian-point/81102566/,

http://www.commondreams.org/news/2015/04/16/new-film-indian-point-explores-nuclear-power-age-fukushima and 

http://www.lohud.com/story/news/local/indian-point/2015/11/12/indian-point-state-deniescertificate-hudson-river-use/75652684/. 

Risks & Challenges

The lights will not go out and the trains will not stop running when Indian Point closes. Replacement power for Indian Point is already on-line. The New York State Department of State has determined there is no need for Indian Point’s electricity and the Public Service Commission is questioning whether Indian Point is needed.

The NRC and Entergy have not operated Indian Point safely. Radioactive leaks continue to pollute the Hudson River and groundwater. The threat of earthquake damage, continuing destruction of the Hudson River habitat for fish and river life, and continued leaks of radioactive water into the ground water are a clear and present danger.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get out the word by posting a link to this call on your websites, facebook pages and tweets. Join us, if you can, at the press conference preceding our arraignment: 3:15 on Tuesday, March 8th at the Buchanan Village Courthouse, 236 Tate Avenue, Buchanan, NY. (If you can come, please let us know by leaving a message at 888-474-8848.)

Get involved! Check out https://closeindianpoint.wordpress.com/ for upcoming events, join Facebook groups: https://www.facebook.com/CLOSEINDIANPOINT/?fref... and SHUT DOWN INDIAN POINT NUCLEAR PLANT.

Thanks very much for helping to make the New York City and tri-state area safer for the 20 million people who live here.

story:
Disclaimer- The views and opinions expressed through this independent fundraising campaign do not necessarily represent those of the  San Juan Ridge Taxpayer Association nonprofit organization.

Short Summary

The San Juan Ridge Mine opened under the name Siskon Mine in the early 1990's.  After a short 1.5 years of operation it struck a major vertical water fissure, releasing an excess of 4 million gallons of groundwater per day,  dewatering many of the surrounding area's wells-- including the one for the local elementary school--, and carving local drainages down to bedrock with high pressure discharge.

 Many of those wells affected are still contaminated beyond safe drinkingwater levels, and the school still pays several thousands of dollars annually to treat the water for its students.  

This painful event left the surrounding natural ecosystems degraded from the inundation with mine discharge,  property values lowered by as much as 75%, school children without a proper well on site, and took the Siskon Mining Corp. itself to total bankruptcy.

NOW-- renamed the San Juan Mining Coropration-- the SAME people are proposing to reopend the SAME mine in the SAME place, using the SAME methods of extraction.     Expecting a different outcome is the very definition of insanity!

The Impact

Within the proposal for the mine's reopening is a request for permits to use 3.5 million gallons of water per day, to use in hydraulic gold extraction. That is more than 1/3 of Nevada County's total daily water usage, pumped from the aquifer, turned into toxic slurry, and dumped into local creeks and drainages not designed to handle this tuantity of inflow.  

This is an extrememly short-sighted proposal with a mindset in the dark-ages.  In today's changing world, Water is More Precious Than Gold.  

There is no justifying pumping the pure lifeblood of this area out of the ground in order to line the pockets of a few CEO's and shareholders, and at the expense of an entire community.

--------------------------------------------------------

Contributions to this campaign will go to the San Juan Ridge Taxpayers Association, a local grassroots organization who's mission is to protect our community's resources and way of life from corporate mining interests.

Your most-appreciated contributions will go towards:

  • Hiring scientists to conduct geology, hydrology, and ecology surveys which will produce valuable data we need to present the case of the mine's potential harm.
  • Keeping the print and media campaign alive and in the public eye, so the Board of Supervisors knows this issue is important to its constituents.
  • Hiring expert Environmental Impact Report legal representation in the event this proposal is passed and needs to be appealed in court.

I would like to point out the bullet #2-- keeping this issue alive and in the public eye is maybe the most important thing to remember right now.  The Board of Supervisors will be reviewing the Environmental Impact Report this summer and making its decision.  We need to let them know WE ARE WATCHING. 

Let's make this campaign 120% funded to make a statement of how important this is to us!

Other Ways You Can Help

Blast this thing all over the internet!

Share this campaign!

Like my facebookpage:  www.facebook.com/waterismorepreciousthangold

-- this will be HQ for all updates pertaining to the mine, a way for us to spread awareness far and wide,  and BONUS travelogue videos from me from the road as I cycle from Seattle to San Diego!

 

Thank you so much for contributing to the fight!

story:
Can't help with money? Help us get the word out there and consider sharing this campaign with your friends!


In short: "What do I need the money for?"

The money is needed to fund my dream and mission of educating more people throughout South & Central America about the many uses of hemp!


Who I am & what I do

Hello

My name is Barbara Crazy Diamond, B.Crazy for short.

I am owner and operator of the Sew Much Hemp shop in Hopkins, Belize. 

Everyday, I educate people from around the world about the many uses of hemp, both as medicine and as material. 


The story behind my cream

I was still in Eugene, Oregon and part of the Sow Much Hemp shop there and I was also part of a group that was able to convince Canada to grow hemp in the 90's. For the first time, we now had cold pressed hemp oil that came from fresh seeds and not from sterilized seeds which lose their nutrition value. I then decided that I wanted to make a hemp moisturizing cream and started a research for the following two years. This led to the formula I still use today, 17 years later. Since then, I have learned my cream heals anything wrong with the skin - from wrinkles to eczema, rosacea, psoriasis, sunburn, bug bites, open wounds & even a brown recluse spider bite is no match for this cream.

Belize is a land of sun and bugs and my cream offers natural sun protection and soothing relief from sunburn or bug bites. In addition, it kills germs to favor the healing of the skin. My cream is made out of 25% hemp oil with a combination of other oils for the best results. By changing the essence oils, I also offer a natural bug repel that in addition includes sun protection


What I need the money for

My ultimate goals are to raise enough money to be able to produce more cream, sell it throughout the world and continue my journey of hemp education throughout Central and South America.
In short: 
  • Expand my business
  • Travel Central and South America
  • Educate even more people about the uses of hemp

Why I went to Belize, Central America

Belize is a small country in Central America, a true jewel by the Carribean Sea. People come here from all over the world for diving and snorkeling at the second largest reef in the world.

Belize is where I have lived and worked for the last 16 years, in a small village next to the Carribean Sea called Hopkins.

People ask me all the time, what brought me to Belize?

The simple answer is, that I work for Father Creator and Mother Earth.

For the last 25 years, I have been a hemp activist and I have been smoking marijuana on a daily basis for 40 years. I woke up a long time ago to the fact that the U.S. have made the most useful plant on the planet illegal. They call our kindest gift from Creator "bad" - but why?

Hemp is the only plant that economically competes with the petrolium oil industry. For that very reason, the U.S. have made a profitable business from arresting people for a plant. But that is not all they have done: the U.S. pays all of Central and South America to call this plant bad and make it illegal to grow. They do not allow them to grow hemp which in return makes them more dependant on fuel from other countries.

George Washington was a hemp farmer and taught the U.S. that if they grew hemp they would be independent of other nations, which still is true today.

My goals here have been to educate the people and see hemp grown here in Belize for fuel. The farmers and the government were very interested because, to them, hemp with 0% THC was not marijuana, which is what the U.S. pays these countries for to make illegal. It was a go ahead right away! But the U.S. stepped in and offered them another deal; the largest most secured U.S. embassy in the world is now here in Belize and the idea to grow hemp went away. But I did not. 

I kept up the campaign to educate and talk about hemp. Down the road a few more years and once more Belize decided they would grow hemp. But again the U.S. stepped in and offered to bring in oil companies to dig oil wells in Belize. They offered paying Belize by the barrel and the plan to grow hemp once more went away. 

Meanwhile, here in Belize we are paying about $6.50 U.S. a gallon for fuel. After the oil wells came my frustration grew. That's why about 6 years ago, I went on a 7 months tour around Belize in my bus. I went to the small villages where oil wells had been dug. No one from the village had been able to get a job and they had to put up with the disturbing helicopter that was constantly bringing in pipe and other supplies and flying over them low.


I hope you understand the importance in educating people about hemp. I am thankful for every contribution you make and every share you put on your social networks.

had been able to get a job and they had to put up with the disturbing

and flying over them low.

I hope you understand the importance in educating people about hemp. I am thankful for every contribution you make and every share you put on your social networks.

story:
More Info

MasseReaction’s World Patented ViPARTM technology can clean up virtually all (90%+) of the CO2, Mercury, and many other pollutants from any modern coal or gas fired electric power plant. It is then converted into hundreds of millions of gallons (billions of litres) of Drop-In Renewable Liquid Transportation Fuels such as Jet, Diesel, and non-food sourced Ethanol; all of which are cheaper than open market priced fossil based fuels.


Indoor Vertical Farming

The ViPARTM (Vertically Integrated Photo Array Reactor) is a photobioreactor capable of growing industrial quantities of algae in a perfectly controlled environment.

That environment is a modularized, vertically stackable, in-door housed, photobioreactor that can perfectly control light distribution to the center of each reactor core (tube). Current ViPARTM technology provides for a stacking height of over 50 feet (15 metres).

Light is distributed to the ViPARTM through fiber optic cables from a remote lighting source (solar/artificial hybrid) and transmitted through the reactor growth chamber tubes; the walls of these tubes are the light emitting elements themselves.


World Patented

This patented feature allows perfect control of temperature, light frequency and intensity. This level of control makes ViPARTM the perfect environment for algae cells to grow.

Each one of these features represents a revolutionary “break through” in the history of photobioreactor development.

ViPARTM is patented around the world, and has never had to defend a single claim in any patent office anywhere in the world. This is a rare occurrence in the patenting industry, and we are very proud of this solid scientific foundation.

ViPARTM science is clean, investable science.


Energy Balance

Algae, through photosynthesis, add energy by capturing photons from the Sun. At the lowest level of lighting inefficiency (artificial use only) the algae provide a positive system energy balance by about 35% (such as might be found in Alaska during the winter months).

Once the algae are grown, the cell walls are split and the sub-components of the algae are separated; specifically these components are lipids (oil), cytoplasm (sugar) and the cell wall itself (protein).

These sub components are transformed via standard practices into Drop-In Renewable Jet, Diesel (via Fischer Tropsch processing) and Ethanol (via distillation). 


Micro Land Use Footprint

A ViPARTM farm containing tens of thousands of modules, and located next to an average modern U.S. coal fired Electric Power Plant (average 670 Mega Watts and 3.2 Million tons of CO2 annually), would only require about 50 acres (20 hectares) for the entire 3.2 million ton CO2 capture, algae production and processing. This same 50 acres also includes all storage, transportation mode interfaces, offices, parking, and green space (although, arguably, that amount of algae taking up CO2 could possibly be considered it’s own green space).

A ViPARTM algae production facility of this size would containing tens of thousands of stacked ViPARTM modules. Three 200 ft (60 metre) wide by 600 ft (180 metre) long fast erect structures house the stacked ViPARTM module farm. They are insulated, cost effective, quick to build and hurricane resistant, with a wind rating to 125 MPH (200 km/h); they are also designed for the efficient shedding of snow.


Financial Sustainability

The product would be ~100 million U.S. gallons (380 million litres) of Jet, ~100 million U.S. gallons (380 million litres) of diesel, and ~400 million U.S. gallons (15,1 billion litres) of non-food sourced ethanol; PRICED BELOW OPEN MARKET SPOT, THESE FUELS PRODUCE ~45% Return on Investment (For the financial types) AT THIS SCALE...

...FROM A SINGLE POWER PLANT!


Job Creation

Phase I is our ViPARTM Technology Demonstrator. Phase II is a profitable Commercial Demonstrator. Phase III is a full scale capture of 3.2 million tons of CO2 from an average 700 Mega Watt Coal-fired electric power station. The number of jobs created by building a single ViPARTM Farm will be around 3,000.

In the U.S.A. alone, there are over 500 power plants of this size; that means full scale national deployment could represent about 15,000,000 potential job opportunities.

You can go online and see how many jobs that would mean for your country!

Just take the total Mega Watts of electricity generated by coal and natural gas...divide by 700 MW (to find the equivalent number of power plants) and then multiply by 3,000 jobs.


Significant Global Scale GHG Impact

Deployed across the entire United States alone, ViPARTM can remove 1.6 Billion tons of CO2 emissions from the Earth’s atmosphere; approximately 16% of the world’s total annual emissions.

We need your help to build a technology demonstrator. We have the scientists and engineers ready to build the special equipment we need to construct this revolutionary device.


National Security

Transportation fuels are the life blood of a nation's or region's economy.

ViPARTM Farms will be co-located next to electric power plants, which themselves are co-located next to large population centers. The amounts of fuel produced in any region, will generally exceed the fuel consumption levels of the local area.

Therefore, if there is a natural disaster in a local area, the surrounding areas can supply their excess transportation fuels to the stricken communities to help get them back on their feet, until their electric and co-located fuel production facilities are operational again.

ViPARTM will help keep citizens safe, and protect a country in the face of disaster.


Use of Funds From Your Donations

Just under a million and a half dollars are required to construct this highly specialized piece of machinery.

MasseReaction has been working with scientists and engineers for the development of the highly specialized manufacturing equipment required to fabricate the photonic intricacies of each reactor tube. (Whew...that was a mouth full!)

The balance of funds will be used for continued operations which encompass just about everything from securing a strategic partner to continued preparations for our Phase II project; the construction of a fully sustainable commercial demonstration facility (costing tens of millions of dollars)... just about everything... EXCEPT SALARIES.

MasseReaction will not commence payment of any salaries until we advance this technology to the sustainable Commercial Demonstration Phase (Phase II), which is the next step in our plan after successful operation of this Technology Demonstrator.

Everyone working on this project at MasseReaction has done so with volunteered time and service, because we believe in what we can do to change the world!


What If We Don't Make Our Goal?

MasseReaction will use the proceeds to continue our operations. We will use these donations to launch a campaign to find a Strategic Partner that can help us to bring this technology to the World.

We have decided that a large fuel consuming company, using massive quantities of fuels stored close to points of operation, would be an excellent candidate; although it could just as easily be a sovereign government, or any other concerned investor.

For instance, Carnival Cruise Lines (passenger) or the Maersk Line (maritime cargo) would be great candidates as they use huge amounts of fuel which they buy at ports with huge fuel tank farms nearby.

Another large fuel consumer would be a large airline. Delta Airlines has even purchased an oil refinery in order to help control the price and supply of their jet fuel. As one of our products is a drop-in renewable FAA approved jet fuel (bio derived SPK, for the tech types), we could make a company like that the "greenest" airline in the world...not to mention the "long term" stabilized prices we can offer... and the money that could be saved because we can offer our product below the "open market spot prices."

Rail Roads like Burlington Northern Santa Fe, CSX, Kansas Southern and Norfolk Southern could also benefit from MasseReaction's clean burning fuels which have high lubricity to protect engines, lower particulate, sulphur, and other emissions.

MasseReaction will use these donations to move this environmentally critical technology forward to North America, Europe, Australia, and beyond!


What You Can Do!

Certainly give if you can...but if you can't...post this link to your Facebook Page and ask your friends to post it, too! You can Tweet, Instagram, show your Pinterest or Google+ us!

Tell your friends and family that there is a new and promising technology...that can help us remain safe from harmful emissions, and really change the world... for the better!

Most importantly...recycle...combine your trips...turn off lights you aren't using...think twice about water use... be a friend to your environment and teach others to do the same!

...and if you can...

"Please help change the world, our environment, and the future of our Beautiful Blue Planet...Give Today!"


"On behalf of MasseReaction, I would like to express our most sincere thanks!"

Arthur. W.P. Masse, CEO

story:
Short Summary

In Nepal, people harvest herbal remedies straight from the forests and mountains where they live. These herbs are part of Nepal’s centuries-old indigenous ayurvedic healthcare system, which emphasizes disease prevention through proper diet and life style. Medicinal herbs are used both to boost immunity and to treat disease when it arises. But because these remedies have become increasingly popular around the world, Nepal’s native herb supply is diminishing rapidly. And the money from their harvest goes mostly to middlemen rather than to the harvesters themselves.

My name is Shane Zisman, I am an environmental lawyer and advocate and the American Coordinator of Healing Herbs Nepal. Healing Herbs Nepal is designed to transform an exploitative and environmentally degrading medicinal herb trade into one that:

  1. Protects Nepal's endangered medicinal herbs by training herb collectors to farm herbs using organic and agroecological methods rather than picking them from their native habitat;

  2. Elevates farmers out of poverty by training them in a new livelihood - sustainable herb production; and

  3. Protects farmers against exploitative industry practices by:

  • Providing training in holistic wellness programs (e.g. meditation, yoga, etc.) and financial and farm management;

  • Organizing farmers into cooperatives for collective bargaining and to cut middlemen out of the supply chain.

The Healing Herbs Nepal program will take place in 2 phases. In the first phase we will conduct a 2 year pilot study on a 15 hectare plot of land in the Nepal village of Rajahar to demonstrate the economic feasibility of this program.

Once we complete the 2 year pilot study, we will be well-positioned to attract the social impact investment needed to carry out the second phase of Healing Herbs Nepal - the engagement of hundreds of farmers to begin with and thousands of farmers as the program expands.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000 USD to meet our remaining budget needs for the first year of our pilot study. Any money raised on top of this will be allocated to the second year budget of the Healing Herbs Nepal pilot study ($60,000).

Your contributions will be used to cover:

•  Cultivation costs

•  Human Resource expenses - project staff (3), farmer salaries (15),

•  Operations - Project site and setup, lab testing, educational activities, media outreach

•  Taxes, royalties, and duties

Our Herbs are Your Rewards

We have selected four herbs to grow for the pilot phase of Healing Herbs Nepal. These medicinal herbs are a staples of Nepal's indigenous ayurvedic tradition and are currently classified as protected or endangered by Nepal's government.

Your rewards will come in the form of the herbs we harvest as part of our pilot study. We will include instructions on how to prepare each herb as well as their medicinal value.

Each of these herbs has wonderful healing properties as you can read below.

**As Healing Herbs Nepal progresses additional threatened species of medicinal herbs will be added to this program.

 Herbs  Medicinal Properties

1.  

Pipla

(Piper longum)

Pipla is a stimulant and can be used to treat coughs, sore throats, asthma, fever, and to reduce obesity.

2.  

Serpentine

(Rauwolfia serpentina)

Serpentine Root is taken to calm the mind and is highly effective for the treatment of hypertension.

3.  

Kurilo

(Asparagus racemosus)

Kurilo is a natural immune system booster and is commonly used to treat throat infections, the common cough bronchitis, and muscle spasms, and to improve fertility.  

4.  

Gurjo

(Tinospora cordifolia)

Gurjo is a natural anti-inflammatory which has rejuvenating properties and is a natural immunity booster. It is also used to treat fever and improve liver functioning.

It makes a delicious tea when combined with mint, cinnamon, jasmine and other herbs for taste.

Major Sponsor Rewards - $2,500 or more

By supporting Healing Herbs Nepal you are supporting the transformation of an exploitative and environmentally degrading medicinal herb trade into a sustainable enterprise that will lift traditional herb collectors out of poverty.

For those of you who are inspired enough by Healing Herbs Nepal to want to provide major program sponsorship of $2,500 or more we have organized a 7 day, 6 night eco-tour of Nepal which includes:

Outline itinerary:

Day 01: Arrival in Kathmandu. Transfer to hotel

Tour  Briefing and preparations.

Day 02:A guided sightseeing to explore major interesting historical and spiritual sites of the Kathmandu Valley. Overnight in Hotel Tibet on b/b.

Day 03: Drive early morning to Chitwan National Park by private coach

We will leave for Chitwan National Park early in the morning (approximately 9:30 hrs). It takes 4-5 hours to reach Chitwan National Park by private coach. Elephant back safari will be our post lunch activity. Overnight in Hotel Hermitage or similar ones with all meals and jungle activities inclusive.

Day 04: Dugout canoe trip and visit to Rajahar

We will go out for a dugout canoe trip on Rapti River after our breakfast. Drifting downstream of Rapti River for an hour or so gives ample opportunity to see slumbering Gharial and Marsh Magar crocodiles and plenty of migratory birds. A visit to Elephant Breeding Centre is also combined with this trip. We will drive to Rajahar for a visit to Herbal Medicinal Plantations. Overnight in the same resort with all meals and jungle activities inclusive.

Day 05: Drive to Pokhara and explore around

We will drive to Pokhara by a private coach after having our breakfast. It takes only 4-5 hours to reach Pokhara. We will explore Pokhara’s major attractions (Davi’s Fall, Guptshwor Mahadev Cave, Tibetan Refugee Settlement and Fewa Lake) after lunch. Overnight in Lake Side Retreat on b/b basis.

Day 06: Morning hike to Sarangkot-Naundanda and fly to Kathmandu in the afternoon

Sarangkot is a famous hill station for sunrise and panoramic mountain views. We will drive to Sarangkot and commence hiking to Naundanda. It takes only 30 minutes to reach the top of Sarangkot. After enjoying sunrise and mountain views, we will commence hiking to Naundanda (3-4 hours only). After the hike, we will drive to Pokhara, have a lunch and fly to Kathmandu by afternoon flight. Overnight in Hotel Tibet on b/b.

Day 07: Attend Rudrabishek at Pashupatinath Temple and Trip  concludes

The trip cost includes

·  All internal transport as per itinerary

·  All accommodation as specified in the itinerary

·  All meals, park fees, and jungle activities in Chitwan National Park

·  An experienced English-speaking KE leader

·  Pokhara-Kathmandu flight fares

The trip cost does not include

·  International flight fares

·  Nepal visa

·  Travel insurance (must cover emergency air evacuation)

·  Optional tours

·  Lunch and dinner in Kathmandu and Pokhara

·  Pure personal nature expenses, e. g. bar bills (bottled and canned drinks), laundry and telephone bills

·  Guide and driver tips

The Impact

The measurable objectives of this program are to reduce wild harvesting of endangered herbs by 80%. We believe this is an attainable goal because over 99% of Nepali production of the endangered herbs selected for our program are wild-harvested by hand by herb collectors. Training herb collectors how to farm these herbs will allow them to grow these herbs in much greater quantities than they are able to pick in the forest. Thus, we can end the necessity to pick herbs from the forest.

Second, we can improve farmer incomes by 300%. 80% of Nepal's workforce are comprised of farmers, half of whom live beneath the poverty line. Many of these farmers live in such remote areas of the country that they must walk for hours to reach the nearest dirt road. Therefore, they lack the capacity to connect effectively with the herb supply chain and as a result are susceptible to exploitation by "herb middlemen."

By forming worker cooperatives, Healing Herbs Nepal can cut exploitative middlemen out of the equation and return profits to farmers thereby significantly improving incomes and elevating them out of poverty.

Healing Herbs Nepal Team

•  Bhupendra Nirajan - Bhupendra is the Nepal coordinator for Healing Herbs Nepal. Bhupendra has over 10 years experience in the field of traditional Nepalese medicine.

•  Deepak Prakash Baskota - Mr. Baskota pioneered organic tea production in Nepal and founded the first successful organic tea cooperative in 1984, which today has over 600 members. http://www.organickte.com/?page=show_page&c=50

•   Dr. Rishi Ram Koirala - Dr. Rishi is one of Nepal's top Ayurvedic physicians. He is recognized internationally for his extensive expertise in the medicinal herbs of Nepal and in their use for maintaining health and treating disease.  

    Dr. John Fagan - John is a successful social entrepreneur. He has founded or co-founded several organizations, including Genetic ID, Cert ID, the ProTerra Foundation, and Food Chain Global Advisors, which have contributed significantly to improving the sustainability of the food system globally. He is also co-author of the Reports Roundup and Birth Defects and GMO Myths and Truths.

•  Dr. Romy Das - Romy is a professor of Business Management at Maharishi University of Management, USA. Romy is a long-time consultant and holds a PhD in agricultural economics.

•  Shane Zisman - Shane is an environmental lawyer and advocate. He holds a J.D. from Vermont Law school and is a long-time environmental advocate.

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

The success of this campaign is directly correlated with our ability to connect with the greatest number of people possible. If you resonate with what Healing Herbs Nepal is trying to accomplish please consider sharing our video with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and by email.
