story:
Summary

Because of the recent urgency in critical climate changes, I was asked to speak at the upcoming 2013 "Sustainable Brands" Summit at the World Brand Congress in India this October and need your support to attend.

As carbon just reaches 400 ppm in the atmosphere (which has never
happened before in human history) and the world is transforming and changing at
an alarming rate, we are running out of time to get the “green” message out to the
business community. 

Because of my long-term commitment to the environment and my position at the U.S. Green Chamber of Commerce, I have been asked to speak at the upcoming summit in Mumbai, India. This invitation to present just came in and was not included in our 2013 budget, so the U.S. Green Chamber, as a non-profit organization,  is unable to sponsor the travel costs to this event.

The World Brand Congress will be the single largest meeting of the International community’s most successful and sought after brand marketing experts.  This is an opportunity to promote the “Green Economy” and sustainability on a global platform.

Why is This Important?

This is a unique opportunity to affect change on a global level and impact the environmental movement. At the summit, I can influence leaders from around the world about the important steps we all must take to make a sustainable future for generations to come. I am traveling to this conference to share this important message to some of the key international "messengers".

The world is watching America in how we manage our resources on a business level and we have the opportunity and the responsibility to be the leaders and show that we a moving in a new direction.


What We Need & What You Get

I need at least $2,300 dollars to cover my remaining
travel expenses including Airfare, Visa, Insurance, carbon offsets,
and lodging.  The airline ticket itself is between $1,200 and $1,500. The World
Brand Congress will be covering 3 nights hotel and all conference expenses.

I am very excited to offer unique items to my contributors!

  • For only $25, I will personally send you a very cool postcard from India.
  •  For only $45, you will receive the cool postcard and public acknowledgement on the U.S. Green Chamber of Commerce Facebook page and the U.S. Green Chamber of   Commerce Southeast region Facebook page.
  • For only $100, you will receive the above plus be invited to a private Indian themed reception following my business trip. We will provide Indian appetizers
         and beverages along with a short and fun presentation on the next steps to
         global sustainability. 
  • For $500 you will receive all of the above, four tickets to evening reception and
         a special hand picked sovenier from India.
  • For the generous contribution of $950 you will receive all of the above plus
         your own table at the reception and your own personal attendant for the evening.

The Impact

The sooner we engage the global business community in a collaborative manner, the
sooner we can:

  • Reduce the impact we are having on the environment
  • Promote sustainable and green business practices
  • Save the environment for future generations

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign with your colleagues, friends and family! 
  • If you or someone you know have airline miles that can be transferred that would
         reduce the cash needed for this important effort

story:
Press:


  



Children’s access to mobile media devices is increasing day by day. As a result parents now tend to use digital devices as quick-shift babysitters. The time children spend in front of a display screen of some sort is increasing rapidly as well. However, apart from keeping them busy this passive and non-active screen time alone will not aid in their brain development.

It is imperative for kids, particularly in their early ages to play with toys. Active play involving pretend-play and imaginative-play is a major part of healthy brain development as often stressed by child psychology experts.

The increasing usage of digital devices among children has led to a decline in the time they spend playing with actual toys. Restricting access to digital devices, however, would limit the opportunities kids get to experience the valuable and positive impact that cutting edge, innovative technologies offer.

We at Kreyonic, encourage physical play in kids without restricting their access to technology. With the use of actual toys, our products can make screen time more meaningful and fun for children.


Qboo is a set of farm animals from the magical farm land far far away, made of fabric (plush toys), and they come bundled with an interactive educational tablet application. 

Children can place toys on the tablet screen and the application presents a variety of creative activities based on the type of toy.

  

By playing with Qboo, kids can reveal the secret magical world of animals, fun facts and their whereabouts.

This is how the perfected toys and characters would look like in the final production design.



Playing with Qboo is easy and fun!

Open the Qboo application on your tablet and place a toy on the screen. Thats it!


Qboo application encourages non-structured, open-ended game play. Children can choose the characters they want in their story. Characters come to life in the digital world. They listen and respond to children.

Qboo's open-ended game play allows kids to control the flow of the game/stories based on their own imagination. So every time kids play they will experience a different flow in the same story!

Our main goal is to encourage kids to play more often with real toys. With Qboo, even when there is no tablet around, children can still keep playing with the toys.


It is magic! Well, not really.

Qboo toys do not have any electronics inside. Current toys are passive and use multi-touch technology on latest capacitive sensing tablet screens.

Each toy has a uniquely identifiable pattern embroidered with a special thread; when kids place toys on the tablet screen, each toy registers a unique multitouch pattern that our patent pending design and technology can use to recognize the type of toy being used.


Educational Value

  • Playing with Qboo will help improve your child's social, intellectual, language, and problem-solving skills.
  • We encourage imaginative play and active play.
  • We provide interactive educational activities for kids which will improve hand/eye co-ordination and fine motor skills.
  • Qboo plush toys are a good travel companion. Have a long boring journey coming up? take Qboo along with you
  • Qboo's smart and cuddly toys provide ideal simulation for kids imaginations
  • Our toys are specially designed and supervised with the help of professional educators and child psychology experts.



To Spend Some Quality Time With Your Kids. You Can Play Along Too!


 





Qboo T-Shirt Designs!


Kreyonic, is an early stage tech startup founded by a team of three and now based in Kitchener, ON Canada.

We are the first international team in the Communitech Hyperdrive Accelerator program.

We are Software Engineers and we have expertise in Human Computer Interaction, Child Computer Interaction, Music Technology and Image Processing.



We love technology and we love KIDS!


Why We Are Doing This?

At Kreyonic we are fascinated by technology and how that can be used to influence curious little minds.

When we were kids, from the very first moment that we could grab a toy we wanted to take it apart to see what was inside and how they worked. It was this ongoing curiosity that led us to an interest in technology and innovation.

We know there are millions of kids out there with curious, creative and innovative minds. We are on a mission to innovate fun and educational tools for those little minds to experience the best of cutting edge technology without getting addicted to passive screen times.


Parents know the best! During our closed beta we realized how important is the feedback from parents to improve our product and company. That is why we created the Moms & Dads Group for Kreyonic.

The Moms & Dads group will be the first to get access to try out new toys and apps and give their feedback. These parents work closely with our team to help Kreyonic by testing new features and suggesting improvements.


Qboo Characters - Work in Progress




We are ready to go. We have completed the toy designs and we have initial working prototypes. We spent months testing prototypes with small groups of parents and kids to make Qboo the hottest toy of next year.

Our specialist custom plush toy manufacturing partner is ready to complete the final production design and guide Qboo toys through necessary toy certifications to get your smart plush toys shipped as soon as possible.

With your help we can start and complete Qboo production run, create more graphics and interactive content - magical stories - to complete the Qboo app and start shipping Qboo packs by April 2014.


We introduce Qboo with three toys, Tuffy, Tipsy and Paddles. After the initial launch in April 2014, we plan to launch more toys.


We are intrigued with innovation and we encourage to build your own creation. Therefore, we plan to provide a set of APIs for creators and developers who love to invent their own applications using our platform.

We value your creativity and your thoughts. We believe it is important to let parents customize our applications to better suit their kids. In future, you will be able to create your own custom applications using our drag and drop interfaces to design stories and scenarios.

At Kreyonic, we bring physical play to digital devices. Our vision is to help the world to create the next generation of creative thinkers... and this is just the beginning.

With your help, not only can we make this a reality, but also start an exciting journey to innovate the next generation of toys!


Please help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with your family and friends.


You might not want kids' toys right now, but sure you know someone who does. So please share this with your social circles. Let's make this happen!


We would love to hear from you!

You can email us at contact@kreyonic.com or call us on +1 226 338 2604


Many Thanks!

- Kreyonic Team


1. When will Qboo be available?

Qboo is currently in prototype phase. We will use this crowdfunding campaign in order to raise funds towards production. Our goal is to have Qboo ready to ship by April of 2014.


2. Can I get anything for this Christmas?

For sure! If you help us by pledging $40 or higher we will send you a hand written, limited edition Qboo Christmas / New Year / Thank You Card of your choice, signed by founders and magical Qboo characters! The card will be illustrated by our amazing artist Isuri and if you want to send it to someone else on your behalf, we can do that too!


3. I want to buy more than one Qboo pack. Do I need to add shipping cost separately for each pack?

No. You only have to pay for shipping once. We will cover the cost for the additional Qboo packs!


4. Are the toys safe for kids?

Yes. The toys will have safety certificates to make sure they are in compliance with all toy safety standards in all countries.


5. Are the toys washable?

Yes, but recommended is surface wash only.


6. Will the toys damage or scratch my tablet device / screen?

No. This is one of the main things many parents are concerned. We take this extremely seriously and that is why we wanted to create a toy, which is both kid friendly and tablet friendly.

The toys are completely made of fabric (plush toys) and no matter how hard your child use it on your tablet device... Qboo toys will not damage or scratch the tablet screen.


7. In the video, I saw a crack on your iPad! Did that happen by toys?

No. our co-founder, Amani dropped that iPad in an airport during a transit. :)


8. What is the recommended age range for Qboo?

The recommended audience are kids from 3 to 5 years. However, we found both younger and older kids showing interest in Qboo and toys during our private beta testing.


9. Does Qboo App work on any tablet?

Our current prototype works on iPad. However, we plan to launch both iOS and Android versions before we ship your Qboo in April 2014.

So, Qboo App works on all iPad versions and most of the Android tablets out there!


10. Can my kids play with Qboo toys even without a tablet?

Yes! At Kreyonic, our main goal is to encourage physical play for kids without restricting their access to technology. The toys and stories are made carefully so that kids can continue playing with them even there is no tablet around!

Qboo toys are not electronic toys so kids can do pretend-play and imaginative play in the real world just as they play with other plush toys.

story:
Short Summary

Millions of sharks are slaughtered each year and they end up primarily in shark's fin soup. The fins are so highly prized that these sharks are hauled onboard, their fins sliced off and thrown back into the ocean to die a slow death. In order to learn more about these creatures and to help educate people, I have actively sought out intimate time with these species. In March 2013, I will be joining the RJ Dunlap Marine Conservation Program from the University of Miami for a shark tagging expedition. The tags will allow us to study the sharks' movements in the subtropical Atlantic in order to identify ‘hot spots’ for feeding, mating, and pupping. With this knowledge, policy makers will be able to make better informed decisions that support establishing effective protection at these critical sites.

On a personal level, this experience will help educate my family and friends about this inhumane practice. Growing up it was common for me to eat shark's fin soup before I knew how it was harvested. I have come to realize how unique and beautiful these creatures are, and I hope my perspective will help change how we view and treat these creatures.


"Be the change that you wish to see in the world" - Gandhi

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will directly fund research aimed at creating a balance between human needs and shark conservation. Sharks play an integral role in maintaining the health of our marine ecosystem by keeping prey populations in check as well as removing weak and diseased animals. We live in a complex and dynamic world, inexorably linked through our oceans, which covers more than 70% of our planet's surface. Through photosynthesis, marine plants provide half the oxygen we breathe no matter where we live. The oceans also sustain us with food.

My goal is to raise money for at least one shark tag and name it Boise. With Boise being landlocked I hope people will appreciate the irony of a shark named Boise swimming in the ocean. For a stretch goal, if you help me raise $1M I will change my first name to Shark. With my last name being Oh, all my official documents will read Oh, Shark. How will cool will that be!

The satellite tags cost $2500 each, which includes the use of satellites to track the sharks. Each tag provides information about the shark’s surrounding environment and its GPS location to help track and piece together each shark species’ life history and ecology. When a shark is tagged, it will be named Boise and you can track it in near real-time on the RJD website - http://rjd.miami.edu/learning-tools/follow-sharks/.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

All contributions are appreciated. In lieu of monetary contributions, please consider the following:
  • Stop eating shark's fin soup.
  • Tell a friend about what you have learned.
  • Ask me more about my trip.
  • And lastly please spread the word by sharing this page on Facebook and/or Twitter.

Thank you all for reading this far and taking an interest in my work!

story:
Short Summary

Hi my names Gilbert M. Brown II, I am a student at The Communtiy School at the Opportunity Farm campus. At the school we have a project called our passages. We chose something that we are intrested in, and do a project about it. I chose to do mine on an herb garden and starting one for the school. The idea of the herb garden is to make it so that the school can save money on herbs. It will also allow future students to learn how to grow, maintain, and how to cook with the herbs that will be grown. At the moment the herbs are inside. When spring comes around the plants will be planted out side of the kitchen door for quick access to fresh herbs for the student that is cooking for that week. I would also like to build a hoop house or green house for the plants so they can be grown for longer in the season. and will be able to stay outside all year round.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will be put into the supplies needed to build the hoop/green house for the plants. the money will aslo be used for soil, plant pots, ferilizers, and will also be used to buy seeds.

 

The Impact

This prodject will save the school money on herbs. the school aleady has a garden where we grow tamatos, pumpkins, peppers, squash, and other foods. This garden will increase the different things that we can cook. We can also use herbs like parsley along with the tamatos and make are own sauces. The school would save money from not having to buy sauce from a store.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can donate soil, plant pots, or even five gallon buckets can also work for plant pots.

Also if you can let people know about my project and what i'm doing that would be great.

story:
Care about the Karoo, its people and environment?

Help us get the facts about gas drilling and fracking in Southern Africa to the communities living in the area. 

Join our campaign!

After screening The High Cost of Cheap Gas in Cape Town and Johannesburg we now need to show our award-winning film to those communities in the Karoo whose quality of life will be directly affected by gas development.

We need your help for translating the film into Afrikaans.

Most communities in the Karoo speak Afrikaans. We need to translate the film so people can understand the messages it brings. 

You can help us get these messages out by funding the film translation and sharing this campaign with your friends and colleagues.

To support this crowd-funding appeal, our team is crossing the Karoo for the next month, screening the film in the rustic playhouses of yesteryear, selling DVDs and talking to communities about gas drilling.  We are not charging entry, but asking people to contribute to this crowd-funding campaign.

Click here for a list of international write ups.  To date, 65,000 web references detail our discovery that companies are surreptitiously fracking in Botswana's famous national parks.

We have already shown the film to thousands of people around the world and won 3 international awards since its official release in 2015:

           


Best Documentary at Ekotopfilm/Envirofilm

Award of Merit from The Accolade Global Film Competition

Best Documentary at the Los Angeles Independent Film Festival

The film has also been on TV broadcasts on 50/50 and Carte Blanche and has made two appearances on ETV.  We have  partnered with WITS University, the University of Cape Town, The City of Cape Town, The Labia Cinema, the Alternative Information Development Institute (AIDC) the Environmental Monitoring Group (EMG) the Centre for Environmental Rights (CER), the South African Mountain Club, and the University of the Western Cape for screenings that drew hundreds of people from government, civil society, industry and the potentially affected public.  

Building on our momentum:

We can translate and edit the film into Afrikaans for 6,000 dollars. 

With the help of our fantastic partners we have organised four english film screenings in the Karoo, during which we will enlist the support of the people who come to our screenings for this crowd-funding campaign.  2,000 dollars of our goal goes towards completing this journey.  Supporters have the exciting opportunity to be involved in every step of the way as we upload  clips, interviews, photos and short messages every day, cataloging our journey. This will also allow us to investigate whether some companies have jumped the gun and started gas exploration already.

If we go beyond our goal and raise $10,000 we will also translate the film into Setswana for the people of Botswana.

If you are in the Karoo, or looking for a great way to explore this country, come and join us for a screening.

If you aren't, follow our journey through our social media on twitter: @allianceearth and @highcostofgas and our facebook page - share them with your friends.

If we raise less than our goal all funds will go towards funding further outreach.

Here are the screenings in the Karoo this month, feel free to share these posters on your various social media outlets!

Barrydale August 7, 2015:


Prince Albert   August 11th, 2015:


Graaf Reinet August 20th, 2015

Who Are We?

Director Jeffrey Barbee is the MD of Alliance Earth and an environmental journalist who works for Global Post, LinkTV.org and the UK Guardian. He also works on a freelance basis for the New York Times, the BBC, NOS Tv Holland, Smithsonian Magazine, RTL News, PBS, CBS, Time Magazine, Newsweek, Vanity Fair and many other publications.

Producer Mira Dutschke has a masters degree in Human Rights Law and 10 years international research experience. Currently she is producing media investigating human rights and environmental issues. She  also teaches human rights and advocacy for the Masters in Child and Maternal Health at the University of Cape Town.

All funds are administered through www.allianceearth.org, our not-for-profit registered environmental and scientific reporting initiative.  Explore Alliance Earth's partners, including The Climate Reality Project, The Guardian Newspaper, KCET TV in California and Link TV in the USA.

story:
We need water

"We need water", the families of Boucan Chat, Haiti told us when we asked how we could help. Most importantly they asked us for a way to catch their own water.

The earthquake had cracked their only cistern and the rain water is now lost. Without the money or supplies to fix it the community has been severely struggling.

Recent drought conditions have intensified this community's hardship.

With $2,947 dollars we can make sure the entire community has a sustainable water source. Help us MAKE IT HAPPEN, if you can.

We went to make a movie but now lives are at stake.

My name is Aaron Straight, I am a filmmaker, and my partner in this mission is Adam Brown a biologist working in the Caribbean for the last 20 years.

Two years ago, my good friend and biologist Adam Brown told me a story about a two families struggling to survive one was a family of Haitian farmers trying to feed their children and one was a family of birds on the brink of extinction. They need the same resources to survive.

We decided to figure out a way to tell this story and share it with the world. In telling the story we made a commitment to protect the bird and a promise to help the people. The long-term storytelling project raises support for reforestation, agroforestry, erosion control, and saving based micro finance other similar projects that support the people and protect the bird.

The movie project is called SAVE THE DEVIL.

The bird on the brink of extinction is called the Diablotin (or 'little devil').

You can see the trailer here:

www.savethedevil.net


All of that will come, but we have an urgent water crisis on our hands.

We need to focus on solving this community's water crisis,

right now.

MAKE IT HAPPEN - the plan & partners

In recent months our partners in the Dominican Republic alerted us that our friends in the Boucan Chat community are in real trouble. They need water. With their help we put together a plan and a budget.

We can fix the old rain catchment system for around $700 but that is only enough water for 1/3 the community. We can build two more for a little more than $2,000. That means 3 rain catchment systems for the community. The water would be used for drinking and bathing as well as irrigating food crops as their situation improves.

Grupo Jaragua, our non-profit partners just across the border in the Dominican Republic, are ready and able to build the rain catchment systems. Grupo Jaragua has invested many years in this community. They are a rock solid organization and trusted by the people. Look them up. http://www.grupojaragua.org.do/index_english.html

Now we just need to raise $2,947.00.

Can you help?

Any thing towards this goal helps.

Many thanks & much respect,

Aaron Straight

Adam Brown

Environmental Protection in the Caribbean (EPIC)

Grupo Jaragua

& the people of the Boucan Chat, Haiti.

story:
Short Summary

Fairies are absolutley real. And, especially, they will truly come to you if you really believe. I am Mallory and I have shared above an episode of the Chris Valentine Show! There are many shows to his series so be sure to check the rest of them out on youtube! I am fairy lover who owns three fairy books and I want to continue to believe and hopefully let fairies know that they are always welcome around me. In order to make this goal be possible, I need to raise money through my campaign right here on indiegogo! 

What We Need & What You Get

I need money to buy specialty fairy houses/accessories. Fairy houses are a definite must for me to have in order to help out fairy friends. All of the accessories and castles will be purchased online from a trusted site, Fairy Woodland. Plus fairy friends will indeed appreciate water related garden displays like nice ponds for fairies to wash up and drink water. So, to answer any concerns, all appreciated money contributions will go toward those areas mentioned. INCENTIVE: A $10 contribution will get you a personalized thank you letter by me. And maybe a tiny surprise! You never know! It will be nice!

The Impact

I want to let you know, everyone, personally, that I appreciate all funds! Your generousity will be acknowledged because the fairies really will be happy I imagine and I will too. Also, when you were little, you saw fairy movies maybe and you may have seen Peter Pan. Well, contributing means that you really care about the imagination and you fully understand that imagination really comes to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

You can do so much, besides donating your money. That will be great if you can spread the word about my campaign on indiegogo! Let this spread like wildfire to the people who believe in my cause! 

And that’s all there is to it. And thank you!

story:
Hi, My name is Dylan D'Haeze and I'm a first time film maker. I made this documentary because I've learned about plastic pollution and how it's affecting the planet in a very bad way.

As a kid, it scared me and I felt powerless. So I decided to make a documentary about plastic pollution and how kids can help solve the problem.

This documentary is one in a series of documentaries I’m doing called Kids Can Save The Planet.

It’s an exciting and cool project because I’ve gotten to learn how to film and edit, and also have filmed all over the west coast, Hawaii and in New York. It’s been a lot of fun!

By contributing to this project, you will help me take "Plastic Is Forever" to film festivals around the country, organize environmental summits for kids, and fund the series "Kids Can Help Save The Planet".  The next film will be on climate change and I'm really looking forward to filming again soon!

Check out the trailer for the film here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Md4D0PZFnE

story:
The Buck Stops Here

Hunters often use attractants to lure deer into a controlled area. Many of the most popular products are liquids and sprays; however, these products have a limited effective lifespan and do not weather well once dispensed. 

The materials scientists at Green Dot Bioplastics have created a biodegradable polymer that is ideal for scenting. These pellets can absorb a large amount of liquid scent and retain the scent for a long time. 

We’ve scented pellets with fresh doe in estrus urine and scrape urine. Natural fibers in the pellets provide an outdoor color and texture to camouflage them when dispersed onto the ground. The pellets  will gently biodegrade when their useful life has ended.

In preliminary tests the results were amazing. Pellets dispersed on the ground quickly attracted bucks. The pellets retained the scent and lasted longer than standard sprays. And, stored pellets kept their potency. 

The pictures below are on from one trail camera using the doe in estrus pellets. Deer were seen on the camera beginning on the first night after the pellets were dispersed. These bucks were not previously seen in the area.

Trail cam video from a campaign contributor:

More pictures from campaign contributors:

"This 12 point buck came into my camera set the second night after I put out the estrus urine"

"Not a monster but def coming to the pellets."

"It isn't the biggest buck out there but this camera is only 100yds from my shop. Only thing out is the pellets and had zero deer pictures the month the camera was out prior to putting the pellets down."

Why it's better:

  • Long lasting scent - won’t wash away with rain or heavy dew.
  • Easy to disperse in targeted area.
  • Stored pellets remain fresh for months
  • Camouflaged - natural color conceals targeted area.
  • Biodegradable - pellets will gently biodegrade over the course of the season

What We Need & What you Get:

We’re seeking $2,000 funds to produce samples of pellets for field tests and data collection. 

Donors will receive pellets to trial and are encourage to send trail cam footage and photos of the results. We will provide additional samples to those who share their results.

story:
The Keep Clean & Run campaign

70% of marine littering is caused by trash that comes by the inner land. Over the past decades, the presence of waste in the world’s seas and oceans has been an ever-increasing phenomenon. In order to invert this trend, we must take action.

2 runners, 400 km, 8 days, 1 goal: cleaning up a trail from Valle d’Aosta to Liguria from litter. Each day the athletes will cover an average of 50 km and pick up litter that they find on their way. Along with their effort, citizens, educational establishments, enterprises, associations and municipalities will be invited to join the clean-up activity.

In the frame of the EU funded LIFE EWWR+ project  AICA (International Association for Environmental Communication) coordinates the activities inherent the European Clean Up Day (ECUD), a Europe-wide annual clean-up day.

 The “Keep Clean & Run” campaign is an additional effort that AICA wants to make in order to boost the visibility of the issue and to increase the number of participants to the ECUD in Europe. Only if many get involved we can really achieve to reduce littering in nature. We need your help to make it possible! 


(Italian version)

La campagna Pulisci e Corri

Il 70% dei rifiuti abbandonati in mare è causato da rifiuti provenienti dall’entroterra. Negli ultimi decenni, la contaminazione e l’inquinamento dei mari e oceani sono cresciuti costantemente. Per invertire questa tendenza, dobbiamo agire.

2 corridori, 400 km, 8 giorni, 1 solo obiettivo: pulire e raccogliere rifiuti su un sentiero dalla Valle d’Aosta fino alla Liguria. Ogni giorno, gli atleti percorreranno una media di 50 km e raccoglieranno i rifiuti abbandonati lungo il percorso. Congiuntamente al loro sforzo, cittadini, istituti scolastici, aziende, associazioni e pubbliche amministrazioni saranno invitate a unirsi nelle attività di pulizia.

Nell’ambito del progetto LIFE EWWR+, finanziato dalla UE, AICA (Associazione Internazionale per la Comunicazione Ambientale) coordina le attività inerenti all’European Clean Up Day (ECUD), una giornata annuale europea di pulizia straordinaria del territorio.

La campagna “Pulisci e Corri” è uno sforzo aggiuntivo che AICA intende realizzare per accentuare la visibilità mediatica dell’attività incrementando così il numero di partecipanti all’ECUD in Europa. Solo se ci facciamo coinvolgere in molti riusciremo a ridurre l’abbandono dei rifiuti in natura. Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto e della vostra partecipazione!


What We Need & What You Get

Here is what the itinerary of the 2 athletes will look like:

Day

Starting location

Arrival location

The 2.000€ that we hope to gather with this crowdfunding campaign would allow us to fund the practical organization of the clean-up activity in each one of the 8 stages.

AICA has already found some technical partners and private sponsors that will contribute to cover:

-  The graphic layout and print of communication material (logo of the event, posters etc.)

-  Insurance

-  Expenses of the athletes for 7 nights and 8 days (hotel accommodation, meals, technical equipment) etc.

We need to cover all the rest (organization, promotional video, cleaning material, the effort of the local associations etc.) !

So, let’s wrap it up:

-  With 5€ you will allow us to clean 1 km of the trail. In exchange you will get:

o  1 clean km of a beautiful trail that you are invited to visit if you ever pass by the North of Italy!

o  1 big thank you from us and your name among the sponsors to thank on the www.envi.info website and in the video-documentary that we will produce at the end of the event

-  With 15€, you will help us clean 3 km of the trail. In exchange you will get:

o  3 clean km of a beautiful trail that you are invited to visit

o  Many thanks from us and your name among the sponsors to thank on the www.envi.info website and in the video-documentary that we will produce at the end of the event

o   A bottle of wine  produced in the Langhe region in Italy

-  With 50€ you help us clean 10 km of the trail! You rock!! This is what you will get back:

o  10 clean km of a beautiful trail that you are invited to visit

o  Many huge thanks from us and your name among the sponsors to thank on the www.envi.info website and in the video-documentary that we will produce at the end of the event

o   A bottle of wine  produced in the Langhe region in Italy

o  The book “Voglio raccontarti una storia” (in Italian) that retraces the story of flooding in literature, conveying one key message about prevention.

o  An electronic certificate to thank you for your effort in taking part in the initiative.

-  With 100€, you almost deserve to become a honorary citizen of Italy! As we can’t make this happen, this is what you will really get:

o  10 clean km of a beautiful trail that you are invited to visit

o  Many huge thanks from us and your name among the sponsors to thank on the www.envi.info website and in the video-documentary that we will produce at the end of the event

o  A bottle of wine  produced in the Langhe region in Italy

o  The book “Voglio raccontarti una storia” (in Italian) that retraces the story of flooding in literature, conveying one key message about prevention.

o  An electronic certificate to thank you for your effort in taking part in the initiative.

o  The possibility of joining the athletes and all the other participants at a dinner in one of the 7 arrival stages of your choice. However, travel expenses to reach the location will not be covered… Everything else, yes!


(Italian version)

I 2.000€ che speriamo di raccogliere attraverso questa campagna ci permetterebbero di finanziare alcuni aspetti pratici delle attività di pulizia nelle diverse tappe.

AICA ha già trovato dei partner tecnici e degli sponsor privati che contribuiranno a coprire:

-  L’ideazione e la realizzazione dell’immagine grafica coordinata e la realizzazione di diversi materiali e supporti di comunicazione

-  Le spese di assicurazione dei partecipanti

-  Le spese inerenti le esigenze logistiche e organizzative degli atleti (pernottamenti, pasti equipaggiamento tecnico etc.)

Dobbiamo ancora coprire tutte le altre spese (materiali di pulizia, spese logistiche e organizzative, lo sforzo di partecipazione delle associazioni locali...)!! 

Ricapitolando:

-  Con 5€ ci permetterai di pulire 1 km del sentiero. In cambio otterrai:

o  1km di sentiero pulito che ti invitiamo a percorrere se passi da queste parti!

o  Un grande grazie da tutti noi e il tuo nome fra quello degli sponsor che ringrazieremo sul sito www.envi.info così come nel video-documentario dell’evento

-  Con 15€, ci permetterai di pulire 3km di sentiero. In cambio avrai:

o  3km di sentiero pulito che ti invitiamo a percorrere se passi da queste parti!

o  Molte grazie da tutti noi e il tuo nome fra quello degli sponsor che ringrazieremo sul sito www.envi.info così come nel video-documentario dell’evento

o  Una bottiglia di vino prodotto nelle Langhe, Italia.

-  Con 50€, ci aiuterai a pulire 10 km di sentiero! Sei un grande! Ecco cosa ti daremo in cambio:

o  10 km di sentiero pulito che ti invitiamo a percorrere se passi da queste parti!

o  Un grazie abnorme da tutti noi e il tuo nome fra quello degli sponsor che ringrazieremo sul sito www.envi.info così come nel video-documentario dell’evento

o  Una bottiglia di vino prodotto nelle Langhe, Italia.

o  Il libro “Voglio raccontarti una storia” (in italiano) che ripercorre la storia delle alluvioni nella letteratura, veicolando alcuni messaggi chiave di prevenzione

o  Un certificato elettronico per ringraziarti ufficialmente per aver preso parte all’iniziativa

-  Con 100€, meriti quasi di diventare un cittadino onorario! Siccome non possiamo prometterti che questo accada, ecco cosa ti daremo invece:

o  10 km di sentiero pulito che ti invitiamo a percorrere se passi da queste parti!

o  Un grazie abnorme da tutti noi e il tuo nome fra quello degli sponsor che ringrazieremo sul sito www.envi.info così come nel video-documentario dell’evento

o  Una bottiglia di vino prodotto nelle Langhe, Italia.

o  Il libro “Voglio raccontarti una storia” (in italiano) che ripercorre la storia delle alluvioni nella letteratura, veicolando alcuni messaggi chiave di prevenzione

o  Un certificato elettronico per ringraziarti ufficialmente per aver preso parte all’iniziativa

o  La possibilità di partecipare a uno degli apericena ZeroWaste a tua scelta ai quali prenderanno parte atleti, testimonial e sponsor alla fine di ogni giornata del trekking. Tuttavia, le spese di trasporto per raggiungere il luogo della cena non sono incluse… Tutto il resto, sì!


The Impact

The ECUD is at its 2° edition this year. In 2014, AICA had already organized a central event in Italy to enhance the visibility of the campaign: thanks to the participation of Italy’s Ministry of Environment, two main clean up events had been organized (one in Bologna, in front of the central station and the other one in Rome, in Piazza Vittorio Emanuele). The Environment Minister himself, Gianluca Galletti, has taken part to these events, along with the Secretary for Environment Barbara Degani. This helped us achieve a greater media coverage and enhance the sensitization of citizen’s to the issue. 

Last year’s results? 400.000 people involved in Italy, 800.000 in Europe. 21 tons of trash collected in Italy, 2.600 tons in Europe.

The Keep Clean & Run campaign takes our goal to a higher stake. Not only will we involve (again) the Ministry of Environment and other relevant stakeholders, but we also want to involve more citizens in the main event. Our goal is to:

-  Collect as much waste as possible over the 400 km of trail

-  Increase the media attention to the issue so that as many participants as possible take part to the ECUD, if not in the central event, by organizing events in their surroundings

This is why we need your help. Our motivation and the contributions of our technical sponsors are not enough to achieve this goal.


(Italian version)

L’ECUD è alla 2° edizione quest'anno. Nel 2014, AICA aveva già organizzato un evento centrale in Italia per migliorare la visibilità della campagna: grazie alla partecipazione del Ministero dell'Ambiente, erano stati organizzati due principali eventi di pulizia (uno a Bologna, di fronte alla stazione centrale e l'altra a Roma, in Piazza Vittorio Emanuele). Il ministro dell'Ambiente stesso, Gianluca Galletti, ha preso parte a questi eventi, insieme con il Sottosegretario per l'Ambiente Barbara Degani. Questo ci ha consentito di raggiungere una copertura mediatica significativa e di migliorare la sensibilizzazione dei cittadini di al problema.

I risultati dello scorso anno? 400.000 persone coinvolte in Italia, 800.000 in Europa. 21 tonnellate di rifiuti raccolti in Italia, 2.600 tonnellate in Europa.

La campagna Pulisci & Corri porta il nostro obiettivo a un livello ancor più alto. Non solo coinvolgeremo nuovamente il Ministero dell'Ambiente e altre portatori di interesse, ma vorremmo anche coinvolgere più cittadini nell’evento centrale. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di:

- Raccogliere quanti più rifiuti possibili nei 400 km di percorso

- Aumentare l'attenzione rivolta dai media al problema in modo da coinvolgere il maggior numero possibile di persone nell’ECUD, se non nell’evento centrale, per l'organizzazione di eventi nel loro territorio.

È per questo che abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute economically to our activity, no worries!! There are plenty of other things you can do.

For example, if you’re in Europe, you can organize your own clean-up activity! More info on: http://www.ewwr.eu/en/take_part/lets-clean-up-europe Otherwise, you can get information on the ongoing clean-up activities and participate. And don’t forget to send us a photo of you cleaning… This helps us spread the message!

Last but not least, whether you’re in Europe or not, you can share this campaign with your friends or acquaintances to help us spread the word!


(Italian version)

Se non sei in grado di contribuire economicamente alla nostra attività, non preoccuparti !! Ci sono un sacco di altre cose che puoi fare.

Ad esempio, se sei in Europa, puoi organizzare un’attività di clean-up tu stesso! Maggiori informazioni su: http://www.ewwr.eu/en/take_part/lets-clean-up-europe

Altrimenti, puoi ottenere informazioni sulle attività di pulizia già promosse e partecipare a una di quelle. E non dimenticate di inviarci una foto di voi mentre pulite il territorio! ... Anche questo contribuisce a diffondere il messaggio!

Ultimo ma non meno importante, che voi siate in Europa o meno, puoi condividere questa campagna con i tuoi amici e conoscenti ed aiutarci così a diffondere l’iniziativa!

siate in Europa o meno, puoi condividere questa campagna con i tuoi amici e
conoscenti ed aiutarci così a diffondere l’iniziativa!

story:
Save the Badgers!

This photo shows what happened after habitat was destroyed.

For over 12 years, our nonprofit in West Petaluma, CA, dedicated time and energy to save open space habitat for the American Badger.  We finally succeeded in saving the 11.22 Preserve in 2012.  This was after 5 years of opposing development on the land and then an add'l 6 years advocating for public funds from the County Open Space District - derived from a 1/4 cent sales tax we all paid into - to purchase the property and protect it forever for the wildlife and education and appreciation of natural areas.   Visit our web site to learn more about us.  We are an all volunteer grassroots nonprofit.  We helped save a 100-year-old habitat area with year-round Badger activity.

The same year the open space land was finally acquired, an adjacent 6-acre property (back half shown above - with habitat destruction photo)  with contiguous documented sensitive habitat went into foreclosure and was sold to new owners.  Despite our pleas to stop and calls to the CA Dept. of Fish and Wildlife, the owners intentionally hacked down the entire habitat area, including destroying an area where a female badger had burrowed 2010-2012, raising her young.  After that, illegal grading occurred with roads, further destruction, erection of nonclimb, nonpassable fencing, and installing night lighting - blocking the habitat, the wildlife movement area and destroying a quiet nocturnal area.  Then, horses, dogs and humans entered the area - with destruction complete.  This willful activity has resulted in displacement of all badgers from our area - leaving their 100-year-old habitat.  Badgers are sensitive mammals - they will not remain in an area where there is danger.  The badgers have now also fled from the protected open space land.  We are heartbroken.  And determined to act to protect the easement for conservation that was placed over the open space to protect the very conservation values that are now severely impacted.

The same owners who hacked down the habitat now propose to subdivide that property and add 2 lots after constructing a large multistoried house that dominates the hillside and area.  We want these owners held accountable for the severe destructon they've caused and we are raising funds for legal support to help us oppose the subdivision proposal. 

YOUR DONATION will help us retain an excellent environmental law firm to help us.  We must do all we can to both protect the open space land for which we worked for so long to save for the badgers and area wildlife and also require accountability for the intense destruction of habitat as well as restoration.  We seek to raise $2000 for our initial legal support.  All donations will go directly to this effort. (Our initial goal was $7000, but the response has been positive and swift from supporters who understand the gravity of what this destruction has done to the Paula Lane badgers - thank you.)  Help us today reach our new goal of $2000 so our legal fund is sufficient to address the destruction and seek accountability.

With badger spirit, we thank you for your consideration.  Time is of the essence.  Please help us help the American Badger.

story:
Summary

Malama Maui Nui - Community Work Day is an organization that was brought into my life a couple of years ago at a large event full of philanthropists, entrepreneurs, and truly Awesome people. A 4-day event of enlightenment, awareness, and passion to be part of the solution instead of continuing to be part of the problem. It was a truly life changing and eye opening weekend on every level for me. 

However, the final day of the event there was a moment that left myself and several others bewildered and through this moment, brought a deeper passion and a deeper connection to the work that needs to be done. 

After 4 days of 250, like-minded people, talking about being part of the solution and changing the world...there was a choice for everyone to make. They could go learn to surf or they could go and volunteer with the kids at the Ka Hale A Ke Ola homeless center, helping them plant a garden. 

As the head of the Community Work Day project, (who is one of the purest and most beautiful souls I have ever had the honor of meeting), stood in the lobby of a fancy Maui hotel.. holding a sign, beaming with excitement knowing how much this would encourage and inspire the kids of the KHAKO Homeless Center...She watched.  

One after the other, speakers, participants, crew members, piled into the buses headed off to the surf lessons, laughing and celebrating being on Maui. Though there is and was absolutely no judgment from anyone on the choice being made, there was a sudden drop in faith.

A lone girl working so hard every day to make a difference in others' lives, was left feeling like the kid that gets picked last for games in school. What would she tell the kids, when she came back alone. How would she stay strong when looking them in the eyes and telling them everyone went surfing instead. Her faith started to shake and her heart thumped harder as more and more people passed her by. 

Finally, a familiar face came to greet her, followed by another, and another. It was by no means a comparable amount to the people that chose to surf, but it was something. 

The people that chose to trust and go on this journey, were awakened to a world that is indescribable. When all was said and done, they left feeling accomplished, fulfilled and agreed that the moments with the kids and the land, were by far the best of the entire event.  These moments also had a lingering and life changing effect on the kids. The kids that still talk about the visit and would like to have more days like that. 

I, myself, was unfortunately too sick to get to be a part of this amazing day and I was so disappointed. However, that Christmas I was given the opportunity to help contribute in a way that again, taught me huge lessens and deepened my passion.

What started out as a push to simply get 8 more gifts donated to KHAKO so that every kid would get a present, quickly and very unexpectedly turned into a snowball of awesome. In 3 days, a small group of us accidentally managed to not only get so many presents donated that each kid got multiple gifts, but we also raised $1000 to be used for something that would have a lasting effect for the kids. 

After much debate of how the extra funds should be used, the kids finally spoke up. They asked for a new playground that was more like what other kids got to play on, vs their run down and hazardous jungle gym.

Ask, believe, receive. There was no discussion and the funds were immediately donated to helping build a playground and garden, happily. *Thank you to everyone that donated. 

This was just my personal introduction into Malama Maui Nui - Community Work Day. The organization goes so much deeper and is doing so much for Maui, Hawaii and the planet. In my eyes, they are so deserving of so much more recognition and support. 

For my first of at least 31 Random Acts of Aloha on my Birthday, I have created this indiegogo account to raise money to support Malama Maui Nui. I will be giving 100% of the donations to the organization and pledging to give at least 31 days of this year to volunteering with their projects, fundraisers, events and anywhere that I can. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking of you, to donate whatever you can, be it money, time or both. 

The minimum goal you can start an indiegogo account is $500. If you do not reach your goal, indiegogo takes 9% for fees. However, if you do reach your goal, they put back in 5% so that only 4% comes out of the total.

I have given this campaign 31 days until it expires. I have over 900 facebook friends. That means you don't even have to donate an entire dollar! If every one of my fb friends donated 50 cents! We would reach the min. limit.

However, this is me we are dealing with over here. We can Go Bigger. 

31 random acts of Aloha on my 31st birthday, 31 days until this campaign expires...hmm, what's the magic number...That's right. Let's shoot for $3100!

It would also be awesome if 31 of my friends chose to volunteer, even just 1 day, to any of the projects Malama Maui Nui offers.  

Please take the time to read what the organization is doing....

The Impact

Community Work Day...now Malama Maui Nui Community Work Day Program is a non-profit that has been around since 1991 whose mission is to facilitate programs that educate, inspire, and empower individuals and communities to beautify and maintain Maui Nui’s environment which supports our economy, health, quality of life and unique Hawaiian culture. Malama Maui Nui works on Environmental Education 23 Gardens in low-income communities School gardens on Maui, Molokai and Lani Marine Debris Cleanups (including large nets on the shoreline) Litter Pickups on 3 islands Household Battery Recycling Paint Recycling Tire Recycling Mālama ‘Āina Recycling events - recycling cardboard, newspaper, books, magazines, office paper, scrap metal, bicycles, lawn mowers, appliances, car batteries, household batteries, paint, cooking oil, eye glasses, hearing aids, and computer waste Uncovered Truck Law Demonstrations at Landfills with Maui Police Department Invasive Species Removal and Native Planting in Public Spaces Graffiti Removal and Highway Beautification Remote area appliance pick ups on Molokai, Maui and Lanai Dumpsite Clearing (Appliances & Trash) from all over these islands Homeless Camp Cleanups

CWD Stats from 2012

Trash Picked Up: 236,055 pounds

Beach cleanups- 245

Invasive Species Cleared: 371,020 pounds

Planted more than Native Species 8,136

Tires Recycled: 2,387

Vehicle Batteries Recycled: 1,372

Household Batteries Recyc: 73,555

Usable Paint Recycled: 6,643 gallons of paint

Helped people get Community Service Hours: 5,123

Picked up Appliances: 2,133

Wire Baskets: 521

Litter Barrels: 307

Trash Pickups from Groups: 72

Hot Spots Cleared: 364

Metal: Over 95,725 lbs cleaned from the land and recycled (+1,616 items – not weighed)

Outreach Events: 31 Community Recycling

Events: 8 School/Community

Gardens workdays with outdoor education: 114

 

There is a saying “He va’a he moku, he moku he va’a” It translates literally as, “The canoe is an island, an island a canoe.” Metaphorically, it means that everything you do...or DON’T do- impacts where we are going as an island. There are no forgotten people on the canoe...no one is left behind. We have to remember that we are all in this together. We are all a part of this island...and there can be no forgotten communities.

In 2011, CWD got a grant from the Center for Disease control- which was aimed to reduce health disparities among the communities that were considered “highest risk”. The “Highest risk” communities were all Native Hawaiian, Pacific Islander and low income communities. What we also found was that these same communities also had the highest rate of a long list of other things- from suicide rates, to incarcerations, depression to diabetes, school-drop out rates, drug use, teen-pregnancy, domestic abuse and the list goes on and on.

What was the commonality that connected all of these communities aside from the socio-economic? What was the thread that connected them all?. All of them lived in areas deemed “food deserts”...cut off from literally the very source of their life, their energy, their nourishment that this land provides. There are no community gardens, no Mana foods, there is literally no access to affordable locally grown food.

And we began to wonder what would happen to all of those statistics, all of those numbers if we fixed just that one piece that we COULD make an impact on? What would happen if we reawakened these roots. What would happen if we gave these communities the same access that other wealthier communities have to healthy organic food, to outdoor education and hands-on-learning, to safe spaces for building community?. What would happen to the childrens attention span in school if they were well nourished when they went to class each day? What would happen to the communities if they were woven together again by the very thread of life itself? “

We decided to find out...

CWD/Malama Maui Nui now has 23 gardens throughout the lowest income parts of the island, from the low-income schools to the homeless shelter. These gardens are growing more than just healthy food, they are growing healthy communities, they are growing healthy families, they are growing healthy keiki.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Giving money to a life changing cause is a great start, but it's just that. A start. We can and need to do more.

I know the people of Malama Maui Nui personally and how much blood, sweat and tears they have put into these projects.  They need your help! If you aren't able to give money, or you gave money and still want to do more.. PLEASE! Contact them and volunteer for at least one of the Community Work Day Projects. 

 

Here's a breakdown of our weekly schedule:

 

<3 Every Tuesday at the Ka hale a Ke ola Homeless resource center from 9-6pm

<3 Wednesdays starting new veggies, herbs, and fruit trees for the school and low income communities (MMN gives away over 1000 plants each month) 3361 omaopio rd in lower kula

<3 Thursdays starting new school and community gardens (next gardens are princess nahienaena school, Maui Youth and family services, and a edible/medicinal garden at Maui memorial hospital),

<3 Fridays beach clean ups and restoration work email for details
 

<3 Saturday native restorations at Laie wetlands in Kihei or at Honokowai valley

 

And many more ongoing projects that will be updated each month on our Facebook page

 

https://www.facebook.com/communityworkday

 

P.O. Box 757, Puunene, Hawaii 96784

(808) 877-2524

 

Mahalo for your Kokua.

story:
Our Story

Great Plains Restoration Council (GPRC) is headquartered in Houston, TX. GPRC became a formal 501(c) 3 non-profit organization in October 1999. GPRC was first founded in 1997 by Jarid Manos during prairie dog rescues while simultaneously working in physical therapy and exercise physiology to help people heal trauma, injury, and illness through holistic recovery approaches. Learn more about GPRC.


Mission Statement: Great Plains Restoration Council works to restore and protect our shattered prairies and plains through developing youth leaders in Ecological Health. Protecting wild nature is a matter of public health, and participating in its hands-on recovery offers therapeutic modalities for many social and physical ills.


Restoration Not Incarcerationï¿½ and Plains Youth InterACTIONï¿½: The Positive Health Impact for People and Prairies


Many young people have no idea that anything they do has any real cause or effect good or bad. ï¿½Things just happen.ï¿½ ï¿½The world just is.ï¿½ We treat our bodies and the planet as if itï¿½s all ï¿½just thereï¿½. And certainly, few damaged young people have any understanding that their own lives could ever make any positive change or difference to the world. When a young person produces a positive ripple effect of health by his or her own hands and mind for the very first time, a whole new world opens.


Serious conservation work: Not just involved in ï¿½busy workï¿½ at any location, GPRC participants produce targeted high value ecological benefits helping save and restore some of North Americaï¿½s rarest and most threatened or damaged ecosystems while simultaneously healing their own conflicts, threats and damage. The Greater Houston/Upper Texas Gulf Coast, Fort Worth, and the Southern High Plains hold some of these most threatened prairies.


Serious social work: Like twin strands of DNA, social work and ecological recovery and protection are intertwined. Supported by licensed master social workers, counselors, and mentors, youth and young adults who face multiple crises and trauma enter into a 3-tier Ecological Health training program certification process that first helps people stabilize their lives, then develop tools to thrive. See GPRCï¿½s trademarked Life Wheel for a diagram of this process.


Your support for the Upper Texas Gulf Coastal Prairie will not only help one of the rarest and most endangered places stay alive but provide training, re-entry, and life stabilization for struggling people locally as well as, eventually, nationally once we get the Visiting Service Learning component set up. 


Our Program: Restoration Not Incarcerationï¿½ (RNI)

Ages 17-25. RNI targets the restoration of Greater Houstonï¿½s endangered native coastal prairie ecosystem in conjunction with rehabilitation of juveniles and adults who have been incarcerated. Many are currently homeless. RNI is a prairies-and-people recovery effort and new Green Jobs training initiative being designed to ultimately train hundreds of ex-offenders, probationers, and inmates in working groups. Future replication of RNI is planned for other locations in the grassland regions of Texas and New Mexico. RNI will also at some point be potentially available for other U.S. regions/ecosystems.


Learn more about Restoration Not Incarceration.


How You Can Help

We are in danger of losing the last 1% of the Coastal Praire. But, with your help we can not only save but restore this Garden of Eden. Please help us raise funds to jumpstart a brand new Coastal Prairie refuge on the Gulf of Mexico for people and animals.


PLEASE DONATE TODAY. We canï¿½t do this without you. Foundation giving has decreased across the board, and great healing and deep social change will only be built with your help now.


Be sure and claim your perk! Or if you would prefer to not receive a perk and have the full donation go to GPRC, please note that in the Optional Message field when checking out.


All donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.


PLEASE ALSO SPREAD THE WORD.  SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY, CO-WORKERS, CHURCH OR OTHER PLACES OF WORSHIP, AND OTHERS.


Itï¿½s easy to set up a group and raise a larger amount of money together as a shared goal. 

This is a fun way to give back, and also brings people together in service, which is a great thing for everybody.


And please donï¿½t forget to use Facebook and Twitter. The Internet can be a powerful tool for social change and we need your help in utilizing its potential.


Ecological Health is the interdependent health of people, animals and ecosystems, and we want to make sure everybody has the opportunity to be part of this exciting rebirth!


More Details about the Conservation Purchase of Virgin Coastal Prairie Urban Remnant + Saltwater Country Tour: $15,000


Directly adjacent to Esteban Park is a rare remnant of high-quality native coastal prairie thatï¿½s in need of protection. We are working to acquire, permanently protect and add this site onto the Park. Your support will not only help us buy and protect the incredible richness and priceless biodiversity of this remnant Coastal Prairie site for people of all colors, cultures and communities, but secure this critical seed source for restoration efforts as we race to save the coastal prairie ecosystem from extinction. (Only 1% of the original coastal prairie remains alive!) 


A 24 x 24 bronze plaque at the entrance to the Virgin Prairie will be dedicated permanently in your name or to that of a loved one. 

?

PLUS: 


A PERSONAL GULF COAST TOUR:

Also included is an all-expenses paid 2 day, 1 night personal tour through GPRCï¿½s Saltwater Country project area on the Upper Texas Gulf Coast, including the National Wildlife Refuges, where the prairie meets the sea, wild bison and red wolves used to roam, and countless migrating birds still come through each year. 

This area is rich in human culture as well that includes Karankawa and other native people, Spanish Conquistadors, the legendary Esteban the Moor, Anglo settlers, and longtime Creole/black history and Zydeco music. 


Message from Jarid Manos, Founder & CEO, Great Plains Restoration Council

So, letï¿½s do this together. Letï¿½s have LESS SADNESS and MORE EXHILARATION.


Nothing is more powerful than getting healthy and giving back.


A lot of us accept the future as ï¿½inevitable doomï¿½, but we are working with you right here right now to show that even our next breath, our very next action, may ripple across 5,000 years with life and health.


Thanks so much. ECOLOGICAL HEALTH IS FOR EVERYONE. Even a year from now, you wonï¿½t believe how much difference your donation and your support would have made.


See you in the new millennium ï¿½ where we are not accepting loss and destruction but rebuilding our lives and civilization as part of Nature, like science fiction coming into real life.


P.S. Donï¿½tï¿½ forget to Tweet and Facebook about this campaign and your efforts regularly, including posting any updates or information or news you want to share or feel may be helpful. The more the betterï¿½getting the word out will make all the difference!!


Once again, thank you for caring about Earth and our childrenï¿½s health and future, and thank you for walking alongside us as we work to get to a healthier place and time. There may be a lot of chaos and sadness in the world, but hands-on work right now can help heal and inspire people like never before.


GPRC Volunteers Crew

Call 832-598-GPRC (4772) to join the GPRC Volunteers Crew. Your help is much appreciated!
story_txt:
Our Story


Great Plains Restoration Council (GPRC) is headquartered in Houston, TX. GPRC became a formal 501(c) 3 non-profit organization in October 1999. GPRC was first founded in 1997 by Jarid Manos during prairie dog rescues while simultaneously working in physical therapy and exercise physiology to help people heal trauma, injury, and illness through holistic recovery approaches. Learn more about GPRC.

Mission Statement: Great Plains Restoration Council works to restore and protect our shattered prairies and plains through developing youth leaders in Ecological Health. Protecting wild nature is a matter of public health, and participating in its hands-on recovery offers therapeutic modalities for many social and physical ills.

Restoration Not Incarcerationï¿½ and Plains Youth InterACTIONï¿½: The Positive Health Impact for People and Prairies

Many young people have no idea that anything they do has any real cause or effect good or bad. ï¿½Things just happen.ï¿½ ï¿½The world just is.ï¿½ We treat our bodies and the planet as if itï¿½s all ï¿½just thereï¿½. And certainly, few damaged young people have any understanding that their own lives could ever make any positive change or difference to the world. When a young person produces a positive ripple effect of health by his or her own hands and mind for the very first time, a whole new world opens.

Serious conservation work: Not just involved in ï¿½busy workï¿½ at any location, GPRC participants produce targeted high value ecological benefits helping save and restore some of North Americaï¿½s rarest and most threatened or damaged ecosystems while simultaneously healing their own conflicts, threats and damage. The Greater Houston/Upper Texas Gulf Coast, Fort Worth, and the Southern High Plains hold some of these most threatened prairies.

Serious social work: Like twin strands of DNA, social work and ecological recovery and protection are intertwined. Supported by licensed master social workers, counselors, and mentors, youth and young adults who face multiple crises and trauma enter into a 3-tier Ecological Health training program certification process that first helps people stabilize their lives, then develop tools to thrive. See GPRCï¿½s trademarked Life Wheel for a diagram of this process.

Your support for the Upper Texas Gulf Coastal Prairie will not only help one of the rarest and most endangered places stay alive but provide training, re-entry, and life stabilization for struggling people locally as well as, eventually, nationally once we get the Visiting Service Learning component set up. 



Our Program: Restoration Not Incarcerationï¿½ (RNI)



Ages 17-25. RNI targets the restoration of Greater Houstonï¿½s endangered native coastal prairie ecosystem in conjunction with rehabilitation of juveniles and adults who have been incarcerated. Many are currently homeless. RNI is a prairies-and-people recovery effort and new Green Jobs training initiative being designed to ultimately train hundreds of ex-offenders, probationers, and inmates in working groups. Future replication of RNI is planned for other locations in the grassland regions of Texas and New Mexico. RNI will also at some point be potentially available for other U.S. regions/ecosystems.

Learn more about Restoration Not Incarceration.



How You Can Help


We are in danger of losing the last 1% of the Coastal Praire. But, with your help we can not only save but restore this Garden of Eden. Please help us raise funds to jumpstart a brand new Coastal Prairie refuge on the Gulf of Mexico for people and animals.

PLEASE DONATE TODAY. We canï¿½t do this without you. Foundation giving has decreased across the board, and great healing and deep social change will only be built with your help now.

Be sure and claim your perk! Or if you would prefer to not receive a perk and have the full donation go to GPRC, please note that in the Optional Message field when checking out.



All donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.


PLEASE ALSO SPREAD THE WORD.  SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY, CO-WORKERS, CHURCH OR OTHER PLACES OF WORSHIP, AND OTHERS.

Itï¿½s easy to set up a group and raise a larger amount of money together as a shared goal. 
This is a fun way to give back, and also brings people together in service, which is a great thing for everybody.

And please donï¿½t forget to use Facebook and Twitter. The Internet can be a powerful tool for social change and we need your help in utilizing its potential.



Ecological Health is the interdependent health of people, animals and ecosystems, and we want to make sure everybody has the opportunity to be part of this exciting rebirth!





More Details about the Conservation Purchase of Virgin Coastal Prairie Urban Remnant + Saltwater Country Tour: $15,000









Directly adjacent to Esteban Park is a rare remnant of high-quality native coastal prairie thatï¿½s in need of protection. We are working to acquire, permanently protect and add this site onto the Park. Your support will not only help us buy and protect the incredible richness and priceless biodiversity of this remnant Coastal Prairie site for people of all colors, cultures and communities, but secure this critical seed source for restoration efforts as we race to save the coastal prairie ecosystem from extinction. (Only 1% of the original coastal prairie remains alive!) 









A 24 x 24 bronze plaque at the entrance to the Virgin Prairie will be dedicated permanently in your name or to that of a loved one. 




?




PLUS: 









A PERSONAL GULF COAST TOUR:
 Also included is an all-expenses paid 2 day, 1 night personal tour through GPRCï¿½s Saltwater Country project area on the Upper Texas Gulf Coast, including the National Wildlife Refuges, where the prairie meets the sea, wild bison and red wolves used to roam, and countless migrating birds still come through each year. 

This area is rich in human culture as well that includes Karankawa and other native people, Spanish Conquistadors, the legendary Esteban the Moor, Anglo settlers, and longtime Creole/black history and Zydeco music. 

Message from Jarid Manos, Founder & CEO, Great Plains Restoration Council



So, letï¿½s do this together. Letï¿½s have LESS SADNESS and MORE EXHILARATION.

Nothing is more powerful than getting healthy and giving back.

A lot of us accept the future as ï¿½inevitable doomï¿½, but we are working with you right here right now to show that even our next breath, our very next action, may ripple across 5,000 years with life and health.

Thanks so much. ECOLOGICAL HEALTH IS FOR EVERYONE. Even a year from now, you wonï¿½t believe how much difference your donation and your support would have made.

See you in the new millennium ï¿½ where we are not accepting loss and destruction but rebuilding our lives and civilization as part of Nature, like science fiction coming into real life.

P.S. Donï¿½tï¿½ forget to Tweet and Facebook about this campaign and your efforts regularly, including posting any updates or information or news you want to share or feel may be helpful. The more the betterï¿½getting the word out will make all the difference!!


Once again, thank you for caring about Earth and our childrenï¿½s health and future, and thank you for walking alongside us as we work to get to a healthier place and time. There may be a lot of chaos and sadness in the world, but hands-on work right now can help heal and inspire people like never before.


GPRC Volunteers Crew



Call 832-598-GPRC (4772) to join the GPRC Volunteers Crew. Your help is much appreciated!

story:
Our Story 

My big-hearted, rescue German Shepherd, Fassbinder, was unexpectedly diagnosed with cancer this month.  Fassbinder has B-cell lymphoma -- which is not a death sentence.  With 6 months of chemotherapy he has a 90% chance of complete remission.  

He's been a major part of my life.  In 2012, I was raped.  When I reported my assault to the police, I started receiving threats.  I rescued a German Shepherd for my own protection.  In the past two years, he's deterred crime twice -- the second time was with a burglar.  With chemotherapy he can enjoy a high standard of living -- I feel a complete sense of duty to help save his life. 


Just today, I drove behind a bumper sticker -- a paw print -- that asked, "Who adopted who?"  And as cliche as that sounds, it might be an important maxim for assault recovery.

Caring for another life forces you to adopt a routine and function again -- it gives you something to live for, and in my case -- it was the determining factor to end my depression.

But Fassbinder also benefitted:  he learned structure and was adopted into a loving home.  Large breeds are often the first to be killed at overcrowded shelters -- and I purposefully chose a dog on death-row, with a high-kill rate.  Fassbinder was given a second chance at life.

Now he needs another chance. 

       

The Goal is Complete Remission...

All funds from this campaign contribute to helping Fassbinder attain complete remission.  Staying on schedule is essential to reach this goal.  Timing is everything.

Here is a copy of the protocol outlined by his oncologists, Dr. Rosenberg and Dr. Turner at Veterinary Cancer Group. (click on Gallery)


    What has been accomplished…

    Fassbinder has begun chemotherapy -- he's doing great!

    I have contributed $3000 for his treatment from savings, picking up extra shifts at work, busting ass, etc.  $3000, essentially took care of staging (where they assess type of cancer, run tests, ultrasound etc) and the first chemotherapy treatment.  

    Any amount given goes immediately to his care.     

       

    Most importantly, Fassbinder is feeling great!  

    Here he is all-smiles, yesterday, 10 weeks into chemo.  He has such bright spirits and tremendous energy!  I can't thank everyone enough who has helped us get here!  It's heartwarming!  Such a happy dog!!
