story:
Short Summary

I’m Mason, a recent college graduate from Florida who has fallen in love with adventure.  Throughout college I would forgo internship and job opportunities to ride my bicycle across the country, always raising money for a great cause.  Now that I’m graduated, I want to continue this journey! 

This summer/fall, I will be competing in the annual 2,750 mile Great Divide Bicycle Race from Banff, Canada to Antelope Wells, New Mexico.  The trip is almost entirely off-road, completely self-supported, and awesome as heck!

Once I reach the finish line, I turn due north and venture on a 7,000 mile “loop” of the American west, through 26 stunning national parks.

Since no one has ever cycled through more than a dozen national parks at one time, I want to take the opportunity of being the first person to write an illustrated storybook on such an enormous bike journey focused around national parks.

I’ve realized that the American idea of creating national parks is completely unique and revolutionary for a country.  These parks embody the values of purpose, liberty, and democracy better than any legislation or governmental constraint. 

As Americans and non-Americans alike, these parks are ours to enjoy, cherish, and share forever.  Help me make them famous!

What Your Investment Will Go Towards

Being a college student who loves to travel on an extremely low budget, I think I am close to the definition of frugality and resourcefulness. 

Some of the funds raised will go towards my expenses for the journey, which work out to be less than $10/day.  I’ve estimated about a $2,000 budget for the trip starting on June 14 and ending sometime in the late fall.

The rest of the funds will go straight towards the publications of the book I plan to write about the journey and the national parks.

The Impact

If you’ve ever read a travel blog, storybook, or explorative journey entries, you know they contain exciting stories in exotic places, making twists and turns that only real life could conjure.  These types of books are real, rugged, and inspiring.  Knowing that they’re non-fiction help readers to dream of their own adventures they could have.  So, help me write this wonderfully illustrated book that will be sure to inspire people to go outdoors and see this beautiful country!

I’ve done a few other long-distance rides (Alaska to Florida, Florida to Maine) that have all proved to give me a plethora of book-worthy material.  This ride should be all the more abundant.  

The beauty of the National Park System is that it was manifested, campaigned, and accomplished by normal folks like you and me, and it will take people like us to continue their existence, enjoyment, and impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don’t think you can help, that’s okay!  I WILL do what I set out to do, that’s not a problem.  All I can say is go out and enjoy the great outdoors.  The splendid beautiful of nature is well worth our time.  I’ll leave you with these words from Our National Parks by John Muir:

“Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop off like autumn leaves.”

How to Follow

I’ll be updating tis Facebook page daily with videos, pictures, and posts.

www.facebook.com/CrossTheDivideRace2013

story:
AFRICAN WILD DOG CONSERVANCY

Please help Kenyans save Endangered African wild dogs and the homeland they share!

 

Join us in saying NO to extinction!

The African Wild Dog Conservancy (AWD Conservancy) is raising money to help schools start wildlife clubs in a remote and much-neglected region in the North East Province in Kenya. Working with local people, we discovered a new wild dog population – unknown to the international conservation community, that is!  With only about 3,000 to 5,500 left in the wild, these highly intelligent,  social animals face extinction, if we don't get it right. So this discovery is a big deal and we couldn't have done it without the help of the people living with them. Now they are asking us to help them teach their kids about protecting and saving their homeland, so we are launching this campaign.

 

Who we are

Started in 2003, the AWD Conservancy is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to working with local communities, and national and international stakeholders to conserve wild dogs through scientific research and education. Co-directors, Dr. Bob Robbins and Dr. Kim McCreery (that's us!), got hooked on wild dogs back in 1991 when we pulled up stakes, moved to Zimbabwe, and conducted a nine-year conservation and natural history study in Hwange National Park. Since then, we've never looked back. 

 

Make a difference!

Helping local schools start wildlife clubs is part of our ongoing community-based conservation initiative in Kenya. With Education Program Director, Hussein Haji (below in a makoro on the Tana River) in place, we are asking for your help in expanding our education program to reach more children. Please help us nurture the seeds of change.

 

Here's Kim at an AWD Conservancy training workshop providing primary school teachers with a lesson plan and materials on the web of life; of course, that includes the important role African wild dogs as well as other predators play.

Please help us help these students and their teachers start wildlife clubs to give them the chance to learn about the remarkable diversity of animals and plants that exist in their own backyard, and launch conservation projects in this internationally recognized Biodiversity Hotspot. 

 

By placing wild dogs in a larger environmental context, our aim is to inform and inspire these students to protect and work to restore their homeland, and that includes conserving "eye durs" (aka African wild dogs). The importance of culture, tradition, and local educators informing this evolving program cannot be overemphasized. Training will continue for the education program director (that's Bob and Hussein below!) who has been with us for almost five years.

 

What we need

To run the educational program, here’s what we’ll do with that money:

  • $9,000: Local salaries. Staff travels to village schools to give wildlife club education presentations and nature shows (DVDs), delivers lesson plans and project materials to teachers, engages parents, elders and local government officials, oversees wildlife club program/educational outreach.
    $1,200: Transport. Area is remote and quite rugged with NO paved roads. Travel is by bus, motorcycle, mutatu (local minivan) and, when it floods, makoro. Fuel is expensive.
  • $2,800: Develop bioculturally relevant materials, activities, curricula, and applied projects. Includes laminated color photos, interactive games, coloring books, and wild dog masks, as well as funding for tree planting projects as requested by local teachers.
  • $300: Telecommunications.
  • $1730: Indiegogo and perk fulfillment.

Other ways you can help

If you feel that you aren't in a position to contribute, you can still help:

  • Please ask folks to spread the word far and wide!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Short Summary

Mahatma Gandi once said “Be the change you wish to see in the world”. Our goal is to live true to that statement. We are Brad Ryland, Trevor Aucoin, and Caroline Rossi, three average but incredibly passionate and adventurous twenty-somethings from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. This November we will be traveling for two weeks from Baton Rouge to the “Golden Triangle” Delhi, Agra, and Jaipur India to get a true idea of what daily life in India is really like. What started out as a vacation among friends to an exotic location has turned in to so much more! The realization is that poverty and the lack of access to clean water in India is a huge issue, but a solvable one. We are setting out on this incredible journey to create a documentary depicting daily life in India and bring global awareness to the issues that over 29 percent of the population face living below the poverty line. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your contributions to fund the making of our documentary and aid us to bring global awareness to a worthy  cause. We estimate that we need $3000 to make this a true success. 35% of the money raised will go directly to our charity: water campaign which will fund projects on the ground in India to provide much needed access to clean, sanitary water and bathing facilities. The rest of the money will go toward the expenses of traveling and filming in India as well as the purchase of necessary equipment and film festival entrance fees. 

What You Get

We have different tiers of rewarding gifts for every level of funding and support from our generous and outstanding donors. 

Please check out the "Perks" section on the right hand side and click on the perk you'd like to receive. Help us make a difference. 

The Impact

 It’s easy for us to forget that there are still parts of the world that need our aid because it isn’t staring us in the face every day. We have the luxury of not living that reality daily. Unfortunately, this is the reality of over 29% of India’s population who live below the poverty line. That’s over 368 million people, or more than the entire population of the United States. 

Right now in India there are people, families, children who lack access to proper sanitation, who suffer from malnutrition and unhygienic living conditions. Over 927 million of them! Even worse, more than 9 percent of India’s population lacks access to water. Period. That’s over 111 million people, people who have to bathe in, cook with, and even drink unclean water that they had to walk for up to 3 hours just to get. Water that is killing them but it’s the only thing they have, but it doesn’t have to be.

Our documentary aims at capturing the daily life of the Indian people in hopes of raising awareness globally of the striking poverty issue that a majority of the population faces daily yet somehow they manage to maintain a positive and infectiously spiritual outlook on life. In the process, we’d like to raise as much money as possible to solve the issue of unclean drinking water in this vibrant, and spirited country. Please donate as much money as you can to help us make a difference in the lives of these children and families. 35% of the money raised from this campaign will go to our charity: water campaign to fund a project in the field to bring access to clean, sanitary water. Together we can be the change we wish to see.

Check out our charity: water campaign page here along with all the other great information and resources that charity: water has including the video featured on this page. 

http://my.charitywater.org/documenting-change-the-golden-triangle

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. 

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share our story and our campaign on Facebook & Twitter. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We are setting out on this incredible journey to create a documentary depicting daily life in India and bring global awareness to the issues that over 29 percent of the population face living below the poverty line. What We Need & What You GetWe need your contributions to fund the making of our documentary and aid us to bring global awareness to a worthy  cause. We estimate that we need $3000 to make this a true success. 35% of the money raised will go directly to our charity: water campaign which will fund projects on the ground in India to provide much needed access to clean, sanitary water and bathing facilities. The rest of the money will go toward the expenses of traveling and filming in India as well as the purchase of necessary equipment and film festival entrance fees. What You GetWe have different tiers of rewarding gifts for every level of funding and support from our generous and outstanding donors. Please check out the "Perks" section on the right hand side and click on the perk you'd like to receive. Help us make a difference. The Impact It’s easy for us to forget that there are still parts of the world that need our aid because it isn’t staring us in the face every day. We have the luxury of not living that reality daily. Unfortunately, this is the reality of over 29% of India’s population who live below the poverty line. That’s over 368 million people, or more than the entire population of the United States. Right now in India there are people, families, children who lack access to proper sanitation, who suffer from malnutrition and unhygienic living conditions. Over 927 million of them! Even worse, more than 9 percent of India’s population lacks access to water. Period. That’s over 111 million people, people who have to bathe in, cook with, and even drink unclean water that they had to walk for up to 3 hours just to get. Water that is killing them but it’s the only thing they have, but it doesn’t have to be.Our documentary aims at capturing the daily life of the Indian people in hopes of raising awareness globally of the striking poverty issue that a majority of the population faces daily yet somehow they manage to maintain a positive and infectiously spiritual outlook on life. In the process, we’d like to raise as much money as possible to solve the issue of unclean drinking water in this vibrant, and spirited country. Please donate as much money as you can to help us make a difference in the lives of these children and families. 35% of the money raised from this campaign will go to our charity: water campaign to fund a project in the field to bring access to clean, sanitary water. Together we can be the change we wish to see.Check out our charity: water campaign page here along with all the other great information and resources that charity: water has including the video featured on this page. http://my.charitywater.org/documenting-change-the-golden-triangleOther Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share our story and our campaign on Facebook & Twitter. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Introduction

Shalom,my name is Florine Gabai as the founder of GB I am totally comitted to building clean tech communities in Israel. What does that mean? After virtually growing up in real estate and intensively tracking the effects of land development and building in Israel I came to  conclusions that demanded action. Action so people can sleep well, action to revoultionize clean tech and set a global example, and action to let people live their dreams.

We at "Gisma Bracha" are working to create a unique platform for CleanTech in Israel, by providing housing, employment and a cutting-edge "green" community in one complex.(see the Hammurabi- Stockholm model)

By joining hands with us at this critical point, you will make a significant contribution to building the necessary infrastructure in planning, letigation and interfacing with gov't agencies and cleantech.   With seed funding,   Bs"d we'll build a better future in Israel and  world-wide!

"Gisma Bracha"   is an exciting high potential win-win project that people like you can make happen!

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need?

We have been developing of the foundations for almost a year and our budget is about expired. We need the time to finish what we started. To do it right costs money,even building a site, creating brochures, or a short video when done professionally are expensive.
Requirements:

Administrative assistant's -  function is to create  Initial contact with CEO's & gov't officials & scheduling meetings this is challenging and time consuming. It requires personal contacts and networking and simply not giving up. Our representatives have met and started negotiating with high level officials in the Israel land Authority, Ministry of Construction and Housing, members of the Knesset, local municipal officials including engineers and CFO and a variety of politicians at the executive level, Ministry of the development of the Negev and Galilee, CEO's of leading innovative clean tech companies, consultations with professional PR, economists, financing, experts etc.

Litigation -  whose job is to draw up  Contracts, M.O.U's, business bureaucracy etc. and make sure we do everything by the book.

Public relations - including social network upkeep,  develop & manage site, press releases & other necessary content, PR strategy, soon a short video.

Gov't permits etc.  Permits, taxes, registration, land issues, meetings etc….

Engineer - Architect  General and specific plans that gov't & others will require stage 2

Financial Services - CPA & business strategist, staff management, basic research etc.

Office expenses -  Rent, utilities, etc.  Besides  Traveling, advertising, human resourcing, etc.

At GB we are confident that we will achieve our immediate funding goals as well as our final mission. If we do not recieve the entire cost from stage one of crowdfunding, then we will launch additional stages & simutaneously approach other financing avenues. Every contribution will be used fully.

What You Get?

  •  Personal invitation to the opening ceremony
  • VIP seating 
  •  A "Gold Key" to the project
  •  Life membership 
  •  Periodic insider updates
  •  Sense of true satisfaction & pride by making a difference

    The Impact

    What impact will solar cars, energy efficient building*- residential and commercial, advanced recycling (for example gray- water treatment), and much more have on the global environmental crisis?
    What impact will a sustainable income and affordable housing have on strengthening Israeli society?

    *47% of energy consumpstion is  in buildings world-wide!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    • Remind GB supporters to use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Organize your community to become members.
    • Send us contact information on clean tech companies and investors.
    • Offer your talents - editing, site up keep, bloggers, etc.

    *** Our site is under construction.

story:
We’re building a new house for Naco, a 75 year old jungle-based Brazilian artist who really needs a new home. After 2 months of work we’ve designed the house, put down foundations and walls using a traditional compressed clay technique - help us finish our project!

“Bom Vindo a Arte Na Mata - A casa de Naco Salles - Telepathico, presidente do mundo e Policia Spiritual”

That’s how Naco introduces himself and when he takes a break from persuading world leaders to live in peace, he follows his passion of sculpting.


The fortune hasn’t always been on Naco’s side. After losing his three bars and a mule-powered transportation company in Sao Paulo he turned to alcohol, which caused him to lose the love of his friends and family and eventually he had to leave the city in search of a new place.

Recently he found a modest shelter within the property of a eco-jungle resort just out of Itacare, Bahia, Brazil. His little shack is divided between an art workshop and simple sleeping space. It’s very small and with the humidity of the Brazilian jungle also very mouldy. 


His living conditions are very harsh but he continues to create hundreds of pieces of art, working hard every day.


Naco probably never dreamed of what was coming for him - or perhaps he knew it all along?

About 5 years ago a Swiss guy kicked a garbage bin, which - as it happens - was filled with concrete, so he broke his foot on the spot.

This little incident led to an unpredictable chain-reaction which would eventually lead 12 optimists into the jungle of Itacare, Brazil in order to build a house.

Initialiy the group came together to build a self-sustainable Earthship with plans, designs and financial support but the Brazilian ways of life changed all the plans fundamentally. The Earthship project fell apart but soon after we heard Naco’s story and from the existing motivation the Naco-Art-House project begun.


And there we were! In the back of Naco’s little shack bringing the news that we’re going to build a new home for him.

Over the past five months we designed, financed and built it all by ourselves. 


Seeing the old man shine with thankfulness has given us motivation and energy to find ourselves in this foreign culture, to source natural materials and keep building the house day after day - with the unconventional but very cheap technique of compressed clay.

Now the foundations are up and we’ve almost finished all the walls. It’s time to cover the house with a roof and work on the interiors. We’re really close to giving Naco a really special place to live and finishing the process of turning his luck around!

We’ll use the funds to buy remaining materials, windows, furniture, kitchen equipment for Naco and some food for the team. The most important thing is the roof - it really rains a lot here!



An exclusive selection of good vibe from Naco. See on the side!



Risks & Challenges

One real problem we may face is that it doesn’t stop raining in the jungle for the next two months. We’ve already had some delays due to the weather, but we’ve also learned how to deal with this and once the roof is complete we’ll be quite weather independent.

story:
NEW YEARS RESOLUTION FROM REVEREND BILLY 

We resolve to offer the fossil burning world more Pussy Riots, Edward Snowdens and Chelsea Mannings, Arctic 30 and Sea Shepherd sailings, Spiderwomen Shard-climbings and Tim DeChristopher biddings and Gezi Park tree-defendings. This year acts of earthy courage will appear on continent after continent, as if we are shouting out to one another from different parts of a burning building that with enough shouts will douse the flames and cool the wetlands.

We resolve that our rebellions from within the ranks of the old human arsonist will make Earth-defending and nation-building one in the same; social justice and Earth justice the same thing. 

We resolve that we re-up our courage this year - but that our courage have generosity in it, not only ferocity. If young parents find themselves taking jobs as riot police, may we appeal to them through their armor and find them laughing and singing our songs. Do I hear an Earthalujah!

We resolve that middle management fossil bankers will become Earthers because their children are made of nothing but Earth. This year let children run forward skipping and shouting into the Climate Movement, playing hookie from the false excellence of constant testing and re-enter the Earth, penetrating as kids can - climbing and gyrating and hopping into the front gates of coal power, the escalators to Monsanto offices, the mysteries of the fossil hedge funds. 

We resolve above all that this year we release the Earth's horrific extinction report into the Climate Movement. This year the Earth itself will scream the science into the hearts of the fossil politicians. May black rhinos and dodo birds and a tasmanian wolves break out of the extinction zoo and run straight into the nightmares of the sleeping fossil investors. This year may Sequioa seedlings ruin their cocktail parties, served by caterers who love forests.

We resolve that this year, where-ever Earth-killers turn, there we will be, window-washing, 'puter hacking, pole-dancing, directing traffic. We're tonight's entertainment! We're Earth children who came to play and our play gets in your way! 

This year, where-ever they turn, there we will be, working for the Earth. Earthalujah!


***

We are working for the Earth every day - will you help us?

Your tax-deductible donation pays for:

  • Ongoing Legal Support
  • Mask materials, repairs & hairspray
  • Food and travel expenses
  • A small, but needed, website and database remodel
  • Phone and Internet expenses
  • Per diems for volunteers when we travel

story:
And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth. Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen. (Matthew 28:18-20)

Short Summary

Dear friends and family,

I love how the passage says, “Go therefore and make disciples” and how the passage ends with “I am with you always.” God has given us the ability to spread the “Good News” (Mark 15), promising that He will be with us as we do so.

God has laid upon my heart to be a special part of spreading the “Good News” to those who have not heard of Jesus Christ and His plan of salvation.

A group of individuals with the same passion will be venturing to Costa Rica March 20 - 31, to share the Gospel to the Ticos (natives of Costa Rice). I pray that God will bless us as we plan for this mission trip. Also, I pray that the people of Costa Rica will be willing and eager to hear the Gospel, and be blessed by the Holy Spirit through our efforts.

During our mission trip to Costa Rica, our team will be holding evangelistic meetings and also providing programs for the children to learn about Jesus. We will build relationships with the Ticos and spend time in prayer, asking for God's guidance in winning souls for Jesus.

Both the North Pacific Union Conference and the NPUC missions are sponsoring the Costa Rica Mission trip.

 

Mission trip includes:

Speaker at one of 48 sites in Costa Rica

Preaching/Teaching the Bible

Outreach options with the area I will be located

 

What is needed for the trip?

First of all, your prayers

Volunteering does come with a price of - $1,400.00

The price includes airfare, lodging, and accommodations

All funds will be used for the mission trip.

  

How you can give

200 people donate $7

100 people donate $14

  50 people donate $28

  35 people donate $40

  20 people donate $70

  10 people donate $140

    5 people donate $280

 

The Impact

The purpose of the mission is to share the love of Christ and invest in the lives of those who live in Costa Rica.

I pray for your support whether it is through prayer or financially.

 

Thank you for your help in this worthy cause!

God bless,

Daniel Vierra, Jr.

story:
Help us create a less trashy world. In a world in search of green solutions and sustainability, our friends the Earthworms are Nature’s Little Recyclers. They can take organic wastes of all kinds and convert them into rich organic compost, nutrient rich organic fertilizers, and they can even provide food for fish and poultry. With a little care and attention, Earthworms can recycle trash from restaurants, homes, farms, and even municipal operations in cities like Chicago and New Orleans.  Nature’s Little Recyclers Earthworm Nursery seeks to provide great resources for our growing green society.


Paganics is a start-up company that is seeking to bring Nature and High Tech together, to answer the needs for a sustainable future, creating quality products and services, and developing long-term jobs for as many people as possible.  We have rented space in The Plant, one of the leading Urban Vertical Farming Projects located in Chicago, IL.  With this space, we have the ability to reach thousands of people to help them understand the power of Nature’s Little Recyclers to serve us in improving the quality of life.

With your help, we can begin this project.  We are seeking funds to use the 600 square feet of space to establish 60 – thirty gallon bins on a 3 tiered shelving system.  We also want to incorporate harvesters, worm tea brewers, and two tables of testing equipment. This will allow us to breed our first line of earthworms, and will also produce the needed worms for our test bins in other parts of the country. Further, we will be able to offer educational materials to schools, community centers, and ecology programs in Chicago and in other cities. We will provide students with ecological training, as well as green jobs. This is one of the many advantages of being part of a great start-up like The Plant.

Your contribution will help us to develop our earthworm breeding bins and associated equipment, and agricultural and public educational services.  This will help us to produce new green jobs as we scale up operations.

How we are different from other Earthworm Breeders.

Our Unique Position: In the world of Vermiculturists and Vermicomposters, little is being done to follow and accurately record breeding lines of various earthworm species,  including information on how well they breed or their rate of consumption. At this time, red worms are basically generic.  In addition, many vermicomposters who sell castings and worm tea often do not have accurate information on what their product is comprised of in terms of microbes, nutrients or minerals.  This can result in poor growth and lower yields, which will undermine consumer confidence in green products and solutions.

 Paganics plans to acquire and use informational technology to follow lines of red worms (and later other species) from cocoon to death. We will be using QR codes, tracking systems, and Adaptive Database technology, so that our worms can be tracked and measured.  With these tools, various events such as heat or cold die-offs, drought conditions, diseases, etc. and the effects of such on the bins/runs/windrows involved can be recorded.  Over time this will lead to a deeper understanding about earthworms and their growing conditions. This will allow the field to expand its information base and provide advanced breeding and cultivation techniques.

By testing the various composts, castings and teas, Paganics can also show which foods will result in the best fertilizer, and allow us to create a line of 100% organic products that will adapt to different agricultural purposes. Measuring every aspect and recording them in a searchable database will allow a useful knowledge base to improve the overall ability for vermiculturalists and vermicomposters to create a quality product.

Your contributions will help to create a space that is accessible and can be managed effectively to provide worm breeding, primarily red worms (Eisenia fetida) and measure their various outputs in form of cocoons and castings.  We will be able to test various types of foods and organic materials to gain accurate measurements of the rate of consumption.  We will also be able to provide reliable lab testing of worm castings and worm teas composition, in order to provide focused information of our products for the end consumer. This lab would test not just the bins on site but also receive samples from other bins around the country.

Sharing the Data using the Internet

As we develop our Nature’s Little Recyclers Earthworm Nursery, we will create a website that will allow all of our customers to acquire more information directly, including unique identifiers for the earthworms they receive from us. In this way, we can use the power of social media and crowd sourced knowledge to make information available to everyone who is interested.

All contributors will receive access to the new website, and be able to follow our long term projects. Whether you are looking for compost, fertilizer, or want to raise your own earthworms, we will provide information and new data, as well as interesting projects including videos, research findings, and the latest available information.

I have added a new perk as wella s stretch goals in my updates. check them out by clicking here.

Your contribution will help us to develop our earthworm breeding bins and associated equipment, and agricultural and public educational services.  This will help us to produce new green jobs as we scale up operations.  How we are different from other Earthworm Breeders. Our Unique Position: In the world of Vermiculturists and Vermicomposters, little is being done to follow and accurately record breeding lines of various earthworm species,  including information on how well they breed or their rate of consumption. At this time, red worms are basically generic.  In addition, many vermicomposters who sell castings and worm tea often do not have accurate information on what their product is comprised of in terms of microbes, nutrients or minerals.  This can result in poor growth and lower yields, which will undermine consumer confidence in green products and solutions.
 Paganics plans to acquire and use informational technology to follow lines of red worms (and later other species) from cocoon to death. We will be using QR codes, tracking systems, and Adaptive Database technology, so that our worms can be tracked and measured.  With these tools, various events such as heat or cold die-offs, drought conditions, diseases, etc. and the effects of such on the bins/runs/windrows involved can be recorded.  Over time this will lead to a deeper understanding about earthworms and their growing conditions. This will allow the field to expand its information base and provide advanced breeding and cultivation techniques.
By testing the various composts, castings and teas, Paganics can also show which foods will result in the best fertilizer, and allow us to create a line of 100% organic products that will adapt to different agricultural purposes. Measuring every aspect and recording them in a searchable database will allow a useful knowledge base to improve the overall ability for vermiculturalists and vermicomposters to create a quality product.  Your contributions will help to create a space that is accessible and can be managed effectively to provide worm breeding, primarily red worms (Eisenia fetida) and measure their various outputs in form of cocoons and castings.  We will be able to test various types of foods and organic materials to gain accurate measurements of the rate of consumption.  We will also be able to provide reliable lab testing of worm castings and worm teas composition, in order to provide focused information of our products for the end consumer. This lab would test not just the bins on site but also receive samples from other bins around the country. Sharing the Data using the InternetAs we develop our Nature’s Little Recyclers Earthworm Nursery, we will create a website that will allow all of our customers to acquire more information directly, including unique identifiers for the earthworms they receive from us. In this way, we can use the power of social media and crowd sourced knowledge to make information available to everyone who is interested.  All contributors will receive access to the new website, and be able to follow our long term projects. Whether you are looking for compost, fertilizer, or want to raise your own earthworms, we will provide information and new data, as well as interesting projects including videos, research findings, and the latest available information.

story:
Hi! I am raising money to help me fund my once in a lifetime trip to Australia! The reason I am doing this is because as a family we are not well off, my mum is a full time carer for my severely disabled sister so is unable to work and is therefore unable to help me. All the money I can gather (birthdays, christmas and work) is also going into this trip to help.

The opportunity has arisen for me to be able to explore Australia, and I don't want to miss it due to lack of funds, so am doing everything to prevent that!

Thanks so much!

story:
~ It's Everywhere  ~

Get your personal
global warming psychology 
and support this film! 

Ten different pieces of art, four different climate messaging icons, seven different pieces of apparel, five different colors. Scroll down to see the apparel and other perks below. (Click the image above for a larger view.)

 

 

~ ~ ~ The Film ~ ~ ~ 

We were awash for 19 days in a tumultuous sea of mountains and forests, drifting a course through the heart of the U.S. Rockies on a 6,000-mile journey of observation. Across the Continental Divide 22 times we navigated our way up and down the spine of North America, making 22 camps and observing 19 national forests. Eighty-nine million acres of conifers--20 percent of western North American forests--were dead due to a native insect driven berserk because of warming. (From our field work 2015 log.)

This is one of many abrupt changes happening already, that have been caused by delay, and masked by mistrust in climate scientists. Reform is stalled worse than any time in 30 years, and our inalienable right to a healthy climate is literally under attack. This funding campaign will help finish field work for our new film, and through the T-shirt perks (see them below), begin a national messaging campaign using our buddy Andy Surfer Bear and global warming psychology.

Fifteen thousand miles of This Land Is Your Land -- Climate Change Across America, are already in the can. Next up with this funder are the final 15,000 miles, and an all-important trip to the Greenland Ice Sheet for repeat photography from our first film in 2008.

Redkill, or forest mortality from pine bark beetle attack. All across the West, our forests are  under attack by a pine bark beetle that is out of control because of warming. Near Steamboat Lake State Park, north central Colorado.

Global Warming Psychology -- Adventure, Discovery and Intrigue: The Solution to Climate Pollution

We break the obvious news that yes, 30 years of delay has made climate change much worse and far more risky. The delay has largely been caused by what research at Drexel and Stanford Universities label the Climate Change Counter Movement (CCCM), whose $900 million in annual funding has destroyed trust in climate scientists. (1) 

To restore trust and finally implement climate pollution reform, global warming psychology says "Foremost, be innovative." This film uses the psychology of adventure, discovery and intrigue, delivered with music and beauty, to discover the truth in disparaged science, and portray the simple solutions, dismissed due to mistrust.

The messaging campaign? The psychology says that because climate change has never happened to our advanced civilization before, we do not understand what will happen. We have no memory of what we need to do. Because we do not know how to behave, unfamiliarity inhibits deep thought. Fear, paranoia, skepticism, doubt and delay are the result. For trust in climate science to return, new and unique communications strategies are needed. Our polar bears and messages, our prose and our images, and especially our music--good old rock, blues, jazz and folk--all embody this new psychology. 

Our Background

The Climate Change Now Initiative is the oldest independent climate science education organization in the world. Founded in 2005, We specialize in reporting the latest climate science discoveries directly from academia, field investigation of climate impacts happening now, and global warming psychology. Bruce Melton, our principle resource, is a professional engineer, environmental researcher, and climate science outreach specialist with over 30 years of experience in critical environmental issues. Our knowledge base, films, images, and music are at ClimateDiscovery.org.

Grand Teton National Park: A native bark beetle driven berserk because of warming is abruptly changing 89 million acres across North America into something different. Click on the image for a high resolution image to see the redkill on the flanks of Grand Teton, the tallest peak.

Climate Change Today: Not What You Think

The Climate Change Counter Movement has destroyed the ability of climate scientists to communicate not only their most important recent discoveries, but the simple basics too. With full implementation Paris Commitments of 80 percent emissions reductions, our climate warms, not cools, by up to triple what we have already endured, in just the next 35 to 45 years, and warming quintuples by 2100. (2)

Climate scientists told us 30 years ago that if we did not act promptly there would be trouble, and this is where we find ourselves today. The delay has now allowed initiation of abrupt changes up to 100 years ahead of, and 100 times more extreme than projections by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. (3)

South Padre Island, non-storm conditions: During the Spring and King Tides, beaches around the world are under water. The reason we don't hear about it more is that the beaches that almost everyone visits are artificially nourished with dredged sand.

Abrupt Change: The New Era of Climate Pollution 

The West Antarctic Ice Sheet is collapsing. The Gulf Stream is shutting down. The Amazon has flipped from a carbon sink to a carbon source. (4, 5, 6)  These are not distant future climate change horrors stories. Thirty years of delay has taken its toll. These abrupt changes (and more) are all happening now and the science has been masked by this extraordinary debate caused by the CCCM. This "movement" has engendered so much doubt--even among believers--that warnings from the scientific community go unheeded, unheard, and  wrongly believed as being some part of a "natural cycle." This film, and the Climate Change Now Initiative, specialize in communicating the badly maligned basics, and poorly communicated recent discoveries.

Dirt on the Greenland Ice Sheet from record melt in 2012, 32 miles onto the ice near Kangerlussuaq, 20 miles north  of the Arctic Circle.The dirt is eons of accumulated dust from as far away as Siberia and the biggest lake is almost a half mile across.  Google Digitalglobe, U.S. Geological Survey 2012. (link)

Graciously, There Is Good News 

The same strategies that have created the disconnection between climate science and the rest of us have masked new discoveries about solutions. But climate scientists have basically had 30 years to research the solutions. We now have proven, cheap and unambiguous technologies to take excess carbon dioxide pollution directly out of our sky and make up for the difference that emissions reductions strategies, decarbonization, agricultural techniques, bio energy carbon capture and sequestration (BECCS), and all of the other strategies combined together cannot accomplish. (7) The 2013 IPCC even thought these technologies were important enough to include in their Summary for Policy Makers: "climate change resulting from CO2 emissions is irreversible on a multi-century to millennial time scale, except in the case of a large net removal of CO2 from the atmosphere over a sustained period."

In other words, we have to remove "largely" more than we emit every year. "Paris" is only reductions in emissions. We must remove more CO2 from the sky than we emit every year--largely more, regardless of costs. Fortunately, the costs are as manageable as many, many different things we do in our society every year.

Carbon Engineering, Squamish, British Columbia: This first of its kind industrial scale facility uses WW II technology that kept our sailors alive in submarines by cleaning carbon dioxide from the air with lye.

But the Climate Change Counter Movement has brought action to a standstill. We have the engineers to do the job, we have the emission reductions strategies to decarbonize our economy, but we cannot muster the will. If we can take action--almost immediately--and remove enough of the excess CO2 from our sky, abrupt changes that are initiating now will reverse. Failure to act however, as per NOAA in 2016, will result in ten feet of sea level rise in just the next 35 to 45 years. (8)  To break the stranglehold we need global warming psychology. If we can overcome this astonishingly ironic deadlock, we can fix the problem for as little money as we spend on advertising across the planet every year. (9)

Global Thermostat, Menlo Park California. First generation designer amine process for removing carbon dioxide from the air. At this early stage of development this technology can remove 1 ton of CO2 for $75 using waste heat. As solar energy falls to $0.01 kWh by 2025 (it's $0.07 kWh now), costs will plummet.

What We Do, What This Film Will Do

Adventure, Discovery, Intrigue:  Global warming psychology says to show viewers what's really happening in the world. So we get out and get dirty. We go to where it is and bring it back. In July 2017, we depart for field work on the West Coast--with or without funding, although with a much reduced scope of work without funding. The challenge now is abrupt change, not the relatively slow 2100 projections that we have been practicing for. This is why our work is so important.

To finally create action, the psychology says: Simplify communications. Minimize ambiguity. Instill trust in our scientists. Don't create fear. Create learning through innovation. Tell a story. Relate, don't dictate. Reveal the innocence of reality and magnitude of risk. Invite participation. And fundamentally, combine science with entertainment: If they aren't in their seats, they aren't listening.

The most important part of our platform is our Knowledge Base and over 400 interpretations of academic literature almost completely unknown outside academia.  It's this knowledge base that our films and music are based upon. Climate change is out there and it is far more meaningful than we have been drilled into believing. It's also a rare, beautiful, and fascinating thing to behold. Abrupt changes have never happened to our advanced civilization, or even to our species, in time frames that matter. It's out there where you least expect it, more fantastic than can be imagined, waiting to be experienced.

~ ~ ~ We Bring It! ~ ~ ~

The Climate Change Now Initiative 501c3 was founded in 2005, – ClimateDiscovery.org -- Over 400 reports on the latest most critical science, innovative filmwork and good old blues, rock and folk music, that tells the complete story of climate change.

Music Can Sooth The Climate Beast

Why music? It's innovative and global warming psychology says to communicate in ways that have not been tried before. Music is the universal language. Music heals. It relates through a different part of the brain. The psychology says this is good, our old pathways have become inured. Think about the blues. It's all bad in the blues, but we enjoy the blues as music. So, why not present climate change through music? And besides, how else would an organization from Austin do it?!

The band has been together since 2002. We love the blues. This film will sooth your soul. It uses the advanced global warming psychology technique of presenting through the lens of music.

 

The redkill pine forest above is a common site across the American West. Usually blamed on natural occurrence by unsuspecting news people victimized by the Climate Change Counter Movement and their insistence on "fair and balanced" reporting,  these are actual abrupt climate change impacts, that have happen every time our climate changed abruptly. 

Climate Change Across America Field Work 2017

In 2015 and 2016 we completed 15,000 miles of filming, observing beetle kill in the Rockies, drought kill in Texas, all sorts of mortality in the Chihuahuan Desert, and sea level rise and dune erosion on the Padre Island wilderness beach--the world's longest barrier island. Another 15,000 miles in the U.S. and Canada is on the books for summer and fall 2017, plus an all important trip to Greenland. This work builds upon our previous two films, The Ice and the Sea, Abrupt Climate Change Happening Now (2008) (22,000 views!) and What Have We Done: The North American Pine Beetle Pandemic (2009).  This new 15,000 miles of fieldwork has four focus areas:

  1. Document the effect of West Coast beetle kill in the Sierra Nevada and Cascades after their record drought, focusing on the  most vulnerably high altitude areas.
  2. Visit leading atmospheric carbon dioxide removal scientists and showcase their advanced work on industrial scale field trials with Global Thermostat, Carbon Engineering and associated scientists from Columbia University, University of Arizona, University of Calgary, and Carnegie Mellon University.
  3. Film the Big Melt again in Greenland, retracing our 2007 expedition path from Point 660 on the edge of the ice sheet near Kangerlussuaq, where melt has been as high as 30 feet per year, to the Jakobshavn Icefjord and the most prolific glacier in the world near Ilulissat. 
  4. Film sea level rise impacts during the King Tides in October between the Outer Banks of North Carolina and South Padre Island, Texas, via Key West, Florida.

Global Warming T-shirt Psychology Messaging Campaign

Because we have never experienced meaningful climate change before, it's an innate response to the unknown to be suspicious, doubting and even fearful. This inhibits deep thought. After seeing the plight of the polar bear for going on 30 years now, the polar bear image has become ingrained in our minds as being related to climate change. Global warming psychology says that even just the sight of a climate change icon initiates thought in our brains. As neurons blink, our minds grow more comfortable with the topic. As our comfort levels increase, our ability to have rational thought increases too, and the tactics of the Climate Change Counter Movement can be defeated!

You can see more about the psychology here at our almost completed eCommerce site. The site is not fully functional yet, but the catalog is! Soon, all of our art will be available on all sorts of apparel and climate change gear ~ ~ ~

Tax Deductible! or Pay by Check

Yes! Tax Deductible, but not through Indiegogo so you need to donate directly to the Climate Change Now Initiative. We are a 501c3 nonprofit charity designated by the IRS and their charitable tax deduction rules apply if you donate directly to us. Our EIN is 90-1006128. You must send your donation directly to us through our Paypal portal, or with a check to: Climate Change Now, 8103 Kirkham, Austin, Texas 78736. Please let us know your check is coming. All perks still apply, let us know -- bmelton@earthlink.net, Subject: "This Land Is Your Land." (512)799-7998.

Perks

  • Updates from the field.
  • Everyone gets a film download.
  • Just want to donate? Go to Climate Discovery Support!

Basic Global Warming Psychology Perk -- $25 and $30 -- (See the apparel below) -- Contribute to this effort and get a global warming psychology T-shirt!  Twelve different pieces of art, seven different types of apparel, five colors, and four sizes.
Climate Pollution Reform Perk $100 -- If you are going to be in Austin, drop by for band rehearsal! We meet most Friday's at 7, the band usually shows about 7:30! Bring friends ~ ~ ~  (You really don't have to donate to come to rehearsal--just show up!)
Team Zero (Climate Consultation) Perk $250 -- Get a consult from our climate change outreach specialist and registered professional engineer B. MeltOn. Do you have a special project, an advocacy challenge, or a pitch that needs something special to set it off? Or a science challenge you need citations for? Or want to know how your personal skills and goals can make the best contribution to the effort?  MeltOn has been an engineering consultant for 30 years and knows what to do.
Policy Wonk Perk $500 -- Digital Images -- Get all of our Supporter Perk images (below) in digital files to use in a screen saver for your computer with the built in Windows 10 screen saver. If you haven't found this on Windows 10 yet, we will help you set it up too! 
Supporter Perk $1,000 -- Large Format Fine Art Photograph (See the prints below) -- Supporters get a large format 24" x 36" fine art print of climate change happening now, and their name or their organization in the credits with special thanks. The prints are meant for framed display and use the finest 200 year archival inks and paper. A detailed description of each image is in the Indiegogo content (below.)
Healthy Climate Perk $2,500 -- Ever been to the music capital of the known universe? Come to Austin during South by Southwest (mid-March) and the band will dedicate our SWxSW studio concert to you and your friends. (We are located at the southwestern city limits of Austin, or southwest of weird as we affectionately like to say). It's always a good party, lots of food and friends, and no telling who will show up and jam.
Associate Producer Perk $5,000 -- Join us for two days on one of our expeditions this season and help document climate change happening now in some of the most scenic areas in North America. Camping is preferred to get the glory light (we will set you up), but moteling is acceptable. We will feed you. Let us know how many t-shirts you want, and look forward to a draft review of the film late 2017/early 2018.
Executive Producer $10,000 -- Meet us for 3 days filming on the ice sheet! Camping is preferred and may be mandatory depending on when your contribution comes in. Greenland is scheduled for late August, before the snows start, after the first freeze. The mosquitoes are gone (yay!), and all the snow is gone to reveal the crevasses (for safety!) This perk is only available if we fully fund. Let us know how many t-shirts you want and look forward to a draft review of the film late 2017 or early 2018 ~ ~ ~

Climate Change T-shirts

Climate Change is Everywhere Perk ($1,000)

~ ~ ~ Fine Art Giclee Prints ~ ~ ~

Large format 24" x 36" fine art, high resolution photography, the finest 200 year archival inks, and semi-gloss archival paper. Borderless or with a border for matting. With or without caption.

Supporter -- Teton Red...  At the foot of the Tetons, the beetle has impacted less than half the trees. The same can't be said for the white pine in the greater Yellowstone ecosystem however. Over 90 percent of this species, which provides a major source of food for grizzlies, were wiped out.

Supporter -- Groundhog Park, Spruce Beetle Attack... This astonishing attack took out 100,000 acres in three years beginning 2012. It's in south Central Colorado in the La Garita Mountains above 11,000 feet. The peak in the background is Mesa Mountain, elevation 12,944 feet. This forest is (was) almost all Englemann spruce except for the fringe along the road of young blue spruce, which are less susceptible to the spruce beetle than the mature Englemanns.

Supporter -- Underice River, Point 660... Point 660 is WW II code for this remote area that is literally at the end of the longest road in Greenland (only 18 miles long!). The underice river is at the heart of the area that is melting the fastest in Greenland, at up to 30 vertical feet per year. It's along the west coast, 200 miles south of the Arctic Circle, east from Kangerlussuaq, or Bluie West as this vitally important airfield was known in WWII.

Supporter -- Padre Mile 11, Surf in the Dunes, South Padre Sea Level Rise...  Apply named The Narrows, at mile 13 beyond the end of pavement the four-wheel drive trail disappears into the surf. Sea level rise during normal high tides has outpaced the natural beach regeneration process, and beach disintegration has begun.

Supporter -- Padre Mile 14, Missing BeachSouth Padre Mile 14...  Normal high tide on South Padre Island. At the turn of the century, the beach on most of Padre during normal, non storm high tides, was one to two hundred feet wide, with some places greater than 300 feet.

Supporter -- Padre Mile 15, Beach Erosion... Up South Padre, in the pristine wilderness beyond the end of the road, the beach is almost gone. Erosion from sea level rise during non-storm conditions has overwhelmed the natural beach regenerative process.

Supporter -- PINS Mile 50, Padre Island National Seashore, 50 miles beyond the four-wheel drive only sign... Sand starvation from dams on rivers and natural subsidence from sediment compaction are challenging enough for our beaches. Add sea level rise and the beach disintegration threshold has already been passed in critical areas like this one where the beach is non-existent at high tide.

Supporter -- The Flats, Padre Island National Seashore... They are (were) located on the back side of Padre Island and were once nearly a mile wide at the widest. These flats disappeared with the sea level jump along the Texas Coast in 2013, and then again in 2016. This time they may be gone for good.

Supporter -- RMNP Westgate, Rocky Mountain National Park Westgate Entry Monument... the mountain pine bark beetle, dendroctonus ponderosae, has devastated the western half of Rocky Mountain National Park. All total, 89 million acres had been consumed across the American West with 60 to 90 percent mortality by 2013 when the attack began to wain. Now, spruce beetles, fir beetles and budworms are attacking across the West in epidemic proportions.

Supporter -- Ice Sheet Muskoxe... The massive Greenland Ice Sheet overhangs its terminal moraine east of Kangerlussuaq, near the Arctic Circle. The distinct boundary between dirty and clean ice was caused by an abrupt climate change. The white ice overides darker ice from an ice age pulse where windier conditions created dirtier ice. The ice on the left remains in equilibrium because it overhangs the terminal moraine. On the right, recent ice sheet retreat is evident.

What'll We Do If We Don't Get Funded?

Continue on of course. Melton has been funding this work from his meager engineering revenues for a dozen years, but it's a lot more difficult today. Melton Engineering's traditional land development clients have evaporated after learning Melton was an evil environmentalist. But Melton Engineering was rebranded in 2013 to cater to residential and commercial clients who have been impacted by the repeated rainbombs in Central Texas.

After the rebranding, there was enough revenue to fund 7,500 miles a year of filming in 2015 and 2016 and this will probably be the case in 2017 without additional funding. But because of abrupt change initiation, we don't have the time remaining to delay and certainly not the funds to do 15,000 miles this year and get to Greenland. Please get a T-shirt or twelve and help save the world! Most important: Share on Facebook and Twitter.

Production 

Regardless of funding, we will get a short film out about the successful industrial scale direct air capture processes by this fall. If we make our goal, fingers crossed to make the film festival entries in spring 2018.

The band is going into production in August or September, depending on Greenland.

Another tour we have planned if we don't get fully funded is a 4x4 trek up and down Padre Island during the King Tide in October. It's just a few hours from Austin and can be executed with just engineering revenues. The beach was closed at Padre Island National Seashore due to high water five times during non storm conditions in 2016.

Bottom line: if we do not reach our funding goal, there's still Melton Engineering. There is no reason why we would stop now. This is too important. We'll get there, but it will not likely to be until 2019. So tell your friends. Abrupt change waits for nobody.

Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Share on social media! Create viralness!
  • Email your contacts and ask them to tell their close by social media maniacs to share. 
  • Talk about climate change. Get those neurons blinking.
  • Talk to those who are receptive. Talking to others is not very productive. Maximize the efficiency of your efforts.
  • Vote! Vote for the only issue that is the most important our civilization has ever faced!
  • Volunteer. Pick a climate change activist campaign: Citizens Climate Lobby, Sierra Club, 350.org. Warm bodies are what matters.
  • Make those calls to your elected leaders. Then repeat until we have a healthy climate.
  • Most important! Wear your T-shirt.
  • Even more important! Give lots of T-shirts to friends! Nonprofit Global Warming Psychology! ClimateChangetshirts.org 

 

 ~ ~ ~ Doing Something About The Weather ~ ~ ~

 

REFERENCES

  1. Climate Change Counter Movement… From 2003 to 2010, $7 billion in climate change counter-movement funding has been identified from revenues reported in IRS tax returns for 91 of 118 organizations and institutions identified in the academic literature as being involved. The research from Drexel and Stanford concludes: “With delay and obfuscation as their goals, the U.S. CCCM has been quite successful in recent decades. However, the key actors in this cultural and political conflict are not just the “experts” who appear in the media spotlight. The roots of climate-change denial go deeper, because individuals’ efforts have been bankrolled and directed by organizations that receive sustained support from foundations and funders known for their overall commitments to conservative causes. Thus to fully understand the opposition to climate change legislation, we need to focus on the institutionalized efforts that have built and maintain this organized campaign. Just as in a theatrical show, there are stars in the spotlight. In the drama of climate change, these are often prominent contrarian scientists or conservative politicians, such as Senator James Inhofe. However, they are only the most visible and transparent parts of a larger production. Supporting this effort are directors, script writers, and, most importantly, a series of producers, in the form of conservative foundations. Clarifying the institutional dynamics of the CCCM can aid our understanding of how anthropogenic climate change has been turned into a controversy rather than a scientific fact in the U.S.” A criticism of this theory is that the conservative political platform funded also supports other issues such as right to life, reduced government and regulations, illegal immigration, lower taxes and etc. Fundamentally however, because the platform supported by this funding is all encompassing, the entire funding supports climate change denial equally to the other parts of the platform.
    Brulle 2013, Drexel and Stanford -- Institutionalizing delay: foundation funding and the creation of U.S. climate change counter-movement organizations," December 21, 2013.
    Melton, Climate Discovery.org -- The Climate Change Counter-Movement: $7 Billion Umbrella, February 17, 2014.
    Melton, Truthout.org -- Buoyed by Trump, the Climate Change Counter-Movement Gains Momentum, May 19, 2017.
    Media Bias and the Conservative Media… Work from McGill, Drexel and Bucknell Universities expands on previous work on the causes of the partisan divide among climate science believers. Their findings are that the media have the most important influencing effect on the public mind with the biased coverage of climate science by the most popular politically conservative media outlets carrying the largest load of responsibility.
    Carmichael et al., The great divide, understanding the role of media and other drivers of the partisan divide in public concern over climate change in the USA, 2001–2014 Climatic Change, January 31, 2017.
    https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Joanna_Hux...
    Corporate funding and Climate Change Bias… Work From Yale on 164 organizations identified as being a part of the Climate Change Counter Movement from 1993–2013 evaluated their oral and written outreach of 40,785 texts (written and oral presentations) and more than 39 million words and found that; "organizations with corporate funding were more likely to have written and disseminated texts meant to polarize the climate change issue. Second, and more importantly, that corporate funding influences the actual thematic content of these polarization efforts."
    Farrell, Corporate funding and ideological polarization about climate change, PNAS, January 5, 2016.
    http://www.pnas.org/content/113/1/92.full.pdf
    Fairness Bias in Liberal Media… From the University of California Santa Cruz and American University, Boykoff and Boykoff find that not only are conservative media outlets far more likely to vastly downplay climate change risks, but that liberal media outlets too are also more likely to downplay climate change risks. It's has been subsequently labelled the "Fairness Bias" and the way it works is this: in journalists' quest to be fair and present both sides of the story, they feel compelled by their journalistic ethics to report both sides of the story equally and let the consumer determine their own answer. This generally works well with issue based discussions where only morals and ethics are involved. But when facts are involved, and "alternative" facts exist that are supported by only three percent of the climate science community or less, and those facts are presented by the media equally to the 97 percent of climate scientists facts that have been proven true, a conflict results where the consumer bases his or her interpretation on the quantity of information presented. To them, it seems like the science remains unsettled, when the reality is just the opposite.
    Boykkoff and Boykkoff Balance as bias global warming and the US prestige press Global Environmental Change volume 14 2004.
    https://www.researchgate.net/publication/248556... 
    2)    Current Policy doubles to triples warming we have already endured…  The IPCC’s new Representative Concentration Pathway (RCP) scenario of RCP2.6, is basically the same thing as 80 percent emissions reductions by 2050 and is described by the IPCC as a “strong mitigation scenario.” RCP2.6 has CO2 peaking at about 440 ppm between 2050 and 2060 and temperature at 1.5 degree C 30 to 40 years later. The increase of 1.6 degrees C is double the current warming since the 1700s. This increase however is the average increase. The worst-case RCP2.6 warming is 2.7 degrees C or more than triple current warming. Considering the understating nature of the IPCC consensus (See Reference 7), the upper limits should be strongly considered as a distinctly plausible. Under the average RCP2.6 modeling and 1.6 degrees of warming with aggressive emissions reductions, the concentration of CO2 in our atmosphere does not fall below today’s level until after 2150, and does not return to preindustrial era temperature until long after the year 3000. Under the most extreme RCP2.6 limits with 2.7 degrees of warming above preindustrial times, Earth’s temperature does not fall below our current temperature for well over a 1,000 years.
    Meinshausen et al., The RCP greenhouse gas concentrations and their extensions from 1765 to 2300, Climatic Change, November 2011, figure 6. 
    http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs105...
    MIT Joint Program on the Science and Policy of Global Change – Results of Paris… With the Paris Agreement fully implemented on schedule, we can expect 3.5 C of warming by 2100 and with additional negative emissions technologies studied of BECSS (bio-energy with carbon capture and storage--not direct air capture) the increase in warming is held back to 2.4 to 2.7 C by 2100. At 2050, Paris alone is 2.1 C warming. 2014 was 0.69 C. The record 2015 and 2016 global average was 0.87 C and 0.94 C. However, 2015 and 2016 were influenced by a record, or near record El Nino, a natural climate fluctuation. 
    Sokolov et al., Scenarios of Global Change - Integrated Assessment of Climate Impacts, MIT Joint Program on the Science and Policy of Global Change, Report 291, February 2016.
    https://globalchange.mit.edu/sites/default/file... 
    ​3. Abrupt change up to 100 years ahead of schedule and 100 times more extreme than the IPCC projected… It is difficult to quantify how much more extreme abrupt change is than the slow changes projected by the IPCC because of many different things: we have never experienced these types of impacts before (sea level jumps, shut down of the Gulf Stream, Amazon flip from sink to source, dynamic collapse of ice sheets. Their unrecoverable nature lends itself poorly to comparisons with a stable and advanced society. Two illustrations are offered: (A) Antarctic ice loss has begun 100 years ahead of schedule… Antarctic ice loss (surface mass balance, SMB) in the 2007 IPCC Report was supposed to increase, not decrease, for all scenarios, through 2100. This means that snow accumulation was supposed to be more than melt, evaporation and iceberg discharge combined. The 213 IPCC report however, tells us that Antarctic ice loss has already begun,  is substantially large, and approaching the volume of discharge in Greenland.   (B) 100 times more extreme… Abrupt temperature change has occurred 23 times in the last 100,000 years of 9 to 14 degrees F globally and 25 to 35 F in Greenland. The changes generally took decades, but the most extreme occurred in just two to three years. When compared to a world that limits warming to a middle of the road scenario of 3 degrees C (5.4 F) by 2100, 14 F in 2 years is 107 times more extreme.(A) Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, Fourth Assessment Report, Climate Change 2007: Working Group I: The Physical Science Basis, 10.6.5, Projections of Global Average Sea Level Change for the 21st Century, Table 10.7.http://www.ipcc.ch/publications_and_data/ar4/wg1/en/ch10s10-6-5.html 
    The 2013 IPCC report tells us that Antarctic ice loss has almost caught up with Greenland… Summary for Policy Makers, B.3 Cryosphere, page 9, second and third bullets. http://www.climatechange2013.org/images/report/WG1AR5_SPM_FINAL.pdf
    (B) Alley, Wally Was Right - Predictive ability of the North Atlantic Conveyor Belt Hypothesis for Abrupt Climate Change, Annual Review of Earth and Planetary Science, February 2007, Figure 1 shows the 23 abrupt climate changes.http://shadow.eas.gatech.edu/~kcobb/abrupt/alley07.pdf 
    Two to three years…  -- see also:
    Steffensen et al., High-Resolution Greenland Ice Core Data Show Abrupt Climate Change Happens in Few Years, Science Express, June 12 2008, page three, final paragraph.
    http://www.sciencemag.org/content/321/5889/680.abstract
    4. The West Antarctic Ice Sheet is collapsing… For a detailed treatment of this topic with 20 references and 30 citations see our article: Collapse of West Antarctic Ice Sheet Reveals Inadequacy of Current Climate Strategies, December 16, 2016. 
    http://www.truth-out.org/news/item/38794-collap... 
    Specific citations for " The West Antarctic ice Sheet is collapsing"…
    West Antarctic Ice Sheet Collapse Began Shortly After the Turn of the Century… Vaughan summarized the science around West Antarctic Ice Sheet Collapse beginning in 1981. While the mechanisms for ocean melt were present in publication from the early 1990s, it was not until the early 2000s that work first showed definitive evidence of thinning, grounding line retreat, and ice stream acceleration in one of the most sensitive area of West Antarctica, the Amundsen Sea Embayment. Vaughan concludes that if these symptoms are indeed precursors to collapse, then collapse has begun. From what we know today, he was absolutely correct. Vaughan, West Antarctic Ice Sheet collapse – the fall and rise of a paradigm, Climatic Change, 2008, see the abstract.
    http://www.researchgate.net/publication/2251669...
    West Antarctic Ice Sheet (WAIS) Collapse Tipping Point Defined… This work out of the German National Science Institute describes marine ice sheet collapse mechanisms, and how there is a very distinct tipping point with the West Antarctic Ice Sheet where collapse becomes irreversible in about 2050. The very important take-away from this work is that to prevent ice sheet collapse the “perturbation” that creates the warming that is responsible for ice sheet collapse, which is mostly ocean warming, must end by at the latest 2050. This means that we must return ocean temperature to its preindustrial stable temperature by 2050. The challenge here is that it is much more difficult to cool the oceans than it is the atmosphere. Figure 3 shows the model runs that define the stable state in blue.
    Feldmann and Levermann, Collapse of the West Antarctic Ice Sheet after local destabilization of the Amundsen Basin, PNAS, November 17, 2015.
    http://www.pnas.org/content/112/46/14191.full.pdf 
    Dynamical Ice Sheet Collapse Modeling Arrives… The abstract from DeConto and Pollard states: “model coupling ice sheet and climate dynamics—including previously underappreciated processes linking atmospheric warming with hydrofracturing of buttressing ice shelves and structural collapse of marine-terminating ice cliffs—that is calibrated against Pliocene and Last Interglacial sea-level estimates and applied to future greenhouse gas emission scenarios. Antarctica has the potential to contribute more than a metre of sea-level rise by 2100 and more than 13 metres by 2500, if emissions continue unabated.”
    DeConto and Pollard, Contribution of Antarctica to past and future sea level rise, Nature, March 31, 2016.
    Full: http://www.documentcloud.org/documents/2823837-... 
    Recent sea level rise rate jump… Sea level rise from 1900 to 1990 was about 1.5 mm per year and from 1990 to 2010 3.2 mm per year. Since 2010 there seems to have been a another jump in the sea level rise rate that puts it above 5 mm per year based on NOAA’s sea level data.
    http://www.star.nesdis.noaa.gov/sod/lsa/SeaLeve... 
    Antarctic Ice Shelves Deteriorating Rapidly… Ice shelves buttressing land ice in Antarctica have seen a dramatic decline in volume due to thinning and retreat. As the shelves thin from under ice melt, their ability to cling to surrounding land and grounded ice diminishes and ice flows faster from the interior. Part of the increase in ocean temperatures doing the melting is actually caused by increased sea ice coverage in Antarctica in recent decades. The increased sea ice itself is part of a melt water feedback where less salty (less dense) melt water floats on the surface of the ocean instead of mixing with saltier denser water below. The fresh water freezes faster and is responsible for more sea ice. The combination of increased sea ice and the fresh water cap decreases wind mixing of deep ocean waters into surface waters. This wind mixing is responsible for upwelling cold deep waters so less upwelling means that more heat is trapped in upper ocean waters. It is this upper ocean water that circulates beneath the ice shelves and causes the melt that destabilizes them and increase ice discharge. Paolo et al., Volume loss from Antarctic ice shelves is accelerating, Science Express, March 25, 2016.
    http://www.ccpo.odu.edu/~klinck/Reprints/PDF/pa... 
    Up to 100 meters (328 feet) of Under Ice Melt per year… The Pine Island Glacier at the Amundsen Sea Embayment, often referred to as the keystone of West Antarctic Ice Sheet Collapse, is thinning from under ice melt at a rate that is up to 100 meters per year (328 feet). The thinning is caused by increased circulation of warming ocean waters because the 3,000 foot-thick glacier has melted up off of its pinning ridge. Ocean circulation can now move far back into the ice sheet feeding the glacier in an over deepened sub glacial trough 30 miles wide extending 100 miles inland.
    Dutrieux et al., Pine Island glacier ice shelf melt distributed at kilometre scales, The Cryosphere, September 26, 2013.
    http://www.the-cryosphere.net/7/1543/2013/tc-7-... 
    NOAA's Ice Sheet Collapse Warning… This is an "ostensible" ice sheet collapse warning. In other words:  being such in appearance. In an interview in the Insurance Journal in April, Margaret Davidson, NOAA’s senior advisor for coastal inundation and resilience science and services said "recent data that has been collected but has yet to be made official indicates sea levels could rise by roughly 3 meters or 9 feet [9.8 feet] by 2050-2060, far higher and quicker than current projections." This report was widely discounted in the press and by theoretical "experts". Davidson further explained herself in an interview in ClimateCrocks--itself with a substantially questioning title " New Sea Level Story May be a Step too Far". The words of Davidson have great meaning however and completely negate any attempt at discounting her statements. ClimateCrocks posted a text obtained from Margaret Davidson of NOAA to Eric Holthaus of Slate, of which the following quote summarizes the pertinent information: “i explained the time lag between observations/data in the field and published approved scientific consensus of peer reviewed literature can be as much as 10 years. and as before, the next approved consensus will likely see a notable uptick in slr [sea level rise] guidance (based upon field work in the period ’05-13) as it will need to have been published by 2017 when the synthesis process begins anew. I am not a scientist, but hang with them a lot. referenced recent paper by Hansen et al (which suggested 3 to 5 meters by 2100 tho Hansen has been saying 5 meters for nearly 15 years.) current work re cryosphere and mass water balance, which is a more recent area of science work. and reports regarding current field observations as mentioned and discussed by experts at various scientific mtgs on presentation rooms an corridors within past 6 months. WA [West Antarctic Ice Sheet] deteriorating rapidly… portions of shelf are now ungrounded with a lens of water underneath like Greenland but different. actually said my personal opinion was 2 to 3 meters in the next 50 years (that 2100 was not a useful frame for most people.)”
    Jerger, RIMS 2016: Sea Level Rise Will Be Worse and Come Sooner, Insurance Journal, April 12, 2016.
    http://www.insurancejournal.com/news/national/2... 
    ClimateCrocks.com, Peter Sinclair, Caution: New Sea Level Story May be a Step too Far, April 21, 2016.
    https://climatecrocks.com/2016/04/21/caution-ne...

    More References Here.
story_txt:
~ It's Everywhere  ~Get your personalglobal warming psychology and support this film! Ten different pieces of art, four different climate messaging icons, seven different pieces of apparel, five different colors. Scroll down to see the apparel and other perks below. (Click the image above for a larger view.)  ~ ~ ~ The Film ~ ~ ~ We were awash for 19 days in a tumultuous sea of mountains and forests, drifting a course through the heart of the U.S. Rockies on a 6,000-mile journey of observation. Across the Continental Divide 22 times we navigated our way up and down the spine of North America, making 22 camps and observing 19 national forests. Eighty-nine million acres of conifers--20 percent of western North American forests--were dead due to a native insect driven berserk because of warming. (From our field work 2015 log.)This is one of many abrupt changes happening already, that have been caused by delay, and masked by mistrust in climate scientists. Reform is stalled worse than any time in 30 years, and our inalienable right to a healthy climate is literally under attack. This funding campaign will help finish field work for our new film, and through the T-shirt perks (see them below), begin a national messaging campaign using our buddy Andy Surfer Bear and global warming psychology.Fifteen thousand miles of This Land Is Your Land -- Climate Change Across America, are already in the can. Next up with this funder are the final 15,000 miles, and an all-important trip to the Greenland Ice Sheet for repeat photography from our first film in 2008.Redkill, or forest mortality from pine bark beetle attack. All across the West, our forests are  under attack by a pine bark beetle that is out of control because of warming.
