story: Dont fund me
story_txt: Dont fund me

story:
Die komplette Übersetzung  auf Deutsch findest Du unter www.khangela.vision!





Mankind blows the same amount of CO2 into the atmosphere within 1 year, that nature took 1 million years to store underground. With severe consequences to our planet. What do we personally do to remedy this?

Let's imagine for a minute, today were the year 2025? Who are you - then? How does your life look like, for you to truely love  living it? Which story do you tell about what you have done since 2015, to help your planet provide you with all you need?

You are already writing this story. Every day.

Source: NASA Goddard's Scientific Visualization Studio (video, 34 short, but very impressive, seconds)

We hope to be able to look back in 2025 and say: Yes, we did all we could do with our own hands. And with every other willing hand we could find. Why not yours?
Be our guest! :-)

The Khangela Eco Lodge is a model project for a fun and future-proof way of living. We human beings are creatures of habit and rather change-resistant by nature. So, any endeavor aiming at transition is only as good as it's comprehensible, tangible ...and brought to life in a no-string, convincingly delightful, first-hand experience.

And that's exactly what this project is all about.  :-)

Fun Factor     *     Team     *    Land    *    Guest Houses   *    Animals  *   Jobs   *   Road To Perdition   *   FAQ




  • Creation of an organic farm & lodge at the Eastern Cape, South Africa
  • Sinking as much CO2 as possible as contribution to climate protection
  • Bamboo bio-char and therewith terra preta production plus collection of organic waste from supermarkets and restaurants to be turned into compost will help to do just that. Both at the same time providing organic furtilizer.
  • Keeping bees for honey, as pollinators and to help them survive as a species
  • Creation of organic clay buildings with off-grid reneable energy
  • Providing an enticing range of DIY courses, recreational and coaching offers 
  • Creation of permanent jobs plus volunteer opportunities via  WWOOF
  • Serving as information hub, multiplier and "trial site" for sustainable lifestyles for community members, volunteers, holiday makers - and anyone interested
  • The Khangela Concept does NOT involve profit maximization, surplus will be plowed back into improving the site or social projects, wherever sensible
Where will all this take place? Take a look at the map.

                                                                                                                   FAQ



What the team does? Working LONG hours  to make the Khangela Eco Lodge happen. With TONS of dedication. For NO pay at all. Which makes LOTS of sense.
Doesn't it? ;-)




If one wants to create something of stability, one needs to give it a feasible structure first. Of which the foundation has already been laid:
  • Company and office registration in South Africa
  • Opening bank and PayPal account in South Africa
  • Finding reliable estate agent, tax and business consultants
  • Finding a comitted Eco Architect in Cape Town, South Africa
  • Project planning (requirements, costs, suppliers, contacts, laws, tax)
  • Buying appropriate land in the Eastern Cape, South Africa 
  • Construction of sun and wind powered clay buildings
  • Creation of a water-retaining, self-sustaining, organic landscape
  • Aquisition of animals and bees as part of the 'gardening team' ;-)
  • Creation of jobs (which includes ecological housing and training)
Every project step is freely scalable and adjustable to any amount of backing. Will there be additional funding? Yes, which means, that the campaign funding sum does not fully reflect the sum available for the realisation of the project. 

Of course, with the pending steps, that's where your most valued support comes in. :-) Your backing will have an immense impact, e.g. on the size of land that can be secured against conventional 'development'.

= Done! / Erledigt!                      = In progress / noch ausstehend




Click for pretty extensive background information in English and Deutsch.  Welcoming the first holiday makers is scheduled in September 2017.

We're sure: The stunningly beautiful Eastern Cape will take your breath away! :-)

What about the fun factor? Plenty plus. As you can see for yourself.

                                                                                                                     FAQ
Garden Route, Eastern Cape, South Africa ©Alexander Fiebrandt

Why we believe, we can create a serious impact? Because we've a powerful ally: ;-)





  • Bamboo is not a tree but a grass. Cut it down and it grows right back.
  • The bamboo family has over 2 000 members, one for every need.
  • Giant Bamboo can grow 50 cm/20 inches. Per day!
  • It can reach a final height of 30 meters/100 feet. In it's first year!
  • Bamboo has over 1 580 known human uses: Food, cattle feed, timber, furniture, fuel, paper, clothing, medicine, scaffolding, building material and, and, and... ;-)
  • It sinks 20% more CO2 and produces 35% more oxygen than any tree.
  • Seeds cost close to nothing: That's why even a contribution of $1 can create a phenomenal impact! It will buy us 10 Giant Bamboo seeds, each with the ability to produce the above described biomass. You can quite literally watch it grow. Each year, for decades. If that's not awesome, than we don't know what is.  ;-)
Interested in absolutely stunning bamboo architecture? Here's a TED Talk with Elora Hardy about "Magical houses made of bamboo". (video, 10:27 min)

The following film (5:03 min) commissioned by INBAR for the World Expo Shanghai, will give you a very comprehensive picture about the incredible power of bamboo:

Source: youtube INBARChannel

How might the transformation of vacant land into the Khangela Eco Lodge look like, before and after? The following will give you a pretty good idea (click to enlarge). :-)




    Organic.

Permaculture landscape with bio-pools, food forests, companion planting, free-range animal husbandry. A solid "No!" to GMO (genetically modified organisms), chemicals, monoculture.


  Ecologic.

Cob, clay, rammed earth, strawbale buildings with living roofs, plus water-treatment wetlands = all natural, fully compostable holiday homes.


  Renewable.

Heating? Bamboo firewood. Electricity? Solar and wind power. Entirely off-grid.


    By the ton.

Tons and tons of CO2 per year will be sunk by bamboo and spekboom tree plantations. The nut trees, fruit trees and vegetables will do their bit, too.


    Plenty Plus.

Monocultures destroy jobs, need gas-guzzling heavy machinery and tons of fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, which destroy soil life. Mixed companion planting just needs caring hands. Which of the two makes more sense?
 
    Resilience through diversity.

Specialisation creates weakness through susceptibility to market fluctuations. Diversity creates flexibility and robustness, strength and self-reliance. The Khangela concept therefore rests on several pillars of income generation:

  • Bamboo, sold as building material, firewood, bio-char, worm compost etc.
  • Farm produce, fresh & preserves
  • Lodge operation
  • Event location
  • Seminars, DIY courses, Open Days etc.
  • Coaching

    Just... well... perfect!!!  ;-)

Diversity to the extreme: Dramatic mountains, awesome rivers rich in fish, plenty of unspoilt wilderness teaming with game and bird life, surrounded by numerous National Parks. And all that a comfortable distance from the beautiful Indian Ocean coast and Port Elizabeth with its sea and air port. The Eastern Cape just has it all! :-)
 
                                                                                                                    FAQ
©Mary Alexander, www.mediaclubsouthafrica.com

Baviaanskloof Mountains, Eastern Cape © MediaClubSouthAfrica.com

You'd love to take a holiday at the Khangela Eco Lodge, but are still worried about a potential bore-out in the wilderness? You need't be. There's plenty of things to do. You might not even find the time to think of going back home again. ;-)





  • private, individual or couple coaching (marriage counseling)
  • business & team coaching, conflict management & communication trainings

  • clay, cob, strawbale and clay oven building for pottery and baking
  • permaculture design for every need (even stamp size balconies)
  • animal husbandry and bee-keeping
  • food conservation: cheese making, smoking, drying, fermenting, preserving
  • pottery, bamboo bow-making etc.

  • quad / bicycle / horse trails 
  • whale / dolphin / bird / game watching
  • swimming (bio-pool or Indian Ocean)
  • visits to one of the numerous National Parks in the vicinity
  • fishing (sweet or salt water, flyfishing)
  • archery and much, much more!   :-)



Every single backer will get a permanent place of honour on our "Wall Of Fame".
Larger version of the perk images wanted? Just click on them.

ESTIMATED DELIVERY TIMES
  • E-Book: Download Link and password will be mailed to you within 24 hours
  • Bamboo Perks: Will be shipped within 2 business days after order day
  • Backpacks & T-Shirts: Will be shipped a few days after end of campaign, as they will be especially printed according to our backers orders
  • Coaching Perks: Directly after selecting and paying your perk you can make your appointment via E-mail.
  • Holiday Perks: If everything goes according to plan, the Khangela! Eco Lodge will be ready to welcome its first guests in September 2017.  At the same time it's obvious that, with any building project or new venture, one always has to expect the unexpected. We will in any case keep you closely informed.

$1 (≈ €0,90)        

The minimum Indiegogo backing with a maximum impact! One Dollar will buy us ten Giant Bamboo seeds. Each of them with the ability to produce an immense biomass, sinking huge amounts of CO2. Each year, for several decades!

The most powerful Dollar you can spend in your entire lifetime!

Apart from that your support let's the world and the campaign team know, you believe that we are moving in just the right direction! Every single name on the supporter list is a big motivation to us and gives us strength to go on.

Of course you will be given the big THANK YOU your invaluable support deserves on our website's "Wall Of Fame".


 
$17 (≈ €15)    


This lightweigt and very convenient drawstring cotton backpack is one of its kind, since you can choose your preferred design. The original artworks of this foil prints were painted by Anke Enders-Ngono. Which one is your  favourite?  Click to enlarge.

1.) KEEP CALM
2.) Giraffe
3.) Elephant

NEW - NEW - NEW!!!


$17 (≈ €15)    

Your very own 100% cotton and 100% unique companion!

Mail us a picture of your own personal heroes, friends, familiy, pets or your own artwork. Whatever you are proud enough of to carry it on your back. ;-)
The higher the resolution, the better. We will foil print it on this rucksack for you.

Please enter your preferred design in the comments box, when selecting one of these very special perks.



$22 (≈ €20)       

Currently only available in German language.

150seitige ökologische Wissensammlung als PDF-Download. Mit Hunderten an Links zu weiterführenden Büchern, Infoseiten, Videos, Selbstbauanleitungen.

THEMEN:
  • Ökologisches Bauen + Renovieren
  • Hausbau mit Lehm und Stroh
  • Solar-, Windkraft- und Pflanzenkläranlagen
  • Fördergelder
  • Lehmofenbau in Haus + Garten
  • Permakulturanbau
  • Umweltschutz im Alltag
  • Waschmittel + Shampoo selbstgemacht
  • Beziehungen + Kommunikation u.v.m.
Zukünftige Folgeauflagen sind bei Wahl dieses E-Books komplett kostenfrei! Downloadlink per E-Mail.



$40 (≈ €35.50)    

Do you believe your eyes? We must say, at first we didn't. Yes, these knife are really made of bamboo! A beautiful combination of innovation & ecology & real treat. This unique knife set is a lightweight eye-catcher, pleasant to the touch, and - thanks to its resharpenable metal inlay - its cutting edge can be kept that sharp for ages. Click to enlarge.

The larger knife measures 35cm x 13cm (13.77in x 5.11in), the smaller one 25cm x 3 cm (9.84in x 1.18in). And as Christmas is the most exuberant feasting time of the year, those two sharp bamboo buddies will be the stars of your next cooking event with friends and family.




$40 (≈ €35.50)    

Your beautiful all organic hygiene set will make a wonderful Christmas present. It contains (click to enlarge):

  • 2 compostable bamboo toothbrushes
  • 1 compostable bamboo mug, for toothbrushes or even your coffee-to-go
  • 1 toothpaste with 24 ayurvedic herbal extract, ZERO fillers, foamers, fluorides, artificial colouring or microplastics
  • 100 gr (3.52 ounces) 100% biodegradable soap nut shells in a cotton bag
  • 100 gr  (3.52 ounces) fragrant, handcrafted lemongrass soap, vegan, 100% fair trade and 100% biodegradable ingredients: coconut oil, olive oil, sunflower oil, lemon grass flakes, shea butter, curcuma
PLUS: Recipe for your own homemade shampoo and laundry detergent.
Even the package & stuffing (fragrant wood shavings) are compostable. You will love this. Be it your hair or clothing – the incredible softness will speak for itself.


$50 (≈ €45)         

Show the world that you not only know about its many problems, but have found all the answers to it, too. :-)

Not only  your body will profit from this garment, but the environment as well:

  • crew neck
  • 100% organically grown cotton
  • fair trade
  • hard-wearing fabric, 155gr per m2
  • CO2 neutrally produced using renewable energies
Gents shirts are loose cut, ladies shirts tight cut.

Your shirt will be ordered according to your specifications, exchange/return is excluded. You may want to check the measurements according to the table. When selecting your perk, please use the comments box to state size and gender. . 




$60 (≈ €54,50)        

Beautiful, environmental friendly bamboo tableware for two. Not just pretty and fresh, but very useful. A lightweight, that will be especially valued during your next camping trip or picknick (click to enlarge):

  • 2 dinner plates Ø 25cm (9.84in)
  • 2 dessert plates Ø 20cm (7.87in)
  • 2 dessert bowls Ø 15,5cm x 7cm (6.10in)
  • 2 stackable coffee mugs Ø 8cm (3.15in) x 9,5cm (3.74in)
  • 2 stackable cups Ø 9cm (3.54in) x 13cm (5.12in)
This colourful set is dishwasher-proof and has big potential to become your new favourite. Or a welcome Christmas gift for a treasured friend.



$95 (≈ €88)         

This wireless, natural bamboo keyboard is not only a true hand-charmer and eye candy (every one seeing ours, immediately wanted to have it) but also robust, functional and just as user as eco friendly. You will quickly forget about laying your hands on chemical plasticizers every day, and instead favour the touch of nature.

Since no two bamboo culms are alike, you will call a handcrafted unicum your own. Every piece an individual item.

Features:
  • suitable for Windows95/98/2000/ME/XP/NT/Vista/Win7/Mac/iOS
  • plug & play (automatic driver installation)
  • environmentally friendly,  clear varnish
  • permanently precise keystrokes
  • skin-friendly, laser engraved keys
  • water- and sweat-repellent
  • anti-slip knobs on the base
  • antistatic
But be warned: You might need to defend your new bamboo baby against your jealous friends. They'll want it. And that's a pretty sure bet. ;-)


$100 (≈ €93)         

We will engrave your name on a plaque and mount it on a wall of the "Khangela! Eco Lodge". Your foresight and generosity will be remembered for generations to come.
Maybe you will even come and visit one day?

Right away, you will be given the appreciation you deserve on our "Wall Of Fame".




Your coaching session with Anke Enders-Ngono, known from German TV and press.
Difficulties in your work, private or love life? Stress reduces the capacity of our brain to solve problems - by dampening logic and memory in favour of its flight or attack functions. A short coaching intervention and a fresh outside view on things can make all the difference. 

You need new perspectives and a fresh approach to pressing problems? Then these perks are absolutely made for you. Appointments can be arranged via E-mail right after chosing your perk.

$60 (≈ €55)         

Difficulties in your work or private life? You need new perspectives? A fresh approach to pressing problems? Than this perk is for you.

1 online coaching session via Skype (full 60 minutes) with coach and project initiator Anke Enders-Ngono. You wish for a more extended support, e.g. a few weekly sessions? Just adjust the number of perks accordingly.

You could use your online hour with Anke to address personal problems... or just to pelter her with any questions you can think of in relation to this project. ;-)

$220 (≈ €204)        

This perk will get you 5 couple therapy session (60 minutes each) in Anke Enders-Ngono's practice in Hamburg, Germany.

There's trouble brewing in the intended paradise of your relationship? It's been going on for some time already? Or a depressing speechlessness has begun to settle in? Happiness and bliss clearly fall into the category  „Once upon a time...“? High time to stop waiting for wonders to happen, but to start making them.

You will be supprised how rapid a turn for the better can be achieved. With a little help from a "paid friend" who knows just how.



Have a fantabulous holiday with your family and/or friends! Each clay guest house (click for pics) sleeps five people. And each perk is calculated to provide for all of them ! Tons of activities & adventures for every taste - on site and in the vicinity - are waiting for you and your loved ones.

Occupancy: max. 5 persons per guest house, self-catering
Includes: 'pick your own' organic food for all 5 of you
Excludes: journey and transfer costs

Estimated Delivery: September 2017


$480 (≈ €445)        

A quick stop-over while your on holiday in the area? Taking an initial dosage of pure nature and wilderness? Just dipping a toe in the water of a delightfully different way of life?

You and your 4 loved ones might want to start off with 3 overnight stays in one of the clay chalets at the Khangela! Eco Lodge.

$800 (≈ €742)          

You can deal with a higher dosage of pristine nature? It’s right there for you. Relaxation and tranquillity or rather mixing in a chunk of action & adventure?

Make it real! Spend 5 appetizing days and nights with your 4 most favourite folks  in one of the clay chalets at the Khangela! Eco Lodge. 

$1 200 (≈ €1 113)     

Family vacation? Adventure holiday among friends? DIY fun? Improving your relationship and love life? Campfire by the lakeside?

Long cherished dreams do come true with 7 heavenly days and nights in one of the clay chalets at the Khangela! Eco Lodge. All of you 5 will love this, no doubt.



Special thanks to our supporters:
                                 

                                      

We in turn support the survival of honeybees and world wide water projects via:

                      



You would like to back us, but are going through tough times right now?
We've been there. Don't worry, walk tall - there's other ways to help!

More ways to contribute to the success of this project:
  • Use the "Share" Tools to enhance the visability and impact of the project.
  • Encourage your personal network to cast an eye on it and join in.
  • Spread the word to people with an active interest in environmental protection.
  • And of course to those who haven't. Yet. ;-)
  • Tell people about it, who wish to spent some meaningful time abroad.
  • Visit us to help after construction has started (prior arrangement essential!) for some hands-on experience in clay building and water retention landscaping.
  • You've got questions? Tons of answers can already be found in our FAQ.

Check them out. Any questions left unanswered? You’re more than welcome! :-)

                   www.khangela.vision / welcome(at)khangela.vision               


Fun Factor     *     Team    *    Land     *    Guest Houses     *    Animals    *    FAQ
story_txt:
Die komplette Übersetzung  auf Deutsch findest Du unter www.khangela.vision!
 


Mankind blows the same amount of CO2 into the atmosphere within 1 year, that nature took 1 million years to store underground. With severe consequences to our planet. What do we personally do to remedy this?
Let's imagine for a minute, today were the year 2025? Who are you - then? How does your life look like, for you to truely love  living it? Which story do you tell about what you have done since 2015, to help your planet provide you with all you need? You are already writing this story. Every day.


Source: NASA Goddard's Scientific Visualization Studio (video, 34 short, but very impressive, seconds)


We hope to be able to look back in 2025 and say: Yes, we did all we could do with our own hands. And with every other willing hand we could find. Why not yours? Be our guest! :-)


The Khangela Eco Lodge is a model project for a fun and future-proof way of living. We human beings are creatures of habit and rather change-resistant by nature. So, any endeavor aiming at transition is only as good as it's comprehensible, tangible ...and brought to life in a no-string, convincingly delightful, first-hand experience. 
And that's exactly what this project is all about. 
:-)

 Fun Factor     *     Team     *    Land    *    Guest Houses   *    Animals  *   Jobs   *   Road To Perdition  
*   FAQ






Creation of an organic farm & lodge at the Eastern Cape, South Africa
Sinking as much CO2 as possible as contribution to climate
          protection
Bamboo bio-char and therewith terra preta production plus collection of organic waste from supermarkets and restaurants to be turned into compost will help to do just that. Both at the same time providing organic furtilizer.

Keeping bees for honey, as pollinators and to help them survive as a species

Creation of organic clay buildings with off-grid reneable energy

Providing an enticing range of DIY courses, recreational and coaching offers 

Creation of permanent jobs plus volunteer opportunities via  WWOOF

Serving as information hub, multiplier and "trial site" for sustainable lifestyles for community members, volunteers, holiday makers - and anyone interested

The Khangela Concept does NOT involve profit maximization, surplus will be plowed back into improving the site or social projects, wherever sensible

Where will all this take place? Take a look at the map.

                                                                                                                   FAQ





What the team does? Working LONG hours  to make the Khangela Eco Lodge happen. With TONS of dedication. For NO pay at all. Which makes LOTS of sense. 

Doesn't it? ;-) 









If one wants to create something of stability, one needs to give it a feasible structure first. Of which the foundation has already been laid:






Company and office registration in South Africa










Opening bank and PayPal account in South Africa










Finding reliable estate agent, tax and business consultants











Finding a comitted Eco Architect in Cape Town, South Africa










Project planning (requirements, costs, suppliers, contacts, laws, tax)










Buying appropriate land in the Eastern Cape, South Africa 










Construction of sun and wind powered clay buildings











Creation of a water-retaining, self-sustaining, 
organic landscape











Aquisition of animals and bees as part of the 'gardening team' ;-)











Creation of jobs (which includes ecological housing and training)












Every project step is freely scalable and adjustable to any amount of backing. Will there be additional funding? Yes, which means, that the campaign 
funding sum does not fully reflect the sum available for the realisation of the project.  


Of course, with the pending steps, that's where your most valued support comes in. :-) Your backing will have an immense impact, e.g. on the size of land that can be secured against conventional 'development'.
= Done! / Erledigt!                       = In progress / noch ausstehend











Click for pretty extensive background information in English
and Deutsch.  Welcoming the first holiday makers is scheduled in September 2017.


We're sure: The stunningly beautiful Eastern Cape will take your breath away!
:-)What about the fun factor? Plenty plus. As you can see for yourself.

Garden Route, Eastern Cape,
South Africa ©Alexander Fiebrandt

antistatic
But be warned: You might need to defend your new bamboo baby against your jealous friends. They'll want it. And that's a pretty sure bet. ;-)





$100 (≈ €93)         



We will engrave your name on a plaque and mount it on a wall of the "Khangela! Eco Lodge". Your foresight and generosity will be remembered for generations to come. Maybe you will even come and visit one day? Right away, you will be given the appreciation you deserve on our "Wall Of Fame". 






Your coaching session with Anke Enders-Ngono, known from German TV and press. 

Difficulties in your work, private or love life? Stress reduces the capacity of our brain to solve problems - by dampening logic and memory in favour of its flight or attack functions. A short coaching intervention and a fresh outside view on things can make all the difference.  You need new perspectives and a fresh approach to pressing problems? Then these perks are absolutely made for you. Appointments can be arranged via E-mail right after chosing your perk. 
$60 (≈ €55)          



Difficulties in your work or private life? You need new perspectives? A fresh approach to pressing problems? Than this perk is for you.
1 online coaching session via Skype (full 60 minutes) with coach and project initiator Anke Enders-Ngono. You wish for a more extended support, e.g. a few weekly sessions? Just adjust the number of perks accordingly.You could use your online hour with Anke to address personal problems... or just to pelter her with any questions you can think of in relation to this project. ;-)


$220 (≈ €204)         




This perk will get you 5 couple therapy session (60 minutes each) in Anke Enders-Ngono's practice in Hamburg, Germany. There's trouble brewing in the intended paradise of your relationship? It's been going on for some time already? Or a depressing speechlessness has begun to settle in? Happiness and bliss clearly fall into the category  „Once upon a time...“? High time to stop waiting for wonders to happen, but to start making them.You will be supprised how rapid a turn for the better can be achieved. With a little help from a "paid friend" who knows just how.




Have a fantabulous holiday with your family and/or friends! Each clay guest house (click for pics) sleeps five people. And each perk is calculated to provide for all of them !
Tons of activities & adventures for every taste - on site and in the vicinity - are waiting for you and your loved ones.Occupancy: max. 5 persons per guest house, self-catering
Includes: 'pick your own' organic food for all 5 of you

Excludes: journey and transfer costs


Estimated Delivery: September 2017




$480 (≈ €445)         


A quick stop-over while your on holiday in the area? Taking an initial dosage of pure nature and wilderness? Just dipping a toe in the water of a delightfully different way of life? You and your 4 loved ones might want to start off with 3 overnight stays in one of the clay chalets at the Khangela! Eco Lodge. 



$800 (≈ €742)          



You can deal with a higher dosage of pristine nature? It’s right there for you. Relaxation and tranquillity or rather mixing in a chunk of action & adventure? Make it real! Spend 5 appetizing days and nights with your 4 most favourite folks  in one of the clay chalets at the Khangela! Eco Lodge. 

$1 200 (≈ €1 113)     



Family vacation? Adventure holiday among friends? DIY fun? Improving your relationship and love life? Campfire by the lakeside? Long cherished dreams do come true with 7 heavenly days and nights in one of the clay chalets at the Khangela! Eco Lodge. All of you 5 will love this, no doubt.



Special thanks to our supporters:

                                  




                                        



We in turn support the survival of honeybees and world wide water projects via:


                       





You would like to back us, but are going through tough times right now?
We've been there. Don't worry, walk tall - there's other ways to help!


More ways to contribute to the success of this project:

Use the "Share" Tools to enhance the visability and impact of the project.
Encourage your personal network to cast an eye on it and join in.
Spread the word to people with an active interest in environmental
protection.
And of course to those who haven't. Yet. ;-)
Tell people about it, who wish to spent some meaningful time abroad.
Visit us to help after construction has started (prior arrangement essential!) for some hands-on experience in clay building and water retention landscaping.
You've got questions? Tons of answers can already be found in our FAQ.


Check them out. Any questions left unanswered? You’re more than welcome! :-)
                  
www.khangela.vision / welcome(at)khangela.vision                




Fun Factor     *     Team
   *    Land
    *    Guest
Houses     *    Animals   
*    FAQ

story:
Purpose: Prove technology is effective in killing the bighead and jumping silver invasive carp.

Use of Funds: Expected funds if campaign is successful $75,000

  1. Fund commercial manufacture of formulations: ~$20,000 for 3 to 5 materials
  2. Testing on wild fish to determine toxicity to bighead and silver carp at University of Illinois, Illinois Natural History Survey: $50,000+
  3. Legal expenses: $20,000

If the proof of concept is successful, the plan is to partner with company familiar with the regulatory process.  Estimated regulatory process cost: $1 to $3 million.

Why: The economics of starting a formulation to control the Asian carp is not good.  This process allows for  my sweat equity with your and my donations to remove project risk. 

Why support my technology: The formulating concept is based on:

It is easy to kill fish, the hard part is getting the EPA to approve the product!

I am asking you to help me with the killing of the fish.

Status of program: Both Formulator and the University of Illinois are in verbal agreement implement the project.  A provisional patent is filled. Testing needs to be completed by the fall of 2014.

Hello, my name is Maurice Sadowsky.  I am an organic chemist who has sales and business development experience primarily with food ingredients.  For the last 1.5 years I have researched and conceived concepts to control the invasive bighead and silver Asian carp.  The formulations are:

  • Selective and Effective
  • Safer than current pesticides
  • Low cost

When commercial, the materials will help control these carp and:

  • Preserve our rivers’ and lakes’ environment
  • Maintain safe water recreation
  • Support our economy

Let me explain how.

Carp are not native to North America and imperil our water eco-system.  The bighead and silver carp are particularly worrisome since the fish:

  • Grow fast
  • Have a strong instinct to migrate
  • Have high reproductive rates

In 35 years, these carp are now established in almost the entire Mississippi river basin.  In the lower Illinois River, the fish represent 85+% of the fish population (2012).

                                  United States Geological Survey map, 2010

These filter feeding carp change the water ecology by:

  • Out competing native filter feeding fish
  • Depriving game fish of prey fish
  • Concentrating toxic blue green algae
  • Turning the water green.

Water recreation is threatened:

  • The game fish like bass and trout become vulnerable
  • A 20+ pound jumping silver carp will injure boaters

                      Photograph by Travis Heying with permission

Jobs are at risk!  The Chicago Area Water System (CAWS) is a major trade route between the Mississippi River and the Great Lakes.  Some organizations want to close the CAWS.  Low cost transportation like the CAWS, is key to a vibrant economy and jobs.

Since 2008, bi-partisan Congressional laws have funded $200 million to control the carp.  Some of the program successes include:

  • Understanding the carp biology and behavior
  • Developing and implementing effective barriers
  • Educating boaters and fishermen
  • Exploring new technologies

To control these fish multiple methods are needed including a new fish pesticide.  Rotenone, the approved pesticide, is non selective killing most if not all the fish and insects and in high enough concentrations will poison mammals, including humans.  To use rotenone the EPA requires the

  • Wearing protective body suites
  • Isolating the treatment area
  • Cleansing the water at the end of the procedure.

                                            Applying rotenone to a pond

Here is the value of my invention.  It will give Federal and State environmental agencies a needed tool to control the Asian carp population.  The technology works by taking advantage of the carp’s:
  • Ability to eat smaller particle than native filter feeding fish
  • Lack of a stomach
  • Their behavior

The formulations consist of:

  • Practiced industrial process
  • Vegetable fats as inert ingredients
  • Active ingredients that if not consumed by the fish, convert quickly and safely materials found in our rivers and lakes.  One of my formulations is 100% food grade materials.

By using commercial materials and processes, the formulation cost is very low.

I have shown bighead carp will eat the powder from the process.

A model formulation force feed to a bighead carp caused the animal to become lethargic and jaundice.  A second model formulation made the fish very lethargic and jaundice and caused fatal internal bleeding.

I filed a provisional patent on the technology.

Any material to control, harm or attract any living plant or animal must gain EPA approval, no matter how safe the material is.  The EPA’s pesticide program is long and expensive: 18+ months from filing and in excess of $1 million for consultants, testing and filing fees.

So to commercialize the formulation I need funds to:

  • Make the formulations and demonstrate their efficacy.  Meeting my minimum goal should fund this step.
  • To start the regulatory process, I need significant support, grossing at least $1 million.

I have spent over $10,000 in addition to countless hours on this project.  Your pledges are need to make, test and gain regulatory approval to achieve the effective, safer and low cost formulations to control the invasive Asian carp.

YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE!  I am asking you to “seize the day”, Carpe Diem™! and pledge to my project:

  • Preserve our rivers’ and lakes’ environment
  • Maintain safe water recreation
  • Save jobs

Carpe Diem™! Carp Die.  Thank you for your support.

Pledge rewards:  This is an important project for the Mississippi River basin's and Great Lakes' environment.  The whole project will require in excess of $1 million to commercialize: making, testing, approvals and initial production.  I follow Cooper's Stage Gate process to ensure the risks are minimized, the project is well defined and each step has goals.  My Linked-In profile should be open for all to read.  If you want to discuss this project please connect with me on Linked In.

The value to society of crowd-funding is to spread the risk in early stages of a new technology.  I have invested money and especially time to show the technology has promise.  Meeting my minimum should allow the manufacture of the formulations and scientifically test the materials at a University Extension.  Funds past the minimum will be used for the regulatory process.  Once the concept is proven, other sources of funding are available.  For the project to go forward, I need your donations. 

               NO SHIPMENTS OUTSIDE THE  UNITED STATES

story:
Destruction of our rainforests is one of the greatest environmental threats we face to our planet and to mankind. In the time it takes to read this presentation, an area larger than 20 football fields will have been destroyed. Over the past 40 years, close to 20 percent of the Amazon rainforest has been cut down—that’s more than in the previous 450 years. Deforestation accounts for about 17 percent of man-made emissions each year - more than all cars, airplanes, trains, and ships in the world put together There is a solution by leaving the rainforest intact and sustainably gathering it's many fruits and nuts, the rainforest has more value than if it was cut down. Rainforest land converted to cattle operations yields the landowner $60 per acre - If timber is harvested, the land is worth $400per acre - However, if medicinal plants, fruits and nuts are harvested, the land will yield the landowner $2,400 per acre!

This provides an income not only today but year after year – for generations. These sustainable resources – not the trees – are the true wealth of the rainforest.  If managed properly  the rainforest can provide the world's need for these natural resources on a perpetual basis. Using rainforest products could help stop the destruction, This can bring positive change while supporting the native people's economy. It’s a way we can all directly contribute to preserving the Amazon.

I'm working with a company in Brazil which have legal government contracts to wild harvest.  They are very dedicated to caring for the rainforest, employing and training the local people to gather the fruits and nuts with the least possible impact on the forest,  then cold pressing them preserving all their beneficial enzymes. giving truly  Raw Skincare.

If this method will work in the Amazon, there is no reason it can't be used to save many of the endangered rainforests of the world.

 Your skin is your largest organ, and often the most neglected, people watch what they eat but feel they can throw any amount of chemical concoctions on their skin and think it’s fine, never considering where it goes and what it’s doing to them, Looking after your skin is so important to your over all health -these products have been tested for thousands of years by the Amazonian natives, not just to put on their skin, but in their cooking as well, they’re edible. Would you eat everything that you put on your skin?

This is my range I’ve called it ‘One Earth’ raw skincare The name ‘one’ because in the main range of unrefined oils, butters and natural fragrances each bottle and jar will only contain the one ingredient—keeping it pure and simple. There’s also an extensive product range including white clay, soaps, this totally different concept called massaging candles, which because of their low melting point can be used as soon as they become liquid. The great thing is these products are absolutely amazing, they make your skin feel so fresh and soft, I’m blown away at how incredible they are.  They’re not just for your face, but for your nails, hair and body  as well. For the mature skin. the dreaded teenage skin, children, babies, men and everyone in between... I’ve teamed these up with this wonderful violet glassware from Switzerland which actually preserves and enhances its ingredients. 
The more these products get known the better it is for the rainforest, it’s a great way you can directly do something for the environment. You're not sending a donation to end up who knows where...you are purchasing the most incredible, raw skincare that you will fall in love with, as well as the extra bonus that every time you purchase a product you know it will be helping the natives of the area and also protecting the forest from clearing.

For more information on all these wonderful products, please see my website:

www.oneearthrawskincare.com

 

BUDGET BREAKDOWN

Importing the products $2600

Miron Glass Jars and Bottles $1400

Printing on the bottles and for promotions, labels $1550

Displays and stands $200

Marketing $750

 

WHAT ARE PLEDGES?

By pledging you are contributing directly towards the campaign and the more you pledge the bigger the reward - you get to try the products and feel your amazing skin.  By choosing the rewards it's basically like pre-purhasing the product

WHAT CAN I DO TO HELP?

If you can't help financially please share this with as many people as possible, I'd really appreciate it, and of course, make a pledge if you can.   Thank you

 

Thank you so very very much for taking the time to look at my campaign.  Have a great day :-)

 

 

(MANY THANKS TO THE WONDERFUL SONGS OF CALVIN HARRIS-  I NEED YOUR LOVE AND PASSENGER -LET HER GO)

story:
Illinois Trail Corps: Let's be trail builders!

Did you know that America's rails-to-trails movement started right here, in Illinois?

Volunteers built 19 miles of America's first rail-to-trail conversion, the Illinois Prairie Path, between 1966 and 1972—just six years!—with the resources they had on hand. Trail building is Illinois' legacy.

We’re Trails for Illinois and our purpose is to connect every Illinoisan to a trail experience within 10 minutes of where they live. We want your home to be your trailhead!

We have a great idea to make trail building and repair affordable for Illinois and its communities. It takes a page from the Illinois Prairie Path's legacy to create jobs and service opportunities while giving our state a do-it-yourself alternative for connecting and repairing our trails.

It's called Illinois Trail Corps. It leverages national young adult conservation programs and volunteer organizing to give communities a way to build trail with the funding and resources they have on hand. 

We have three ways you can help:

  1. Donate funding so we can buy tools and training
  2. Volunteer for work days with Illinois Trail Corps
  3. Equip Illinois Trail Corps directly—see the tool list at trailsforillinois.org

Get the Illinois Trail Corps Business Plan

We need to get back to trail building

We've got amazing trails in this state, but not enough money to keep them open and in good repair. And the federal funding we rely on to build our new trails was slashed in half in 2012—with more cuts likely to come.

These cuts come at EXACTLY the time Illinois communities want and need trails more than ever—to revive downtowns, attract new companies and families, and improve quality of life. 

Our answer: tear a page from Illinois' trail building past, when volunteers built the first 19 miles of the Illinois Prairie Path in just six years, 20 years before federal trail grants were even born. We're going to use that legacy to create a model that can build and repair trails anywhere in the state, using the resources Illinois and its communities have on hand.

It's called Illinois Trail Corps, a return to Illinois' do-it-yourself trail building roots. It leverages the power of a national youth service corps and the energy of volunteers to build and repair trail in Illinois. Think of it as “Habitat for Humanity” for trails.

In Summer 2014, we're piloting this model in the US Army Corps of Engineers’ Lake Shelbyville Recreation Area and adjacent Eagle Creek and Wolf Creek State Parks in Shelby County, about 1.5 hours south of Urbana-Champaign. In eight weeks, Illinois Trail Corps will repair, rebuild and extend nearly 27 miles of the area's hiking, biking and equestrian trails while creating JOBS for young adults who are serving their country, and demonstrating what a service-led model of trail building can do when deployed statewide.

Our job right now: Get Illinois Trail Corps equipped with the right tools and equipment for 2014 and beyond. That's where YOU come in!

More than tools...connection

Make a donation to help us buy tools and equipment for Illinois Trail Corps. You'll help us launch our pilot at Lake Shelbyville this summer. And when we show what our service-led model can do, other communities will turn to Illinois Trail Corps to build and repair trail next year, and more the year after that.

The tools you help us buy will keep on giving at trail projects around the state! It’s a great capital investment – a trail building toolkit.

For $13,500, Illinois Trail Corps will be fully equipped to take on Lake Shelbyville trails and more trail work in 2015. Shovels, wheelbarrows, Pulaskis—oh my! Plus a small pull-behind trailer to get tools to the job site. If we raise more, we can get the equipment and resources to deploy at multiple sites in 2015—a movement is begun!

And every time a tool is used, we'll think of you. We'd like to engrave the wood handles of our tools with your name or dedication. And put plaques on the metal machines. Then we’ll send you a picture of the tool you purchased, and the inscription. When an Illinois Trail Corps member puts a tool to work, he or she will put a name to the folks who believe in trail building in Illinois. 

If you opt for direct donation instead of a tool, we still want you to connect, with biking, with the outdoors, with the Lake Shelbyville area. Browse our great list of perks and connect.

Yes it's a trail, but it's more, too

If you know Trails for Illinois, then you know about our Triple Bottom Line – trails bring economic, environmental, and health & wellness benefits to the communities they serve. But the DIY nature of this trail project also provides jobs for young adults serving their country, and an opportunity for us to grow a community of volunteer trail builders. Building trails at less cost benefits communities—more trail gets built. More trails remain in good repair, so cyclists aren’t stranded on impassable trails. And our state gains a community of Trail Builders once again.

Besides $...how you can help

We’d also like you to spread the word. Let your friends know about this project – just use the convenient share tools to post our campaign on your Facebook wall or Twitter feed or send a link via email. We appreciate your help and support.

Thanks for reading!

It leverages national young adult conservation programs and volunteer organizing to give communities a way to build trail with the funding and resources they have on hand. We have three ways you can help:

Donate funding so we can buy tools and training

Volunteer for work days with Illinois Trail Corps
Equip Illinois Trail Corps directly—see the tool list at trailsforillinois.org
Get the Illinois Trail Corps Business PlanWe need to get back to trail buildingWe've got amazing trails in this state, but not enough money to keep them open and in good repair. And the federal funding we rely on to build our new trails was slashed in half in 2012—with more cuts likely to come.These cuts come at EXACTLY the time Illinois communities want and need trails more than ever—to revive downtowns, attract new companies and families, and improve quality of life. Our answer: tear a page from Illinois' trail building past, when volunteers built the first 19 miles of the Illinois Prairie Path in just six years, 20 years before federal trail grants were even born. We're going to use that legacy to create a model that can build and repair trails anywhere in the state, using the resources Illinois and its communities have on hand.It's called Illinois Trail Corps, a return to Illinois' do-it-yourself trail building roots. It leverages the
power of a national youth service corps and the energy of volunteers to build and repair trail in Illinois. Think of it as “Habitat for Humanity” for trails.
In Summer 2014, we're piloting this model in the US Army
Corps of Engineers’ Lake Shelbyville Recreation Area and adjacent Eagle
 Creek and Wolf Creek
 State Parks in Shelby County, about 1.5 hours south of Urbana-Champaign. In eight weeks, Illinois Trail Corps will repair, rebuild and extend nearly 27 miles of the area's hiking, biking and equestrian trails while creating JOBS for young adults who are serving their country, and demonstrating what a service-led model of trail building can do when deployed statewide.
Our job right now: Get Illinois Trail Corps equipped with the right tools and equipment for 2014 and beyond. That's where YOU come in!
More than tools...connection

Make a donation to help us buy tools and equipment for Illinois Trail Corps. You'll help us launch our pilot at Lake
 Shelbyville this summer. And when we show what our service-led model can do, other communities will turn to Illinois Trail Corps to build and repair trail next year, and more the year after that.
The tools you help us buy will keep on giving at trail projects around the state! It’s a great capital investment – a trail building toolkit.
For $13,500, Illinois Trail Corps will be fully equipped to take on Lake Shelbyville trails and more trail work in 2015. Shovels, wheelbarrows, Pulaskis—oh my! Plus a small pull-behind trailer to get tools to the job site. If we raise more, we can get the equipment and resources to deploy at multiple sites in 2015—a movement is begun!And every time a tool is used, we'll think of you. We'd like to engrave the wood handles of our
tools with your name or dedication. And put plaques on the metal machines. Then we’ll send you a picture of the tool you
purchased, and the inscription. When an Illinois Trail Corps member puts a tool to work, he or she will put a name to the folks who believe in trail building in Illinois.  
If you opt for direct donation instead of a tool, we still
want you to connect, with biking, with the outdoors, with the Lake
 Shelbyville area. Browse our great list of perks and connect. 
Yes it's a trail, but it's more, too
If you know Trails for Illinois,
then you know about our Triple Bottom Line – trails bring economic, environmental,
and health & wellness benefits to the communities they serve. But the DIY nature of this trail project also
provides jobs for young adults serving their country, and an opportunity for us to grow a community of volunteer trail builders. Building trails at less cost benefits
communities—more trail gets built. More trails remain in good repair, so
cyclists aren’t stranded on impassable trails. And our state gains a community of Trail Builders once again.
Besides $...how you can helpWe’d also like you to spread the word. Let your friends know about this project –
just use the convenient share tools to post our campaign on your Facebook wall
or Twitter feed or send a link via email. We appreciate your help and support.
Thanks for reading!

story:
You all made it possible for me to raise  $3110

I have just received confirmation that I am 1 of 30 IUCN Youth Professionals who have been invited to attend a pre-congress workshop in the Blue Mountains in Australia!

I am extremely excited to hear this news and will make my time in Australia even more valuable!

Thank you for helping me get this far!

Please continue to share and support me in my quest to  contribute and participate at this once a decade Congress this November in Sydney, Australia!


Hello! Bonjour! Hola!

My name is Sondra Eger and I am a graduate student at the University of Waterloo studying Geography and Environmental Management (see profile).  In November of this year, the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) will be holding the World Parks Congress in Sydney, Australia which will bring together global leaders on protected areas to share knowledge and innovation.  This congress only happens once every 10 years and directly relates to my master's thesis of "Perspectives on Coastal and Marine Management in Dominican Republic" (see summary below).

Both Marine and terrestrial protected areas are important to preserve ecological diversity and integrity, but also strive to protect the natural resources that provide human kind with crucial ecosystem services. These include clean water, food, raw materials, medicinal resources, natural capital (recreation and tourism), etc. Currently, many important natural resources are being depleted at alarming rates and parks and protected areas provide one was of conserving these diverse resources for future generations.

For more on the Importance of Protected Areas:  http://worldparkscongress.org/about/what_are_protected_areas.html

In order to attend this event, I need YOUR support.  I anticipate my travel and participation costs to be CAD $4000.  I have applied to volunteer at the conference to offset registration fees, however travel to Australia and unique field trip opportunities are costly.  I have explored some funding options through my home university and other WCP related positions to assist with these costs.


Every donation will receive an entry (or many) for a chance to win a Protected Area and Marine Conservation gift/prize to commemorate the WPC. Number of entries will vary with donation amount.

By supporting my attendance at this prestigious global event, not only will you be supporting my future in Natural Resource Management, but you will be contributing to the preservation of our world's ecosystems. Knowledge gained from this experience will be shared back at University Waterloo, Canada and incorporated into both my future projects and final thesis. This coming year I have a unique chance as the SWIGS Chair to connect students interested in PA and water resource management with relevant topics and contacts at the international level. Previous experiences with marine science and protected areas and have been in Africa, Canada and the Caribbean and I hope to continue  working both abroad and/or within the National Protected Area system for years to come.

Additionally, my recent experiences with Reef Check- Dominican Republic (http://reefcheckdr.org) and their co-management arrangement for La Caleta National Park has afforded me with unique insights into opportunities and limitations of Marine Park Management. I look forward to sharing these experiences and learning from other congress participants.

Donations

Please check out the various donation perks.  If you are able to donate to my cause I would greatly appreciate it and will ensure you receive the associated perk.  Even if you are unable to donate financially, sharing this page with friends via social media will help to raise awareness of the need for protected areas and would greatly help my cause.  

Every Donation will receive an entry (or many) for a chance to win a Protected Area and Marine Conservation Gift/prize to commemorate the WPC. Number of entries will vary with donation amount.

Donations will go directly to supporting costs incurred by attending the conference- flight, accommodation, meals, registration and in country transport.

Again, I have explored other funding opportunities such as through WCPA - Young Professionals, as well as applied to volunteer at the Congress to help cover registration fees.  Also, I have entered some of my photos in the WCP SAVED photo competition. Check out some entries here: www.wpcsaved.com 

I am also looking to stay at a friend of a friend's place to cut down on accommodation costs, and have applied to various opportunities that offer some funding relating to the WPC such as:

1. Canadian IUCN Youth Ambassador

2. Participation in the Climate Change Journeys  - Marine Systems / Large Scale Landscapes and Connectivity


Thank you for checking out my page and for considering to support me!


Sondra Eger

Please Share with others using Indigogo's SHARE TOOLS.


General Project Summary

Project Title: Perspectives on Coastal and Marine Management in Dominican Republic

The purpose of this research is to determine how the livelihoods of coastal communities in the Dominican Republic are likely to be affected by the expansion and further establishment of marine conservation initiatives, such as protected area (PA) networks.  These include the Convention of Biological Diversity (CBD), Caribbean Challenge Initiative (CCI), and the Caribbean Biological Corridor (CBC). Connectivity conservation initiatives are increasing in prevalence as a diverse array of benefits are continually being demonstrated through these models, such as marine protected area (MPA) networks. The benefits of these initiatives include, preserving biodiversity and ecosystem services, adapting to climate change impacts,allowing for long term protection of natural resources and threatened species, and supporting the transition into more resilient coastal communities.

The Dominican Republic is a biodiversity hotspot meaning it's extremely important to conserve the often threatened species in these regions. In order to efficiently secure marine natural resources for the future, the knowledge and concerns of coastal community members must be considered to ensure effective protection and regulation compliance. Therefore there are several other intentions of this research. Firstly, to examine the government frameworks in place and determine the degree to which they consider local resource users in the decision making process for natural resource management.  Secondly, to identify potential opportunities within social-ecological systems to reduce livelihood impacts from conservation efforts, such as the establishment of marine parks or protected areas. Lastly, to assess the perceptions on biodiversity conservation via connectivity initiatives that speak to the DR’s commitment to increasing ecosystem protection and acknowledging the value of MPA and PA networks.

By gaining insight on the interactions of marine resource stakeholders/users with coastal and marine conservation initiatives within the DR, I hope to achieve the following: document proposed methods for reducing the negative impacts associated with these efforts, determine potential alternatives to traditional subsistence fisheries, and identify possible opportunities that may lie in the tourism realm. An overarching goal is to attempt to further understand coastal ecosystems, assist in developing coastal areas responsibly while considering management implications local communities and conduct a multi-level stakeholder analysis for marine natural resource management. 

Coastal and marine based initiatives are important because these sectors are valuable to the social, economic and biological functions of many Caribbean islands, such as the Dominican Republic. These environments contribute to the foundation of the tourism industry, national GDP, livelihoods of the country’s inhabitants as well as the biodiversity of the region.


Please Share with others using Indigogo's SHARE TOOLS.
